title: Great location and experience for an NYC Weekend Trip!
text: Great experience at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. The location is perfect. The staff (particularly house keeping) goes above and beyond. There is a Starbucks across the street as well as a Walgreens across the street. The area surrounding the hotel is always packed with people but it felt safe.

title: Good, modern tower hotel a half block from the views, and noise, of Times Square.
text:
This tower hotel is a half-block from Times Square.  We stayed in a Times Square view suite.  The view was great, but even at the 48th floor there was substantial street noise--not as bad as other hotels we've stayed at in New York, but enough to keep us up late into the night from intermittent honking horns, revving cars and emergency vehicles.  The location was convenient to the subway, Broadway shows and local shopping, but in the future we'd probably stay further from Times Square.

The room was well appointed and clean, and housekeeping was responsive and thorough during our 5-night stay.   We did use the sofa bed - it was adequate but just barely so.

The lobby is minimalist but efficient.  Staff was friendly.  The gym on the 4th floor has a good mix of cardio and weights.  We used it twice and it was never more than 1/3 full.

title: Disappointing stay at Hyatt Centric Times Square, New York
text:
Unfortunately, the Hyatt Centric Time Square New York fell far short of my expectations, based off prior Hyatt experiences. Despite my efforts to arrange an early check-in, the initial experience with the hotel significantly impacted my stay, with a continued series of frustrating events.

Upon arrival at 5 AM, I was informed that the double queen room was occupied, despite later discovering it was actually vacant, and awaiting cleaning. Despite repeated inquiries about the status of the room, it remained unavailable until late in the afternoon. At 3:50pm I called and was told it still was not ready; once I was visibly upset, they told me it would be ready in minutes. 

Mr. Richie's abrasive and argumentative attitude towards my concerns only added to the unpleasant experience. Moving to a larger room on the second night seemed like a positive change, but it was quickly overshadowed by plumbing issues in the shower and the lack of proper maintenance response. The lack of communication and acknowledgment of the inconveniences by the hotel staff was disappointing.

Furthermore, the oversight in finding and returning a personal item left behind during the room change and the discovery of a non-functional phone in the new room highlighted a lack of attention to detail and guest satisfaction.

Amidst the series of disappointments and frustrations, Mr. Tomas repeatedly went above and beyond to genuinely address my challenges. His exceptional customer service and dedication to ensuring guest satisfaction showcased a level of care and professionalism that set him apart as a true asset to the hotel's staff. If his coworkers adopted just a few of his qualities, this hotel would never fall short of guest satisfaction with a long lasting impression of their stay. 

Last year, I had a superb stay at its sister location (Grayson) down the street. The differences in service and amenities provided by these two sister hotels were truly remarkable. I was warmly welcomed with early check-in and even offered a complimentary late check-out when I inquired about storing my luggage on the last day. The rooms had robes and slippers for the guests to use during their stay. It was quite disappointing, that I didn’t experience anything similar at the Centric Time Square

title: Very good location and nice rooms
text: Hotel very well located for visiting all areas of NYC, with many subway lines nearby. Spacious room with 2 large beds, bathroom with large shower, towels and hygiene products in abundance, coffee machine in the room. Room on the 20th floor with a downside regarding noise, soundproofing not effective against the noise of Times Square. A big downside also concerns the reception staff, none of whom were ever smiling throughout the stay, it's a real shame!

title: Best front desk hosts ever
text: This is my first review on TripAdvisor but I have to leave it for this hotel.  This is by far the best service we’ve received from any hotel (and we are originally from Vegas!).  The hotel front desk people Michael and Alana went above and beyond to make this trip smooth and comfortable, they felt like my friends!  Will come back again.  Great location, comfy room, and incredible service.  Highly recommend.

title: Very Pleasant service and Nice Hotel
text: Convenient to theaters, larger than average NYC hotel rooms, clean and well-appointed and all staff were very pleasant and helpful.  In town for a birthday trip for 2 nights to see a show and this was the perfect location.

title: Awesome Again
text:
We had the pleasure of recreating an overnight stay we had in 2019 and once again it was an amazing experience. Our view from the 48th floor was spectacular. We thoroughly enjoyed cocktails and sliders at Bar54 before retiring to our room at the end of a glorious night. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
Fantastic location as well, close to theater, Times Square and many restaurants

title: Great hotel with friendly, welcoming staff.
text:
I am not a fan of the craziness of Times Square but staying in the Hyatt Centric Times Square made this more than bearable.

The hotel was very clean and modern, and the staff were extremely helpful with any needs or requests we had. They helped us arrange transport to JFK in a large, comfortable car, for all 5 of us including lots of luggage. Nothing was too much trouble, and the whole team were very friendly, from the reception staff, doorman, housekeeping, and even kitchen staff who pointed us in the right direction when slightly lost using the lifts at first - different lifts service different floors and key card required to access. 

We had 2 rooms, one with a large king bed and the other had 2 queen beds. The rooms were spacious by New York standards, and lots of places for charging/plugs etc. The rooms were cleaned daily and bottled water and coffee machine replenished (even told we could have as much as we needed). There is a mini fridge in the room which was great for chilling water and milk for tea. There is a hairdryer provided and the shower was great with waterfall option. We did not have breakfast in the hotel.

The hotel has a roof top bar, however as we had an under 21 with us we did not visit the bar for drinks, but the hotel staff accompanied us up in the morning, before the bar opened, for a tour and some time looking out on the views of the New York skyline (and amazing Chrysler Building) so definitely worth a visit up to the 54th floor for that.
I would certainly return to this hotel and would recommend it to anybody wanting a comfortable stay in this busy part of the city.

title: Great experience
text: I loved that we unlimited bottles of water, coffee and the. We were 4 in a room and the space was perfect, beds very comfortable and always clean. The location is more than perfect and the staff was always willing to help

title: Filthy, broken and overpriced
text: Room was filthy, ice machine on our floor and was broken, hair dryer was broken, outlet in the bathroom had a short, beds had a comforter but no sheets and no blankets. When we called to request blankets, we were told the hotel was out of them, front desk wasn’t trained and took an hour to check us in, we were put in an Accessible Room without our consent bc they oversold reservations for regular rooms. I can’t imagine what’s happened to Hyatt that their hotels are in such disgusting conditions. The staff couldn’t care less.

title: Second Visit - Absolutely fantastic!
text: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square last year and had a fantastic time then - the hotel definitely did not disappoint the second time around.  The room and facilities were amazing - the view was out of this world - and the staff always go above and beyond.  The location is perfect and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.  We're looking forward to our next visit - we wouldn't stay anywhere else!

title: Excellent Hotel but be prepared for retention fee and daily service charge.
text:
Extremely impressed with the Hotel, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, the facilities and location.
Perfect stay to celebrate a big birthday and once in a lifetime experience.
Times Square literally round the corner and plenty of resteraunts and bars.

title: Great hotel and staff!
text:
Dede in the front desk and Rey at the T45 market provided exceptional service.  They made us feel at home.  This is a spring break stay and there were so much hotel guests.  Yet the customer service was on point.  I also loved the cleanliness of the room.  Free bottled water daily and they refill your coffee pods. We had a family of 4 and the 2 queens bedroom was perfect.  Enough space for everyone to move around. Best part of the room was the shower pressure (handheld one since theres also a rainshower head). It was so strong and it felt great to shower.  Housekeeping (Jane) did a great job cleaning our room!  Also, there's an amazing rooftop bar with great views of Chrysler building! 
Loved this place and will definitely book again in the future.

title: City break
text: Booked this hotel through British airways, a three day mini break to celebrate my daughter’s 30th birthday! It was a perfect location and met our needs and exceeded our expectations. Would definitely recommend and would stay again.

title: Family vacation
text: Great location. Safe and easy to access all of Times Square. Clean and well taken care of. Not too crowded with few rooms on each floor. Subway about 1000 feet. Train station 10 minute walk. Street area was clean and well lit.

title: Clean rooms, good location (if you want to stay in Times Square) but beware the elevators
text: I would have given this a better review but the elevator situation was so bad during my stay that can't rate it over 4 stars. At various times during our 5 day stay, elevators would take anywhere between 5 and 15 minutes to get to your floor. It'd get so bad that people would have to go up, in order to come down. The hotel and rooms themselves were pretty good. I was pleased with the service, and WoH benefits offered. Despite being right next to Times Square, I felt the room was quiet and I wasn't on one of the higher floors. I'd recommend it but only if they fix the elevators.

title: Friendly in NYC
text: This was our family's first big trip to NYC, and the staff here could not have been friendlier. They were great at greeting us with each entry to the hotel, the rooms were cleaned daily, and gave us as many water bottles as we wanted. In addition I stumped them with the request for a shower chair, I don't need a full ADA room, but I do have arthritis and a bad ankle injury that cause issues. At first they were unsure, but once a chair was located they quickly brought it to my room. They also helped me mail some cards and postcards and no request went unanswered.

title: The best hotel near Time's Square - Great staff and experience
text: The staff was wonderful and helpful. Hotel is clean and comfortable. You can't beat the location - Basically right in Time's Square. You can text with anything you need and they are very responsive. Very helpful with storing bags after checkout so you can explore before leaving for the airport. Overall a great experience - We have stayed here twice and will definitely stay again on the next trip.

title: 'Centric' is right
text: Our room on the 10th floor was impeccable, the staff bent over backwards for any additional request but the cherry on top was the courtesy water bottles.  Would only stay there every time we visit NYC.

title: Great times sq location
text: One night stay but amazing location . Room on 23 rd floor great views . Room was clean and comfortable. Very close to Times Square and close to theatres. Check in staff good and knowledgeable ,only slow point was waiting for the elevators . Would choose again

title: Clean and nice
text: Nice location, close to metro and lot´s of ok restaurants. Good service, very clean room, comfortable beds. Very clean and good gym with all machines you need. Try to get a room as high up in the hotel as possible - great view.

title: Spacious and nicely appointed. Highly recommend
text: Ideal location, big rooms with true queen beds x 2, large newly decorated bathrooms with rain shower and handheld shower head, comfy beds, quick elevators, clean rooms, fresh smelling air, friendly and helpful staff that anticipated our needs by giving us reusable bags to take home some boxes of croissants to our family. What more could you need? I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location, great service for the most part
text: Location is great. Room is excellent with no noise. We stayed 41st floor. Be mindful of rooms though first room was expensive with no views had to upgrade twice. Most representatives were helpful. Food and drink options at bar were limited but there are many options close by so not too much of a bother.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
Great hotel in a great location
Staff very knowledgeable and helpful
Would definitely return and recommend to friends and family
Everything you need with a few minutes walk
Although you are in the centre you didn’t hear any noise from the rooms

title: Stunning! Friendly! The best location!
text: Every staff there was so friendly, chatty and welcoming! The beverages and food were amazing in the coffee shop! Rooms were very very clean and the location was amazing!! Literally in the heart of Times Square, we hardly used to tube because everything was walking distance!

title: A great location for exploring the city
text:
This hotel is in a fantastic location for exploring New York City. Our room was on the 43rd floor and had a fantastic view of times square. All the staff we spoke to were very polite and helpful. 
The housekeeping team were great.
The shower in the room was good and the bed very comfy. 
We visited Bar 54 on our first night and the sliders were delicious! 
The views from up here are fantastic and its definitely worth taking a look.
Theres also a pub bext door to the hotel that is great for a couple of drinks. 
When we checked out the hotel helped us arrange a lift to the airport for a flat rate which was very helpful and saved us dragging our cases through the subway at rush hour in the rain. 
We will definitely be reccomending this hotel to our family and friends.

title: GREAT HOTEL!  THE WORSE MANAGEMENT STAFF! ALANA ! DANNY ! JONATHAN
text:
I have to start off by saying I have been staying at this hotel for over 5 years plus!  It was Ana still is one of the best hotels in Times Square. Back then management was top notch with GM Tomassi, he was always on top of the hotel and took care of the customers. 
Now there is new horrible supervisors or managers what ever you wanna call them. 
Alana, Jonathan and Danny are so incompetent and just have no customer service. I have been a globalist for over 5 years  till it ended in Feb.  and Alana had to make a point that I wasn’t a globalist anymore !  Like I care !  I’m still a paying customer.  Then she refused a certified service animal and then proceeded to ask what the condition  was for a service animal! Read the law Alana ! Then said you’re not allowed back to hotel with the service animal anymore! So you’re refusing a 4 lb service dog! Read the New York law Alana . 
Now had to go to next steps due to her lack of experience.  Jonathan who is suppose to be hotel manager hides and won’t return emails. 
So the hotel is great but managers sucks and rude . I will share emails on the refusal of a 4lb service  animal .

title: Love this hotel
text: We went for a weekend in February. Location is central to so many attractions. View was amazing. Staff was super friendly. Regardless who we talked to, they all seemed willing to make our stay a great experience.  This was by far the cleanest hotel I’ve stayed in.

title: Beautiful Hotel in Great Location
text: Booked this hotel for a three night stay with my daughter. It is tricky to find a room with two beds for a competitive price in NY, that is not closet sized. I was fortunate to book this early enough and received a decent CAA (AAA) discount. The room was beautiful, spacious, great bathroom, great bedding and very clean. Of course breakfast items in the downstairs coffee shop were pricey as to be expected. Staff however were very helpful and I was able to get an extra hour at check out. The hotel is right off of 7th in Times Square - couldn't ask for a better location, particularly since it was my daughter's first visit. The only disappointment for me was that when I inquired about staying an extra night it would have cost me over twice the nightly rate I had paid with my reservation. I feel that I got lucky with the rate I received and most likely this hotel would often be out of my budget. Otherwise - a great place!

title: 다음에도 이곳에서 숙박할겁니다.
text: 깨끗하고 모던한 시설과 친절한 직원들 덕분에 항상 편안히 머물다 갑니다. 무엇보다 타임스퀘어 바로 옆에 위치해 있어서 접근성도 좋고, 치안도 좋습니다.

title: Rude reception  staff
text:
This hotel is in a great location in NYC.
Rooms are comfortable  and clean.
We have travelled to many destinations  around the world and  when arriving at a hotel the reception  staff  should make you feel welcome.
Unfortunately  the reception  staff at the Hyatt centric were quite rude and unhelpful. 
Especially  one lady called Dede.
British Airways never informed us of the nightly destination  fee when booking  and we were never informed about this  when checking  in either. This hidden cost  of $35 a night should be made clear.
So it was a shock when we were checking out to get this bill.
Dede spoke to us with a very sarcastic rude tone on checking out as if we were stupid for not knowing!
Some  of the staff working at the reception  desk at this hotel need to be taught good customer service skills or find a different  job!

title: Excellent Hyatt Centric
text: An excellent hotel with great facilities and excellent staff. Really clean - house keeping second to none. The facilities are very good in the hotel. It has a beautiful bar with great views. There is a cafe/ little food shop on the ground floor. Coffee and tea were good there - great for a morning coffee and croissant.

title: Excellent Location, Lots of Room, Excellent Hotel
text: The room was large by NYC standards, very comfortable, clean and updated. The location was perfect - close to everything, but not too loud at night. My two daughters and I stayed here - we felt welcome and safe. The staff knew my name, provided a microwave upon request and extra blankets. A++ We will definitely stay here again when we come visit!

title: Another Amazing Stay at the Hyatt Centric
text: I am a tour operator and the Hyatt Centric Times Square is my favorite hotel for all my groups.  The location, excellent service, larger than average rooms with beautiful finishes makes every stay special.

title: Another perfect stay.
text: This was my 8th stay here and I can honestly say that I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. I travel every January to binge on theatre and I love how close everything is to the hotel. All staff is welcoming and lovely and remember me from year to year. As a solo traveler, I always feel safe and well looked after. The rooms are extremely comfortable and outside noise is nearly non-existent. 10/10  would recommend my "home away from home"

title: First visit to New York
text: This hotel was very good.Easy check in out and staff very attentive and professional.in an ideal location to times square not too noisy but easy enough to navigate and Broadway,Rockerfeller and Empire State Building. Would highly recommend.

title: Perfect location
text: This is a perfect spot to stay if you want to explore NYC.  In the heart of Time's Square, easy walk to dining, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, St. Patricks, Central Park.  Rooms were clean and spacious.  Housekeeping was in and out every day.  Lobby/valet staff was attentive and helpful.

title: Great family vacay
text:
Our room was big enough for a family of 4, had a nice view and comfortable beds. Situated very centrally, you could easily walk to several attractions. We were satisfied with this hotel.
Only downside was that rooftop-bar has age limits of 21. We´d have wanted to spend some evening there and watch the views.

title: Highly recommend.
text:
Just returned to the UK after a lovely 3 night stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. 
First time visiting NY with my two sons to celebrate my eldest turning 18. We were offered an upgrade upon arrival to an oversized room for $40 instead of $75 as it was my son’s birthday. Being as there were three of us in the one room, we took the offer. 
Room on the 41st floor was lovely and spacious, spotlessly clean and with a decent view of the city. Very quiet even thou it was just a stone’s throw away from Times Square. Room had everything we needed and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. They even delivered some balloons for my son’s birthday, which was a nice touch. 
The location is very central, literally a one minute walk from Times Square. 
Would highly recommend this hotel. 
Thank you for making our first visit to New York so comfortable and memorable. We will definitely stay again next time we visit.

title: My Favorite Hyatt in Manhattan
text: I love the Hyatt Centric on 45th street in NYC.  The rooms are very comfortable and clean and also well equipped.  I like the wireless charger. The view is spectacular (from the room and rooftop bar)  You can't beat the location.  It is my first choice whenever spending time in the City.

title: Excellent Location and Friendly/helpful staff
text: Wasnt sure what to expect but delighted with hotel overall and would definitely go  back.  Great location and quality of service.  Felt comfortable as staff were very friendly and helpful. Recommended for couples/families/friends and business travellers

title: Amazing experience
text: Our experience was one of the best we have felt. Super comfortable hospitality and amazing service! My kids enjoyed how comfortable the furniture was and how quiet the room was. Bar on room 54 was incredible with a nice view. Would definitely go again and would recommend for other families

title: Hyatt on Broadway
text: We have been coming to NYC for years to see shows, dine and shop.  The location of the Hyatt Centric is central to our visits.  What is most important is knowing that Hyatt will deliver consistently on quality, service and accommodations. It's a nice friendly place.

title: Great location and friendly staff.
text: Loved the location (half a block away from Times Square). The rooms and friendly reception. The breakfast was a big disappointment with poor service and limited menu. Dinner choices very also limited as the restaurant was out of stock for some entrees.

title: Excelente opción
text: Excelente atención al cliente buenas instalación y ubicación si te gusta la zona del tome square con mucha gente pero elevador es poco para mucha gente pero recalco la atención son muy amables es buena opción  instalaciones buenas y tranquilo a pesar de la zon

title: Convenient location, large rooms
text: I recently stayed several nights for a business trip and was pleasantly surprised by the large size of the room (compared to many NYC hotels). Appreciated the several free water bottles and mini-fridge. Everything was clean and comfortable. There is a handy small market / cafe on the ground floor for a quick and convenient breakfast or snacks. Although the hotel is just a couple of blocks from Times Square, the room was quiet.

title: Well located, clean and comfortable
text: The Hyatt Centric just off Times Square is a well located hotel, especially for this visiting New York on holiday. Clean and comfortable throughout. Not a huge selection of food or drink options with a rooftop bar and small food and drink shop in the lobby. Located within 5min walk of 42nd street subway. Well located for many theatres and midtown attractions.

title: Yenny for President!
text: Enjoyed my stay thoroughly can't wait to return. I've told several people about the location and your wonderful guest service member Yenny. Rooms were spacious for Times Square.  Best perk since I'm a coffee lover was the access to Starbucks across the street.

title: Excellent staff and hotel
text: Excellent hotel near all the central locations for NY.  This is one of the best hotel experiences in NYC.  From the front desk to the doorman - everyone exceeded my expectations, genuinely cared about my stay and were very helpful.

title: Not Your Average Times Square Hotel
text:
This was our 3rd stay at this property. Very friendly, easy check-in. As we're Globalists, we were offered an upgrade with a choice between two different rooms; we chose the Executive Suite, and we were very happy we did. It's a very well-appointed 2-room suite with partial views of Times Square.

We like several things about this property. It's 54 stories high, but each floor has only a few rooms on it. You're very close to Times Square, but you're not exposed to the noise or light pollution. Normally I shy away from hotels in this area, but this is the exception.

The only reason I gave a 4 instead of 5 is because we had to wait a substantial amount of time for our room to be cleaned. When I poked my head out the door, all I heard were 2 housekeepers talking loudly and the cart where it was a couple hours ago.

Other than that, this was another good visit.

title: Muy agradable
text:
Muy agradable. 
Nos atendieron muy bien, llegamos del aeropuerto antes de la hora de entrada y nos permitieron ingresar y usar la habitación sin costo extra y eso fue muy agradable. 
La ubicación es magnífica, cerca de times square, pero tranquilo, sin tanto ruido para descansar. El wifi funciona perfecto. 
Lo que no es muy bueno y por eso no le doy las 5 estrellas, la habitación es pequeña, bastante pequeña y en horas pick había que esperar mucho rato el ascensor y el desayuno estaba muy lleno, había que esperar mesa o sentarse junto con otras personas. 
Pero creo que precio/calidad, vale absolutamente la pena

title: Amazing views
text: We stayed on the 49th floor and had the most amazing view of the city! The wet room bathroom design was a nice surprise and great touch to make us feel more relaxed after a long day touring the city. The rooftop bar took the cake, nice server, strong drinks and amazing views. The staff was so helpful and I would definitely recommend!

title: Great place to stay!
text: We loved our stay at the Hyatt Centric!  Location was great.  Walkable to so many popular locations. All Staff we came in contact with were friendly and helpful.  Bar 54 was awesome.  Rooms were spacious for New York and comfortable.  We will definitely be back!

title: Excellent Stay!
text: Close to Times Square, a well-run bar (think: mixologists), and lots of transportation options nearby.  Lots to love about this hotel, including the small market and proximity to many Irish Pubs.  Will certainly return in the future.

title: Hyatt Centric is a must stay!
text: I recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay steps away from Times Square, but not directly on the strip.  I was able to see the lights from my window; however, I could not hear all of the noise and bustle from Times Square.  It was peaceful and safe at the hotel.  The staff was very attentive.  My room was a great size and cleaned daily.  The beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was modern.  I would absolutely stay at this hotel again!

title: Just "right"
text: As a business traveler, I dont want simplicity and comfort and responsiveness at a value.  I had not been to Manhattan before.  I got lucky and just picked this.  I have to travel here quite frequently and will come back to this location.  Great view, value, staff, comfort  LOCATION!!! .  I was shocked i got this much value and a reasonable price.

title: Really nice stay
text: Customer service great.. everyone very nice and accommodating, Globalist status honored and got upgraded to a very nice suite! The club on the 54th fl was very cozy with nice views and on the pricey side. 2 sliders were $20.00 but were excellent. I liked the breakfast delivery to the room. The food was good, plentiful and was delivered quickly.. only negative was the coffee, which was really aweful. The other negative was the location of my room on the 6th floor facing 45th St. No veiw and super noisy with the traffic, trash trucks etc. Hotel is in a great location for tourists though.. mins. From Times Square and Broadway shows. I’d stay again but ask for a quieter room.

title: Excellent Stay Experience
text:
The hotel was a wonderful experience.  I will definitely return for our next conference visit to New York!!  I loved the location!  The staff were so very pleasantly accommodating...on every shift.  I left early for a conference and returned late back to the hotel.  The professionalism of the staff was consistent.  Great hotel!!

Dani (Detroit, MI)

title: Loved this hotel
text: i stayed an extra night in NYC after the NRF conference this hotel was amazing! I loved the location, the room was clean and the cost was pretty good as well. I definitely will stay again in the future.

title: This my new go to Hotel in Times Square
text: This is my second time staying at the Hyatt Centric in Times Square and both stays have been perfect, which is saying a lot in NYC. I love the location and the fact that this is a smaller hotel and very easy to navigate! We left our room for the theatre and arrived in 4 minutes. What sets this hotel apart is the staff. They are on the ball and take great care to insure the safety and security of guests and I really appreciate that especially when I am traveling alone with my children. The rooms are super clean and quiet and the staff is friendly which makes me right at home. I like that the housekeeping staff is particularly friendly and works to accommodate our schedule. The meals we had for breakfast were really good, much better than your typical hotel fare. Check-in and check-out were super smooth. Overall, just a really great place to stay.

title: Outstanding
text:
We have stayed here on a couple of occasions, and staff are always helpful. Lovely clean rooms with underfloor heating in the bathroom.

In a great location, if you want to be right in the middle of Times Square.
Food at the onside cafe is fresh and tasty.

 Will definitely return.

The

title: Great location. Only basic services.
text:
We were able to walk everywhere! No traffic jams for shopping, theatre and restaurants.  The rooms are modern and spiffy clean.

Brown bag breakfast and lack of evening towel service reminded me of Covid cutbacks.  If you like full service you’ll be disappointed .

title: Enjoyed my stay!
text: Great experience staying at this Hyatt location Times Square. Close to Times Square, however, being on a side street helps with minimal street traffic. Broadway is steps away.This will be in my list of go-to hotels when I stay in NYC

title: Hotel in the Heart of Times Square
text: We stayed here for 1 quick night this past weekend. Location is 1/2 block from the heart of Times Square. Had 2 rooms (at my company’s discounted rate) on the 41st floor so luckily we were high enough that we didn’t hear any noise from the street below. Room was updated & clean. One room was even ready when we checked in at 11am. Tried Bar 54 with our daughter. Pricey. Pretty though. No complaints with the hotel & would stay here again.

title: Long weekend after New Year
text: Excellent room, clean, superb location. Right in Times square walking distance to Broadway Theatres. Helpful friendly professional staff.  The bed and pillows were exceptional for a hotel. Room was great, view was ok

title: Rooftop bar& Spacious room
text: Very clean and spacious. Great rooftop bar!!! Repeat customer!checkin was easy and the doorman helped us with a ride to the airport. He had a gentleman waiting in a black suburban who got us to the terminal in a timely manner.

title: Hôtel très bien placé
text: L’hôtel est très bien placé pour une première visite à 3mn du métro avec tout à proximité la vue des étages supérieurs est incroyable. Les spectacles de Broadway à proximité à 100m de la célèbre place Times Square. Chambre petite mais très propre.

title: Best Customer Service Hotel in NYC
text: If you want an extremely clean, updated hotel with the best customer service, run do not walk, to the Hyatt Centric. Location is amazing,  just steps from Broadway,  in the heart of the theater district & near many great restaurants.

title: This Hotel is amazing
text: Really enjoyed our stay.  The Rooftop Bar is amazing, and the Gym was excellent too.  So close to everything!  Very close to Times Square and great Restaurants such a really good Irish bar and Restaurant next door.

title: Did not meet expectations
text:
Pros - Great location for tourists, nice sized room and beds (paid a fortune), valet service
Cons - Terrible breakfast for a 4-star hotel (just to-go options), inadequate room amenities, barely any space in the front to park temporarily to unload luggage from car

title: Great location for family vacation. Safe and clean
text: Family trip to see all things Christmas. Fabulous location - so close to Times Square. Pharmacy across the street for anything you need. Safe - they check if you have a room key before you can get to the elevators especially at night. Comfortable beds and phenomenal housekeeping staff. Amy kept our room beautiful and offered great tips for us on our trip. She even practiced some phrases with our son who is learning Chinese in school. She was a highlight of the trip! We will definitely stay here again. Convenient. Clean. Comfortable.

title: great location
text: perfect location for city walk. associates were friendly. once you walk out the building, make a right turn, you are at times square already. i was staying at 14th floor so I was hearing the police and all kind of traffic noise until 3pm.. But no complain because I chose this location.

title: Best location
text:
Located minutes away from the centre of Time Square, it is super convenient to visit Broadway theatres!! 

Rooms are fresh and clean!! Very quiet in rooms and feels safe. We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent location
text:
Execellent location, few steps to Times Square and short walk to Empire State Building.
Room and bath size above average, housekeeping did a great job. Comfy beds, overall a great experience.
Recommended for short stays

title: Disappointed
text: Found several hair on sheets when turned bedding back. We were promised $100 credit on our bill which we never received. We were very disappointed with the city view that we paid extra for. Expected more for amount we paid. Nothing special about the room.

title: Great stay!!
text: The hotel was great!! I’m a hotel snob and they didn’t disappoint!! Location was great. Right in the action but tucked away to enjoy some peace as well. Staff was attentive and pleasant. Very quick elevators

title: Great Stay
text: Great location. We were able to easily walk to Times Square, Rockefeller, 5th Avenue, and Central Park (30 minute walk). Starbucks was immediately across the street for an early morning coffee run and there is also a market in the hotel with basic food and drink options. Staff were kind and helpful. Rooms were simple, comfortable, and very clean. Comfy bed & pillows. Complimentary waters in room each time they serviced it. No complaints.

title: Do not stay
text: When I made the reservation months in advance I was promised rooms side by side or on the same floor I called 2 times after that and before the trip to confirm and each time spoke to the front desk and they all said the same thing yes you will and cannot wait to see you when you arrive!! The morning before we left NC to go to NY I called again at 5am and spoke to a gentleman tom and he said yes one room is ready and the other two on the same floor will be ready by the time we her there!! Well that didn’t happen we arrived at 3 when check in and no rooms were ready and no they didn’t see anything about being on the same floor!! After waiting hours for one room then another couple for the others that were on different floors it was a joke!! I asked for Tom that I spoke to in the morning and the rude staff said he is the manager and hasn’t been in the office in a few days!! So I was just like ok

title: Not impressed
text: Noisy room (AC and staircase). Woken up every hour during the night. Tried to talk to the reception about the situation - met with no understanding at all. Hotel looking kind of outdated.  Not recommend

title: Pésima, catastrófica y estafadores
text:
Horrible experiencia. Al llegar al hotel nos dijeron que la habitación estaba cancelada y al asegurarles que estaba todo correcto, no miraban por nuestra identificación. Nada amables, prepotentes en recepción y cuando confirmaron que estaba correcto nos dijeron que nos  darían una estándar, cuando teníamos pagada una suite executive. Cuando todo se aclaró, nos pidieron 500€ en tarjeta, aún estando todo pagado, al final nos cobraron 200€ por las tasas. Una vergüenza todo.
La habitación (suite executive) no estaba preparada, la cama supletoria sin hacer. Las sábanas olían a humedad. Habitación no muy limpia. Baño pequeño y sin apenas accesorios. Tuvimos que comprar un gel para la semana porque solo había un tubo pequeño, insuficiente.
Lo peor el desayuno, es un autoservicio, sin platos y cubiertos de madera, los camareros maleducados, prepotentes y chulos, una vergüenza. Sólo entraban 20 dólares por persona y en NY con ese precio sólo tienes para un café y un croissant. Al hacer el check-out nos cobraron 45€ de más por el último desayuno,que, por supuesto, ya estaba pagado, se lo dijimos y nos dijeron que se habían equivocado, pero aún no nos han devuelto el dinero. No volveremos jamás y ya le hemos dicho a nuestra agencia que, por favor, no lo recomiende. UNA  ESTAFA!!!
Lo único bueno, la ubicación, para nada es un 4 estrellas.  Hace años estuvimos en el Hotel RIU y se corresponde con un 4 estrellas en todos los sentidos.

title: Fantastic
text: I don’t think I’ve stayed in a lovelier hotel in a major city! Roomy for manhattan, spotless, comfortable beds, amazing bar on the 54th floor, and just off Times Square. The staff seemed genuinely helpful and friendly. Perfect for us!

title: Pleasant Stay
text:
Tried the hotel for the very first time. Will readily come back because of the pleasant experience. 

The first encounter took place on the sidewalk. We were dropped off slightly off the hotel entrance. As we were struggling with the luggages, the doorman approached us very courteously and offered help. Most importantly, without expecting anything in return. This is so unlike NY! 

Likes:
1. Attentive staff.
2. Prime location.
3. Nice property.

Dislikes:
1. None.

title: Nice but there are better
text: Nice hotel, nothing special, beds we ok, view was nice.   I have traveled professionally and personally for over 30 years and have status at Marriott and more recently Hyatt.  The two program can’t compare, Marriott takes care of their customers. When I checked in I asked if an upgrade was available, they said sure, for $170 I can give u this room, for $$$ I can give u that room.  I was insulted

title: Horrible Experience at the hotel
text:
At check-in, I was given incorrect room keys, forcing me to trek up and down to three different floors before gaining access to the right one. Upon entering, I discovered a broken hand shower and trash bin, hindering basic use of the bathroom. To top it off, the room and bathroom lights repeatedly plunged me into complete darkness for several minutes, requiring multiple attempts to switch them back on.

I reported these issues to the hotel managers but the unpleasant experience unfortunately continued. The unauthorized entry by the hotel attendant to deliver unsolicited dental supplies was a particularly disconcerting incident that further marred my stay. After checkout I got an email from lost/found for some other room. Clearly its a mis-managed hotel so I will not recommened to stay there.

title: Central location at Times Square
text: We stayed at Hyatt Centric as this was the first time we had visited NYC with our young kids. The location worked out great as it was in the middle of all the action. Very close to subway stations and walking distance to watch Aladdin on Broadway. We had rain for a couple of days and the staff was great in letting us borrow umbrellas as well. Special shout out to Dede, she was super helpful in getting us checked in. Although our room wasn’t ready yet as we had arrived early in the morning, she was able to find us a suite that would work for our family and notified us when the room was ready as we explored the city.

title: Home Away From Hone
text: I highly recommend this NYC hotel.  The doorman always greeted us as though he knew us when we returned from our adventures each day.  Housekeeping was superb! And the front desk answered all our questions in a kind and prompt manner.

title: Great location, great staff and hotel.
text: It was 5 out of 5!  Clean room, great staff, quiet hotel room. Staff were very prompt to my request and professional! Just loved the way they treated me as a guest.  Convenient location!  Walking distance to many great places!!  Despite it is in Times Square area, one block away from it so noise wasn’t concern at all!

title: Great hotel--cheap mattresses
text: We liked the hotel and location, but the thin/cheap mattresses made it unlikely we'll return.  Staff was very friendly, housekeeping was great.  They're so close to having a really great-go-to hotel, but they followed the trend of bad beds as a way to cut costs.

title: Great location
text: We had a wonderful time in NYC and having the location of this hotel made it even better.  So close to many things and great views.  Beds were good, very modern, but pillows were flat.  Would stay here again.

title: Quiet seclusion.
text: Quiet seclusion. Lovely clean room; friendly housekeeper, Evelyn was very thorough. It was nice to receive her greeting as we left for the day. No restaurant here but nice small rooftop bar with excellent food offerings- we tried empanadas and sliders.

title: Holiday Girlfriends’ Trip
text: We were very pleased with the attentiveness of the staff, hotel ambience, cleanliness and location. Conveniently located one-half block from Times Square and broadway shows. Hotel safety was important. Staff stood by elevators to ensure anyone entering was a hotel guest. We will definitely stay at this location again.

title: Good highrise views, but poor room condition for price
text: Our 2nd stay in 2 years.  This year we found out the room was not ready until 8pm and when we did get finally get to our room we found the floors sticky with sugary-sticky coffee spills throughout the room. We further found a previous guests cheesecake in the mini fridge. There was less than 1/2 roll of toilet paper in the roll with no spare rolls and we had to send for more. The bedside pull out table drawer literally broke off of the rolling hinges and landed on my foot and was unrepaired during our stay. For the 53rd floor at $1300/night we should have at least found a sparkling clean room!

title: Excellent location, great rooms, staff almost all helpful
text:
The location was perfect, 30 seconds from Times Square. We got a room upgrade as I contacted the hotel and told them we were celebrating 2 special birthdays, they also put balloons and a card in the room which was a lovely touch.
The room was extremely clean and comfortable with a great side view of Times Square.
Reception staff were all helpful except one who was a little rude. There is no restaurant but a small cafe/ shop in the lobby which was nice but expensive. There is a coffee machine and bottled water in the room which is great, but be prepared for the $40 a night resort charge on top at the end of your stay. The lobby is small with only a couple of chairs so not comfortable if you have a long wait after checking out, we were also allowed an extra hour for checking out on request which was appreciated. 
Overall excellent hotel and staff I would stay again x

title: Outstanding hotel
text: This hotel is amazing! Perfect location just off Times Square and close to most main tourists attractions like Broadway, Rockefeller tree and Central Park. Hotel is extremely clean and felt like a safe haven after exploring the city every day. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Rooftop bar lovely. Outdoor area open again and we were allowed to go out for a look. Can’t recommend this hotel enough.

title: Tomas was great
text: We had a good trip but Tomas at the front desk made it better than we expected. He really went above and beyond . We also enjoyed the lounge on the top floor. Good snacks and drinks. Beautiful view of the city.

title: 21st Birthday Celebration
text: Fantastic time at the Hyatt Centric Times Square celebrating daughters 21st birthday. It was our first trip to New York and it was amazing! Central location but no noise from Times Square - would definitely stay again at this hotel

title: Windows full service
text: My family is fast trip in New York thanks a lot  I like coming my next trip to your hotel you guys have a great service and good staff my room service  she is a magic she helps a lot I stay at 5day fill like home  thank you so much have a great weekend

title: NYTime Square
text: Great location to experience Time Square, Rockefeller Center, and surrounding popular spots all on foot.  A 10 minute ride share from Penn Station.   The hotel was secure, clean and very accommodating and has a lovely bar on the 54 floor.  A very comfortable stay.  The food options at the hotel were limited but good.

title: Great stay and that heated bathroom floor
text:
Stayed one night at Hyatt Centric on Thanksgiving Eve to watch the parade the next morning. Check in was easy (used the app and phone to open the door, which worked every time!) The room was perfect. Could use some USB outlets but no biggy. The bathroom had heated floors which was a delight. Room was ready early and I was able to get 2pm check out (I am an Explorist.)

Being a block from Times Square, the sounds from the street were loud until about midnight (I presume this is when they closed the streets for the parade.) I was on a lower floor (8th) and a sound machine or Airpods would have been helpful but I was able to fall asleep at a decent hour regardless (had to be up at 6am for the parade!)

There was a snafu with the valet upon check out, which resulted from a poor decision made by the parking garage. The hotel manager, Alana, immediately attended to the situation and tried to resolve the issue. Her efforts to make the situation right is deeply appreciated. The way the front desk, management and concierge showed their concern made me feel confident in the team and staff at this property. I am looking forward to returning soon with a few lessons learned. :)

title: Perfect Location
text: The hotel was clean and convenient. Would definitely recommend this hotel. It was within walking distance of everything we were interested in, Bryant park, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller center, Times Square.

title: Great location and hotel
text: We stayed here for Thanksgiving- the Macy’s parade was only steps away from the hotel. Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park are an easy close walk. The hotel is in good condition and the staff were very nice.

title: Great stay at Hyatt
text: Michelle at the front desk was great, extremely helpful and super friendly. A real asset to Hyatt team. Both myself and my partner were very pleased with Michelle's hospitality!! Lovely stay and would definitely visit again

title: Times Square Hotel, Where Serenity Meets Urban Energy.
text:
Just checked into the Hyatt on 45th St., time square. the first room I got was on the 36th floor - lovely view , but I definitely did not need two queen size beds all to myself! The room is quite big for New York City 460sf ! 
But I tried my luck and I'm now on the 24th floor with a cozy suite . The living room area and the bedroom are just perfect, and the shower combination is huge  ! Big shoutout to Elisabeth, the front desk manager, for the excellent service. I will definitely be coming back to this hotel when I return to New York. My only complaint is the  Construction work in the front of the hotel building. Still, overall a great experience! 😊 #Hyatt #NYChotels #Greatservice #Roomwithaview

title: Perfect Place to Stay in Midtown
text: Convenient location.  To the west: Times Square & Broadway.  To the east: shopping on Fifth Avenue.  Very clean.  Helpful and cheerful staff.  Comfortable rooms.  Have stayed at this property dozens of times.

title: Weekend getaway
text: Enjoyed every minute at the Hyatt. There are many options in Time Square and I appreciate a company that put people first. I have enjoy Hyatt for many years, but the Hyatt Centric is on another level. Every time I am in New York I will probably be at B54 or enjoying enjoy the easy access to Time Square and all the shops on Madison and 5th Avenue while staying at Hyatt Centric. Thank you Jonathan and Alana.

title: Hyatt à la dérive
text:
Chambre pas insonorisée, bruit infernal de la climatisation. Personnel désagréable et pas du tout accueillant. Aucun effort pour la communication et les renseignements. Petit déjeuner très cher et pas à la hauteur...
Hôtel très décevant pour le prix !

title: Great location in NYC
text: Given my experience with the small size of NYC hotels I was a little bit worried about having sufficient room for 4 women, but this hotel was Great!  Plenty of space within the room and 2 closets.  The bathroom was very spacious.  Our only (small) complaint is that the switches for the lights in the room were odd - only one switch to turn off all lights and it was on the wall side of one bed.  We were out of the room most of the time but probably could have figured it out if we'd worked on it harder.  One block of off Times Square and easy walk to multiple subway stations.  Highly recommend Hyatt Centric Times Square.

title: Good experience but Front desk won’t accept AmEx benefits
text: We booked through AmEx travel which was $300 more than Expedia. Got none of the benefits. No upgrade, No late checkout, Aggravation by front desk wanting to charge $50/hr for late checkout as we had 75 old who needed to stay in the room.

title: Luxury has a location and it's here in Time Square, NYC
text: Luxury has a location, and it's here in Time Square, NYC.  I was thrilled with the treatment, service, and experience I encountered during my stay.  The rooms were elegant and super clean, and the service was top-notch.

title: Great Stay ! ++
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. The rooms were impeccably clean and modern, and the staff was exceptionally friendly. The hotel's prime location made it convenient to explore the city's attractions, though some noise was expected due to its bustling surroundings. Despite ongoing lobby construction, the overall experience was positive, and I would gladly stay there again. Additionally, the hotel's flexibility in allowing us an early check-in enhanced our overall experience, demonstrating a commitment to accommodating guests' needs. This added convenience further contributed to the positive impression during our stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square.

title: Very nice; close to, but not in the middle of Times Square
text: The staff are friendly and helpful; room was clean and comfortable. The location is great and within walking distance to Times Square and lots of good restaurants. Not far from other attractions. I would stay here again.

title: Pas digne d’un Hyatt
text: Incompétent et froid voici ce qui caractérise cet hôtel. Pour un Hyatt c’est juste incompréhensible que les réceptionnistes ne réservent pas de restaurant pour leurs clients. Pr ailleurs, la femme de chambre a embarqué 2 doudous de notre fils, on attend toujours qu’ils nous les retrouvent !! Lorsqu’on a signalé leur disparition, la personne de la réception n’a pas semblé s’en préoccuper. Il a fallu qu’on monte le ton pour qu’une responsable daigne s’en occuper. Et nos batteries de téléphone ont disparus également. Tellement antipathique qu’on n’a même ps signalé cette disparition. Le petit dej est hors de prix et  le choix est restreint.  Aucune empathie.

title: ❤️ Hyatt Centric on Times Square
text: Stayed here for the marathon weekend. I was very happy with the location, the rooms and the friendliness of staff. Albeit on Times Square my room was relatively quiet and I slept well. Staff did their best to accommodate our every need- even giving us microwaves for our carb dinners. I will make this my go-to hotel when in NY.

title: A fuir …
text: Nous avions réservé un type de chambre en étage élevé et nous avons eu un autre type de chambre en étage inférieur et on a tenté de nous faire croire que c’était équivalent ! Cela s’appelle du vol . Le bruit de la rue est incessant et l’insonorisation catastrophique. Les chambres sont sommaires sans grand intérêt. Le rapport qualité prix est très mauvais et le personnel est à peine aimable … bref à fuir !!

title: Un hôtel très bien situé
text: J'ai apprécié cet hôtel idéalement situé sur Times Square. Très bonne literie et bonne insonorisation des chambres. Le seul bémol c'est que pour les petites déjeuner il n'est possible de les prendre que dans la chambre ou dans leur "market". Ce n'est pas du tout convivial et pratique. Nous étions en famille à 4 dans une chambre familiale et nous ne pouvions pas tous être assis en même temps. Très bon accueil à l'arrivée puis à la fin de Diana qui a fait de son mieux pour tout nous expliquer avec le sourire.

title: Your close to everything
text: Great Location, good base to explore NYC. Close to the subway and Broadway. Lots of traffic noise at night but hey you are in the middle of a major city. Lots of things to do within walking distance, some great places to eat

title: Great quick trip
text: we arrived at the Hyatt centric for a short stay to see the rock ‘n’ roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony. The staff greeted us quickly when we arrived and was very helpful throughout our stay. At check-in, I needed to change our room as my daughter decided last minute to join me on the trip, and they were super accommodating. At check out they were able to hold our bags for a little while while we did some extra sightseeing and had breakfast nearby. The room was clean up-to-date and had plenty of space. This hotel is very close to Times Square although there wasn’t any trouble sleeping as it seem to have some sound dampening. I would recommend this hotel and this location.

title: Ótima opção de hospedagem em Nova York
text: O hotel é muito bem localizado ao lado da Times Square e com tudo, mas tudo mesmo bem próximo de lojas, restaurante e teatros. Dá para ir a pé as lojas da Disney, M&M, HardRock, Museu, farmácias, e diversas opções de restaurantes e lanchonetes.

title: Very good stay with only a few issues
text:
Housekeeping was flawless - the room was always serviced properly and the housekeeper remembered preferences from day to day.

Location is great - so close to Times Square and the theaters. The Museum of Broadway is next door. Starbucks is almost across the street.

Check-in and check-out was easy. I noticed lines at other times but my timing must have been lucky.

Had a room on the 10th floor with a view facing out the back of the hotel towards 46th Street. There are only 11 or 12 rooms per floor so not a lot of noise from the neighbors. Elevators were prompt. The hotel had issues with the TV system the first morning - no channel guide or Chromecast available. They did get it fixed by the evening. 

Picking up food/beverages in T45, connected to the lobby, was easy. The only room service is for breakfast and the prices are very high. Oatmeal, banana and coffee was $24 plus tax plus 18% gratuity. They wanted an extra $6 plus tax plus tip for berries. Food is delivered in a bag in disposable containers. Best bet is to go to T45 where prices are much lower (but still high - this is NYC!). Salads, baked goods, sandwiches, etc. were very good at T45. Plenty of tables in the back or you can ask for the food to go. Charging to your room is permitted.

One night, went to the rooftop bar. Had a reservation and was quickly seated. Their specialty cocktails start at $24 and bar food is available. Two drinks, two sliders, and two empanadas resulted in a bill (with tip) of $108. Outdoor terrace was closed, supposedly for renovations even though there was no apparent construction. Nice views, even from within the lounge. 

I used Curb or Uber to preorder cars. Curb cabs consistently arrive 15 minutes before the time I requested. This was an easy way to ensure I had a cab/car when needed.

When returning to NYC, I would have no concerns about returning to the Hyatt Centric.

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square fab hotel
text: The best location and exceptional hotel in NYC. Staff were friendly especially the housekeepers. They were super friendly and worked diligently to ensure rooms were cleaned to the ultimate standards. We had a room overlooking the Paramount building which was chargeable but worth it for bringing the buzz of NYC into your view. Loved it!

title: Excelent choice
text: Nice hotel in perfect location, clean in room with good room service. Missing the free breakfast, but its not broke down our assesment. I fully recomend stay in this hotel to anyone with high expectatuon to clean room & good level of service.

title: An All-Star Experience
text: The Hyatt Centric was the perfect place to stay for my trip to NYC. The staff was friendly, the rooms were impeccable, the cost was great (especially since it's right in the middle of Times Square), and it was close to many NY attractions. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend to others!

title: Not worth it. Slow, poor & curt service. Bad bedding. Have to pay for early check in / late check out.
text:
It's just day 1 out of 5 here & it's been a bad experience from the start.
We moved here for 5 nights this afternoon, from Homewood Suites Hilton, as we extended our stay in NYC & that was fully booked. We asked for an upgrade from a double queen room and were sold a deluxe room at $70/night which seemed fair. While my husband was speaking to the front desk executive, my friend & I were standing next to him, by default positioned in front of the desk next to her. Another executive came & stood at that desk & literally gestured rudely with her hands, indicating we move. I couldn't believe they have such brash staff at their front desk. Her attitude showed you can work at a 5 star and still lack class. Note that there was no one behind waiting to be assisted! Regarding our check in: It was 2.15 pm & we wanted to freshen up & get somewhere. We grabbed lunch & returned at 3.30 only to be told we'll have to wait to get the room, as check in time is 4 pm. So don't arrive even half an hour early unless you've paid for it! Finally we got the room key by 3.50 pm, but our bags took 20-25 mins to arrive. Another friend is joining us tomorrow around 1 pm, and we have a second room booked. But as we asked for an early check in, we were given the "pay for it" story.
The in-room situation: the duvets aren't duvets but a thin sheet placed inside a duvet cover. We asked for a proper blanket - Each time, it took several attempts for someone to answer the "guest services" call. Finally a dirty one arrived after 3 calls & 45 minutes. 
The room situation: Some of the pillows have been slept in for so long,  they've gone flat. There's a closet that doesn't close even if you put a medium sized suitcase in it. And I don't want to get started on the electric situation! Operating the lights in this room is more complicated than operating an aircraft simulator. I haven't tried the shower yet. All in all, terrible service & I wish I could've stayed back at the Homewood Suites Hilton. Honestly, for a 5 star & for the money we paid, the least you expect is half decent service, good bedding & someone to answer your call if you need someting at night.  Won't recommend staying here, there are far better options around here at a lower cost.

title: Can't imagine a better hotel on Times Square for the money
text: A very pleasant experience in one of the oversized rooms. Service was outstanding, from front desk to housekeeping. We had everything we needed for a long weekend. The bedding and pillows are top-notch. The hotel stored our luggage for several hours after checkout, no problem. Each time we needed something in our room, a staff person was there within minutes. I've never experienced this kind of responsiveness in many years of hotel stays.

title: Centrally located, nice facility
text: This was a nice hotel and a great location.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and spacious with nice decor.  The gym has lots of new equipment and was very clean.  They have good security as well.

title: Nice stay
text: Hotel needs a place in the lobby where people can hang out with friends which is feature of many other hotels nearby. If you are meeting a friend, you need to walk to a restaurant since there is no place to hang out. The bar on the roof top is very small and can't accommodate many people. Otherwise, the staff and the location make this hotel a nice place to stay in NYC.

title: Great location! Times Square and centered around most everything you want to get to in New York City.
text:
Nice lobby, excellent front desk, housecleaning and room services. Asked for amenities and got them quickly. Had a standard King. Not spacious but functional. Nice view though. Bathroom is extremely cramped and strange that you have a full size window right next to the toilet. Never seen that before. Kind of weird. Really nice rain shower. The light switches are kind of strange in the room. We never got a handle on them but there's a control all switch button next to the bed. The entire electronic setup in the room needs a modern update. Only one USB charger on the desk. Very early 2000s technology.

All in all, nice hotel. I'm a big fan of Hyatt. Except for some quirks around the room needing modernization I recommend staying here if you're going to be in New York.

title: Great location, clean and quiet.
text: Overall a good hotel. It's expensive and there really aren't any extras but the staff was friendly and we felt very safe. My main complaint is that the housekeeper cleaned our room even though we had the do not disturb sign on and she swooped up my son's beloved stuffed animal with the linens. The manager assured me that they were trying to get it back, but I sensed it was just lip service. The housekeeper apologized profusely, but the front desk staff was pretty indifferent to the seriousness of the situation. Anyone with young kids knows that losing a favorite stuffy is a big deal. It definitely soured our trip a bit.

title: Ask for female staff
text: Female staff members knew what to do, were polite, and cared about each customer.  Male staff members didn’t know what to do, brushed us off with rooms weren’t ready, and did not help with what we asked for.

title: Convenient location & nice place to stay
text: The rooms were clean, quiet and more spacious than some of the others we stayed in while in NYC.  The staff was very courteous and helpfule and the location is very convenient to Times Square & the subway. We had a room with a king size bed & handicap accessible/walk-in shower.  The only odd thing was there was no drawer space.  T

title: Great Location; Not so great staff
text:
This is a great location, and thankfully the windows are soundproof (a HUGE plus when staying in Times Square). Rooms are small, and amenities are a bit sparse. 

Unfortunately, the big negative was the hotel staff were flat-out rude. For example, I had to wait on hold for over 10 minutes for someone to answer the phone when calling the front desk. Once the phone was answered, the individual was flat-out rude (even though I was being friendly) and interrupted me mid-sentence when I was asking about a late check-out.

title: Great hotel. Not so sure about the paper bag!
text: This is a great hotel. Clean comfortable and lovely rooms. My only niggle is that breakfast is served to the room in brown paper bags....not my preferred method of breakfast when I am on a trip.  The other comment is that there are 50+ floors so if you soon;t like heights ask for a low floor!

title: Amazing location
text: The hotel is located steps from Time Square but the room was quiet, well sonic isolation. The check in was seamless, fast. Valet parking was $90/day that was very reasonable rate considering the location. The room was spacious, clean, modern, internet was fast. Bathroom impressively spacious. We had room service for breakfast, a bit pricy but fast and reasonably good. it was brought in a bag so not very fancy. The location could not be better, we walked everywhere, came back from a Broadway show, changed the attire and walked out the street. Bar 54 was unimpressive and expensive. The Irish pub right next to the hotel was much better and half the price. Many options for breakfast. I would probably not order room service again if it would not for the kids.

title: Great location!
text: This hotel gets 5 stars for location and staff! The staff from check in to housekeeping were very attentive! If you’re looking for a central Time square location you can’t go wrong with this location. Rooms needs a bit more storage. Strong shower pressure!

title: 매우 쾌적한 호텔
text: 맨해튼 중심부에 이 정도 넓이의 객실이 매우 깨끗하고 시설이 좋았습니다. 직원들도 친절하여 소통의 어려움을 극복할 수 있게 해 주었지요. 일주일 동안 편안하게 지냈습니다.

title: Great experience in NYC
text: The Hotel is located between Broadway and 6th Avenue, very close to several points, with easy access to the subway. The hotel staff was very kind and attentive during our stay. We definitely recommend the Hyatt Centro Times Square.

title: Great central hotel with wonderful views...
text: Stayed at this hotel and everything was perfect, very central and steps from the subway, lovely check in from Percy at reception, after a long flight from the United Kingdom, and a wonderful view of times Square. wow.. thank you to all your lovely staff

title: Great Hotel for Families - Queen Beds!
text:
Had a really great stay here at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. It was difficult to find NYC hotels with Queen beds, but we found a great deal here and were happy it was so centrally located.  

The room was well-sized for our family of 4 (kids ages 13 and 10).  The bathroom was a really nice size and had a great shower with good pressure.  We were on the 10th Floor, and were surprised at how quiet the room was being right off Times Square.  It was well-appointed and the beds were very comfortable and clean.  Air-conditioning worked very well for a warm week in October.  There is an in-room safe and small fridge.  Not a lot of drawer space, but the closet was big.

Hotel was clean, front desk was courteous and helpful, and I liked that they checked for room cards in the evening before accessing the elevators.  Elevators were fast, even though only 2 went to our floor.  Lobby was clean.  The gym was a good size, and we had some good snacks from the lobby cafe.  We got free water bottles every day which was a nice perk.

Location is great from the perspective that you’re near an exciting part of town and can pickup almost any subway line with a few minutes walk.  It did take longer to get here via taxi from the airport because of traffic, but wasn’t terrible.

Can definitely recommend for families and got a great value for our dollar.

title: Great location and spacious rooms
text: Our room was inviting, clean and spacious.  The bed was comfortable and there was minimal noise. Even though we were in close proximity to Times Square we still got a peaceful night’s sleep.  Drybar blow dryer was great!!

title: Wonderful hotel in a perfect location!
text: Just an awesome stay for my husband's birthday! Everyone was super-friendly, especially front desk clerk Yenny and housekeeper Jenny G. We were celebrating my husband's birthday and had asked for a higher floor, which we were able to get. The room is wonderful and the bathroom is fantastic - such awesome water pressure. Very spacious and light room. Also, we were able to check in early, which was wonderful as we were soaked from the flooding in NYC last Friday. The location of this hotel is wonderful and I honestly will be wanting to stay here for every future NYC trip!!

title: As always stellar service and attentive
text: Second time staying here and as always, super helpful and attentive staff. Water kettle and slippers upon request were brought up swiftly. Location is central and close to subways. The only complaint is the noise from Times Sq but that's to be somewhat expected...

title: Best in town!
text: This place is number 1 in Manhattan. Near everything you want to see and more. My first time in New York and this staff is like family. From the guys @ the door to the people working check in.  Sean, Byron, Yousef, Tommy, Mike, and so many more. Even the security is very friendly and on top of safety. Favorite of all was James as he was training and worked diligently to learn and be helpful. I'll definitely be back and it's worth every penny.

title: Amazing staff saved the day!
text: The Hyatt Centic Times Square saved the day when The Millennium Hotel (across from the Hyatt) canceled my reservation 3 days prior to our booked date for a reservation I had made10 months ago because the credit card I had booked with had gotten compromised and so the credit card number changed.  The Millennium Hotel notified me via email while I was on a cruise ship in the middle of the Atlantic, the email had the name of the employee in the by-line not the hotel name, no phone call or email asking for a different credit card. This could have been a nightmare of New York vacation with no place to stay and pouring down rain but the excellent staff at the Hyatt Centic went above and beyond for senior citizens that weren't even Hyatt members (at that time).  They were FABULOUS!!! Hyatt  Centic A+++++, The Millennium Hotel F !!!!!

title: Excellent Location in NY near Time Sqaure and close by main atractions
text: The hotel is located in a walking distance to all key attractions in NY mainly Times Square and the rooms are modern and overall service is great . This is my 2nd stay in 3xmonths and will come again for sure

title: Great hotel in Theatre District!
text: This was a perfect hotel for a weekend in NYC.   Everything we wanted (great restaurants, theatres, Times Square) were in walking distance. Hotel was very clean and had everything we needed. Staff was friendly and helpful

title: Great hotel, central location and superb staff
text: Our second stay in this hotel having previously stayed with our children back in 2016. We chose to come back based on location, price range and the good experience we had previously and we were not disappointed. Room was really nice, check in really smooth and staff very attentive throughout. If you are looking for mid-range in NYC definitely consider this hotel.

title: Fantastic Place to Stay in NYC!!
text: My family of 4 with 2 children (9 & 10) came for a long weekend to visit family, see a show, visit the Statue of Liberty and the American Museum of Natural History. The hotel was a great location to walk to the show, Times Square and tons of good shops & restaurants. The room was HUGE for NYC and was more than comfortable for all 4 of us. The bathroom was clean, spacious and nicely decorated. The staff was super helpful and friendly and, despite being so close to Times Square, it was quiet at night and we were able to get good nights rest the whole time we stayed. Highly recommend and will definitely come stay again.

title: Excellent Location Amazing Staff
text:
This was my 4th time Visiting New York and have to say that the Hyatt Centric Times Square is the best place I have stayed in the city. 
The location is fantastic with Times Square right at the bottom of the street. You can also walk to a number of different New York favourites from here. 
The hotel was very modern, clean and comfortable. All the staff are very professional, friendly, helpful and made us feel welcome during our stay. Especially Richie who checked us in. He even reallocated our rooms as he said the rooms that we had been assigned did not have a view. As it was my Nephew’s first time he gave us a room with a view. This was a really nice touch and when we seen the rooms and the views we really appreciate this. 
Every time we went to reception he was always there to help and if he wasn’t there the staff who were on shift were just as nice as him. 
Will definitely stay here again.

title: Great Hotel
text: The location was perfect for us, just around the corner from Times Square, loved the buzz around that area especially in the evenings! The room was spacious and clean. Housekeeping were super friendly and efficient, always greeted us in the mornings. The only few things that stop me from giving 5 stars was that I had asked in advance for a possible upgrade as we were celebrating our honeymoon and we didn't get an upgrade nor was it even acknowledged that it was a special occasion for us. Reception staff were pleasant but not particularly friendly, we weren't even asked on departure if we enjoyed our stay etc. but she was kind to store our bags for us, also the 'resort fee' is a complete money scam, over 300 euro for the 8 days on top of we we already paid. I would advise to skip breakfast here, its only a $20 credit, the coffee for over $5 is horrible and the options for food are very limited and expensive, also staff working at breakfast were unfriendly. There was a great coffee shop across the road that I went to most mornings instead and a place for food a few doors up from the hotel. Overall we enjoyed our experience and would certainly stay here again, I just feel a few small things could be improved to give it 5 stars.

title: Charged $1,500 for Suite - felt like dirt cheap hotel
text: Room service food? Served in plastic take out boxes - Waited 7 minutes for the elevator - ridiculous - at $500 for a suite it might be ok but $1,500 ridiculous - everything felt like I was in a cheap hotel that tried to charge me $10 here, an extra here - not a hotel I was paying a hefty price for a room

title: Wi-Fi never worked
text: The Wi-Fi never worked for my laptop, even after 30 minutes on the phone with the hotel's tech support. She checked a few things and said I just have to keep trying. I stayed only one night and my entire stay I had no Wi-Fi.

title: ok to stay in
text: hotel was beautiful but there is one agent that check in named Michael that treated us bad didn't want to be bothered to help us and turned us away .I had to go back a 2nd time and show him again i had a reservation and confirmation email . Honestly the hotel was good and the person who checked me out named Eva was wonderful . The welcoming was bad experience because of the customer service check in agent Michael and for that i wont ever go there again.

title: Such a brilliant time
text: Now back home to the uk after a superb 7 night stay, the location was excellent right by Times Square and the metro which took us straight to flushing meadow for the tennis, also only 20 minutes walk to Maddison square garden where we saw The Eagles in concert, an added bonus to our trip! Our room was on the 50th floor so super views of the city. The breakfast was really good with lots of choices and as for the staff all were so friendly so nice , especially Dyana on reception who was just lovely. We will be back!!!!

title: Horrible
text: Increíble que al hacer el checking me ofrecieron update con un sobre coste de 150 $ diario y que el hotel no tiene room Service, no tiene breakfast apenas un mercado para comprar café y croissant, housekeeping todas las mañanas molestando a las 08:30 para limpiar la habitación y eso que tenía una suite supuestamente

title: Great Location, located best
text:
We made a 5 days New York trip. On the schedule were musicals, museums MET and MOMA, good restaurants and shopping.
The hotel is new and offers a very nice breakfast bar/shop and a credit cool rooftop bar. The rooms are clean - book a room in an upper floor with view on Times Square. Stunning!
All theatres, Central Park, shops are to reach in walking distance. A tip for a closed by good restaurant: “ Sicily”.
Rooms are clean, spacious, good gym. Dedicated and service oriented staff.

title: Do NOT stay here
text: Do NOT stay here. The room is not refreshed and it's almost 4:30 pm. The housekeeping manager Joe is saying they won't send anyone to clean the room while I am in the room. The housekeeper might not feel comfortable. First time in my life to hear that the hotel guests would make hotel employees uncomfortable...This is probably the worst Hyatt property I have stayed in terms of service. Hotel has good location so they probably don't need to care about the customer experience. You have to call over and over again for basic things like housekeeping and yet still no delivery...

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
text: Very well located hotel.  Near Times Square but not enough to suffer the noise and crowds.  Good service.  Rooftop, breakfast room with good service.  Front desk and housekeeping staff always polite and willing to help.

title: A model of consistency in an inconsistent city.
text:
This was my fourth stay here, and many more will come.  I stay in a lot of hotels for work and leisure both.  I stick to the big 3: Hyatt, Marriott, Hilton.  This property is my favorite in the city.  Yes, that includes the Park Hyatt and the Andaz 5th avenue.  This one has what the other two don't have: guest service.  Don't get me wrong.  I love the Park and the Andaz in their own ways.  But the management here at the Centric has it all figured out.  Communication here is great.  Do you want a high quality and a sanely sized room smack in the middle of Times square with a swift, no-nonsense breakfast and management that actually cares?  This is it, period.  I have yet to have a bad stay, here.  They treat Hyatt elite members very well here.  The security is top notch.  

I love that this property focuses on the things that matter.  I don't need a sit down dinner restaurant at a hotel in New York, anyway.  Please stay here.  It's a real gem.

title: Issues unresolved
text:
The hotel itself is is clean and spacious. The air condition in our room was noisy and we were not able to use this at night. The rooftop bar was closed for renovations and no one advised us of this. No information given to us on check in and discount codes as part of tourist fee did not work. We arranged a car to take us to the airport which changed the fee after I had paid it and the hotel have failed to reply to emails so I am left with a gradual at payment and no contact.
