Overall the hotel was nice, nothing special and in my opinion overpriced considering the issues we had.

title: best stay in Times Square
text: Can't go wrong at the Hyatt Centric.  Great staff, excellent service, updated and clean rooms.  BEst location only a few blocks from Times Square. You have to try the breakfast bagel sandwich fromt T45 market. Valet parking is a must in Manhattan.

title: comodità assicurata
text: hotel in posizione strategica per girare tutta new york, sopra times square. avevamo una camera con vista città ed era  compresa di tutti i comfort, spaziosa e molto pulita, con cambio di lenzuola e asciugamani giornaliero. nonostante la posizione per sua naturalezza sia caotica la stanza era ben insonorizzata. letto molto comodo e doccia spaziosa. l’unica pecca è la colazione non inclusa e il market al suo interno è molto caro per ciò che offre. consigliato.

title: Magnifico hotel
text: He estado alguna vez en Nueva York y este hotel me ha parecido estupendo. Para un viaje familiar las habitaciones son las más grandes que he visto en Manhattan. La limpieza de la habitación brillante y la atención del personal de recepción fue sobresaliente

title: NYC Hotel
text:
Everything was great except breakfast prices through the roof. Very convenient to theatres and a couple of restaurants we visited. Rooms were first class. Room service superb. Cleaners straightened out the room and gave us clean towels everyday. Rain shower was great for showering.
Front desk very helpful.

title: Vacaciones
text: Hotel céntrico con vistas a Time Square muy bonitas, limpio, camas amplias (se puede dormir en una habitación 2 adultos y 2 adolestentes), cómodo para moverse a las actividades en Manhattan, hay nevera y te facilitan agua todos los días, tienes cafetera de cápsulas para hacerte café en la habitación y un starbucks enfrente.

title: Nice Hotel
text: The location is perfect, the rooms are very clean.  The staff is also very helpful.  We enyoyed our stay very much. They did us the favor of making us check out late because our flight left at midnight.  Would definitely return.

title: Excellent All Round
text: Superb all round hotel. Staff, cleaners, room, cafe / shop were all excellent. The location is perfect for a central NY trip. Good value as well for such a central hotel. The room was plenty big enough for our family of 4 sharing two beds - our boys are 12 and 14. Definitely recommend and definitely will stay again.

title: Hotel muy bien ubicado
text: El hotel me gustó me sentí segura, la habitacion muy limpia y el persona que me atendió muy amables, el precio es algo alto, pero vale la ubicación e intalaciones lo valen. Un poco ruidoso de noche, pero si es posible conciliar el sueño.

title: Great Staff
text: Staff was great, friendly and helpful for our entire say.  All departments did an outstanding job.  A little to close to time square for us but that just our preference.  If you're looking for close this is it.

title: Stay Elsewhere
text: The customer service and World of Hyatt members need to get their act together. I had an incident happen at a previous location and when arrived at the location was expected to pay both nights. There was a huge lack of communication between hotels and world of Hyatt. I will never be staying at a Hyatt location again.

title: Hotel Hyatt un nome e una garanzia
text: Hotel molto centrale, pulito ed accogliente. Personale gentile e disponibile. Pulizia tutti i giorni e anche cambio asciugamani. Letto king favoloso. Abbiamo trascorso un soggiorno bellissimo. Unica pecca la colazione non inclusa, ma si ha comunque la possibilità di fare colazione al mini market all’interno dell’hotel.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text: It's a great hotel, with excellent service , on a fantastic location with a great view. If you come to New York for the first time and you want to get around town and quickly find your way. This is the hotel to pick. You get to all the places you want on a short distance as a vacation visitor. If you come for Broadway, it's literally around the corner!

title: Excellent choice for NYC short stay
text: The Hyatt Centric is well positioned for visiting the key tourist sites in NYC. The room was well apportioned, comfortable beds, good shower and bath. Housekeeping kept it spotless throughout our stay. There is a lack of restaurants but then we knew that before we booked. The T45 market was good quality, a little pricey but it is New York! Bar 54 has a great view - the outside was being refurbished when we were there but that happens. Cocktails were lovely but again pricey! Overall an excellent choice for us.

title: Great stay at Hyatt Centric Times sq
text: Friendly staff, great location . Neat rooms . Staff were very obliging and heeded to our requests with true sincerity. The food was great. The top floor pub was great. Would love to stay there during our next visit

title: Very rude support staff
text: The support staff at the front desk was very rude and not willing to share any details about the hotel. Ended up not providing the correct room ( connected room for which we were charged 80$ ecr)we requested. And provided wrong information about parking as well which cost us $$$$

title: 予約内容と事実が異なる可能性あり
text: Agoda経由で「朝食を含む」とあったので、6泊の予約をしたが、チェックインしてみると、「朝食の予約はないっていない」と言われ、「Agoda経由の予約では、同様のことが時々起こる」として、一切の対応や埋め合わせも取ってもらえなかった。2人×6泊分の朝食代を考えたら、他のよりグレードの高いホテルに予約できていた。

title: Modernes City Hotel ohne viel Infrastruktur
text: Die Buchung lief absolut problemlos über die Hyatt-Seite. Der Check-in lief auch problemlos und effizient ab. Das Hotel ist relativ neu und die Zimmer sind sehr sauber und modern. Im Zimmer ist ein kleiner Kühlschrank vorhanden, welchen wir sehr praktisch fanden und immer gefüllt hatten (Einkaufsmöglichkeiten gibt es 24 Stunden direkt auf der anderen Strassenseite oder vormittags im Market in der Lobby). Das Badezimmer war auch sehr schön, modern und sauber. Die Zimmer sind freundlich und hell gestaltet. Die Qualität der Betten war auch sehr gut und wir haben sehr gut geschlafen. Wir hatten ein Zimmer zur Stadtseite gebucht, da es dort nicht so laut ist. Das Hotel verfügt über eine Bar in der obersten (54.) Etage, aber leider war die Dachterrasse während unseres Aufenthalts geschlossen. Die Bar darf erst ab einem Alter von 21 Jahren besucht werden. Das Hotel hat ein 24 Stunden geöffnetes Gym welches wir mehrmals genutzt haben. Es ist gut klimatisiert, praktisch eingerichtet und es liegen ausreichend Handtücher aus. Ich würde aber empfehlen, sich selber Getränke mitzubringen, da das dort angebotene Wasser aus der Leitung kommt und leicht nach Chlor riecht bzw. schmeckt. Ich fand das Gym zweckmäßig, aber zu dunkel und somit wenig motivierend. Das Hotel verfügt leider über keine Restaurants, keinen Pool und keinen 24 Stunden Roomservice. Das ist aber überhaupt kein Problem, da es genügend Restaurants in der Umgebung gibt und man rund um die Uhr über Uber etwas liefern lassen kann. Ich finde, das Hotel ist ideal gelegen. Es ist 200 Meter vom Times Square entfernt gelegen und man kann viele Sehenswürdigkeiten zu Fuß erreichen. Die U-Bahn ist ebenfalls gleich in der Nähe. Ich werde dieses Hotel bei meinem nächsten New-York-Aufenthalt wieder buchen und kann es nur empfehlen, wenn man die Stadt erkunden möchte. Wir haben einen late Checkout gebucht und konnten ganz bequem und effizient online auschecken.

title: 清潔で家族旅行にも適するホテル
text: タイムズスクエアのすぐそばに立地し、ロウアー／アッパーマンハッタンいずれもアクセスが良い。コネクテッドルームのリクエストにご対応頂きました。

title: Great stay! Very clean, great location, great staff!
text: Great place to stay, spotless room, very warm and welcoming staff. We stayed with kids and were always comfortable and felt safe. Worst thing I can say is, bring your own pillow, they need to replace theirs.

title: Excellent hotel
text: The staff were so friendly and accommodating. The hotel was immaculate and our room was lovely overlooking Times Square. We had one incident one evening with the alarm going off but the staff did apologise. We would definitely come and stay again at this hotel.

title: Yes! Best hotel in NYC I’ve stayed in!
text: This hotel was amazing and had so many extra amenities! The special light switches, the drybar hairdryer, streaming radio and chromecast in the rooms. The beds were spacious and comfortable. I intentionally chose this hotel because the rooms were easily 350 square feet which was important for my family of four. The wifi was the best hotel wifi I’ve ever experienced in my many years of travel. I would definitely return here again.

title: Excelente ubicación junto a Times Square y habitaciones limpias.
text: Hotel muy limpio y con excelente ubicación junto a Times Square. Personal muy agradable y profesional. Nuestra habitación era amplia con camas doble y el baño muy grande. El desayuno en la tienda de la entrada del hotel era un poco caro. Nosotros repetiremos.

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square
text: I would definitely stay here again.  Very convenient location.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  There is a market in the lobby that is great for breakfast and coffee and so easy since it's on property.  Bathroom and room were good sized and very clean.

title: Great location and comfy beds
text: Fantastic location in the heart of Manhattan. We were a family of 4 with 2 teens. The room was a good size with comfy beds and a great shower. Housekeeping kept us stocked up with coffee pods, bottled water and toiletries. It was very clean and well kept. We were on the 8th floor and had a view but only of roofs so not that interesting. Grab and go breakfast was ok and we used it 3 times. Could do with a bit more choice on the hot food. Room was quiet for sleeping apart from the humming of the air con whether it was on or not. Would stay here again.

title: Perfect location. Great service. Exceeded my expectations
text: This property is a hidden gem. Although located just a half a block off of Times Square, it’s surprisingly quiet and just far enough away from the crowds and chaos that is Times Square. The rooms were modern and stylish, surprisingly large for New York City, and the bathrooms were decent sized and elegantly appointed. And the staff were all very personable and provided outstanding service. I generally got the impression that they enjoyed working at this hotel and or pleased of being of service to the customers. The lobby is a bit underwhelming, but it served its purpose. And because of the quaint size of lobby, the elevators are conveniently located just steps from the front door of the building. The hotel is 54 stories tall, and has incredible views from the top floor Bar 54 lounge. And because we were traveling with our kids, it was great to know that this hotel had an option of two queen beds, rather than double beds, which was the primary reason we selected this hotel, as the majority of NYC hotels do not offer 2 queen beds. We had a fabulous stay and I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent place to stay!
text: The Hyatt Centric was a wonderful place to stay in NYC! In the heart of the theater district, only 3 blocks from Bryant Park and the library. We were able to walk to Fifth Avenue and Starbucks was right across the street. The room was clean. The bathroom was sparkling and the bed was very comfortable! Would absolutely stay there again when I return to NYC!

title: Excellent
text: Clean, great staff, awesome location. Would 100% stay again. Can’t go wrong with this site. Close to everything. Cleaning staff was very very attentive and made you feel like family. View was also perfect.

title: Great Stay of Hyatt Centric Times Square
text: We brought our 3 grandkids to NYC to visit family.  They upgraded our room to the 51st floor so the kids could experience the excitement/lights of NYC.  They loved it.  The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable.  The staff was so friendly and helpful.  Perfect location in Times Square.  We enjoyed our stay so much we are going back the end of September with our granddaughter.  Thank you Hyatt!!!

title: Excellent Expiriance - Well Done
text:
It was my first time at Hyatt Centric and it was great. Clean, great location, good staff. well done! 
If you need a nice hotel in a decent price in the area of time square, you definitely should consider it.

title: Overall 5 star still, but has some weaknesses.
text:
Overall 5 star still, but has some weaknesses.

Here are the good:
-spacious room 
-new and modern room 
-facility is top-notch 
-generally good front desk
-good location in NYC.  Right next to Times Square.

Here are the weaknesses:
-No room service.   That breakfast bag stuff is weak 
-The first floor pantry has limited menu.  
-It’s hard to take off silver tab from shampoo and conditioner tubes. 
-Housekeeping should automatically give more soap and shampoo each day.  They don’t, unless you ask for it, which is extra effort on part of guest.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
The cleanliness, friendliness,  location and overall experience within the hotel was really enjoyable. 

Unfortunately we ended on a bad note when the concierge/door man offered to provide us a ride service to the airport. He quoted us a price and clarified that the price included a tip so it would be the final total. The driver got really upset when we reiterated that the price included the tip. He then ignored us, didn’t help us with our luggage  and did not acknowledge us at all. I would recommend taking an Uber or regular taxi as our experience with those drivers was always pleasant and transparent. Unfortunately I wouldn’t trust the staff when offering to set you up with services outside the hotel.

title: Great place right in the middle of Times Square
text: This was in a very good location. Right in the middle of Times Square. But aside from the perfect location, everything else was average.Staff weren’t really friendly or accommodating. The hotel also didn’t really offer a lot of food selections from the small cafe they have downstairs.

title: Broadway show trip
text: All staff were very friendly, the accommodations were excellent, and the rooms were super quiet, especially considering how close to Times Square the hotel is located. Highly recommend this hotel and will stay here on my next trip to NYC!

title: Excellent hotel
text: An amazing, clean hotel in the perfect location. The staff were attentive, housekeeper was wonderful. The room was large as was the bathroom. The beds were big and comfortable. A minute from Times Square one way and 2 minutes from 6th Avenue the other...

title: Broadway Weekend
text: I was extremely pleased with the condition of this beautiful hotel and the friendliness of the staff.  My son and I plan to make our Broadway weekend an annual event and we will definitely stay here again!

title: Too clinical
text:
Nice hotel, but way too clinical. Had more of a conference facility with rooms feeling especially the gestapo that screams at you to show your room key to get to the elevators after 16.00. One particular guy was extremely rude shouting  repeatedly even tho the room key was visible in my hand. 

Rooms are huge and laid out well but the beds are uncomfortable. Pillows tiny and uncomfortable and the duvet very thin. Coffee machine hid away in a cupboard but no milk provided despite the facilities fee. 

Front desk staff are amazing and so friendly. Location good.

title: Hyatt times square
text: Larger room than I was expecting and great location.  Most of the places were in walking distance so it was ideal for us....traveling with 3 kids under 8.  Gym was great to get a workout before starting our day.

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
We visited here in July. The hotel is located right around the corner from the red stairs in Times Square. We paid for a room with an enhanced view of Times Square and we were given room 2406. The lifts were really quick, getting to and from the 24th floor. We were able to see the Paramount building and right along W45th Street.
The room was immaculate and the bathroom was huge, with a fantastic shower. The beds were incredibly comfortable, although the pillows were not the greatest. The air conditioning was very easy to use. We all slept well, even though we were right in the heart of Times Square.
There was water available in the room and this was replaced daily.
We didn’t eat in the hotel, but had a few meals in Connolly’s Irish bar which was right next door and Cook eatery a few doors up. These come highly recommended.
I would not hesitate to book here again.

title: Great experience
text: Wonderful hotel centrally located near Times Square.  Totally met all expectations for a Hyatt experience.  Hotel is small enough to feel intimate but has all of the “big” hotel amenities.  Second time staying here and would definitely stay there again.

title: AVOID, AVOID, AVOID... hidden charged over $1000 on departure
text:
Stayed here as getting married in Central Park, and booked 2 rooms.

**** AVOID AT ALL COST ****

Resort Fee / Destination Fee of $30.00 per pay, per room PLUS TAX which was not mentioned ONCE during any of the check in process, then demanded $1032.00 at check-out! 

-	Let’s be perfectly clear here… I was not advised of any of this by your receptionist, and I did not want or even NEED this “fee” to get me discounts on you in-hotel restaurant/bar, discounted helicopter rides, or entry to WorldOne. This is completely and utterly NOT acceptable!

I have contacted my credit card provider to stop and revoke any payment from your hotel. I see from other websites, you are also being called out for this shoddy practice!

The only thing I agreed to was the $150.00 upgrade to a "view" of Times Square, which was, let’s be honestly with ourselves here, non-existent! Before even telling us where in the hotel we would be located, the reception staff asked for $15 per room per night to be upgraded to “a view” of Times Square. I was expecting to see something more than once digital display board… I’m not exactly sure what you consider a view, but this “view” was absolute nonsense!

The staff are unfriendly, unhelpful, not interested in interacting with you whenever there is a problem. I was advised this "Destination Fee" is really a “resort fee due to their location in New York and as youre see close to broadway” (their words, not mine) and that it was billed due to the location of the hotel. I asked is this was option or compulroy by the City or State and could not be given any form of a comprehensible answer. This comes as quite the surprise when I booked and paid for the hotel 10 month in advance as I wanted this location… and after getting married in New York, i didnt not have $1000 at hand to pay upon departure, having already made sure I would not be using Room Service or any other items at cost.

I formally request that you contact me urgently to discuss this!

The location regrettably is on a very dirty street with garbage on the sidewalk, and overflowing garbage bins outside. The street has 24/7 food trucks burning charcoals and engines running, and every single night without fail, we have been offered weed and cocaine by dealers at the entrance to the hotel and the street. Take a left out of the hotel and meet the friendly dealer who will greet you with “smoke, smoke, smoke. You want weed?”

Security in the hotel is slim to non-existent. You DO NOT need a keycard to access or enter the elevators, and with the high volume of degenerates in Times Square this seriously needs addressing! Absolutely anyone can enter this hotel.

The ONLY, and I seriously mean this, the ONLY positive thing in this entire hotel was the Housekeeping staff on floor 34. I as always greeted with a smile and wishing us a great day. Always asking if we needed anything, fresh towels, the room serviced etc., and sadly the front of house/reception mostly chat amongst themselves and spend more time on their phones than customers. 

We visited the restaurant/bar but did not take a table as we were denied entry due to a member of our group being under 21. The rooftop itself was closed for refurb. We didn’t order any room service, and we definitely will NOT be returning.

I have stayed in Hyatt hotels before (Grand Hyatt Tokyo is one of my favourite hotels) and this Hyatt Centric hotel definitely needs some attention – urgently. I have already made a complaint to your customer services via email.

1. Location: perfect if you want Times Square, but the street experience is simply awful
2. Staff: unfriendly and unhelpful, they DON’T advise if Resort Fee/Desination Fee which I DO NOT accept.
3. Room: clean, well presented
- bathroom needs some attention as the shower has poor pressure and the door to shower just leaks water everywhere. The sink overflow is extremely dirty, hasn’t been cleaned in months by the amount of mould in there (yes I have pictures).
4. Walk in off the street and head to the elevators you are NOT acknowledged in any way. Their “security” is only after 4pm and it’s just a guy who wants to see a keycard, but will let multiple persons pass

If you try and ignore Times Square, stick to Bryant Park, it’s cleaner, 100 times not as busy, and you’re also not constantly harassed for money

If there was an opportunity to rate this place ZERO i would.

title: Exceptional service, clean and comfortable rooms, and a prime location! Perfect!
text: We stayed here for 4 nights in July and loved everything about this hotel. The service is friendly and efficient. Every request we made was fulfilled promptly and accurately. The location is perfect just a block away from Times Square and walking distance to Grand Central and 5th Avenue. Our room was super clean, quiet and comfortable and was a nice respite from the hubbub of the city. The breakfast was delicious and made with quality ingredients. We will be back!

title: We had a nice stay!
text: We had a nice stay. We paid for a higher room on the 22nd floor and we're happy with the view.  Its in Times Square, but slightly down the street from the main area. You can't hear all the noise from Time Square. The rooms were clean and the elevators fast. Its across the street from a Starbucks which is helpful in the am. They do have security, especially at night. I was with my kids so I could not go up to the restaurant, which was a bummer, but they do offer tours to go up at 1030 a.m.  The housekeeping staff was very kind to us.

title: Centrally Located, Comfortable Room
text: My friends and I stayed here as part of a Girls Trip Weekend.  The hotel is centrally located (half a block to Times Square, Starbucks right across the street, Broadway theaters close by) and up to date. There was plenty of space for the 4 of us to move around and the room was clean upon arrival.   As an added bonus, our room had a view of Times Square.  We were on the 20th floor and could not hear the street noise.  The bed and pillows were comfortable.  The mini fridge came in handy for storing snacks and drinks.  The bathroom was spacious with plenty of hot water and good water pressure in the shower.  The staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Do not bring your kids!!!
text: We arrived at hotel 6:30 and called restaurant for reservations. Right before I hung up the woman asked if everyone was over 21. I said no i have my 11 y/o daughter and the woman said we can’t eat there but I can order takeout and bring to our room. I asked if she was kidding and she said no. Never again!

title: Excellent Staff
text: The staff here are great! Anticipated our needs (extra water bottles in the room, getting us an umbrella to use during the rain,helping us with early check-in, etc). Housekeeping took special care with our kids’ things and was very kind. Room were nice, and even though we were right off Times Square, the room was quiet.

title: Beware of hidden charges!!
text: The hotel itself is in a great location close to times square and rooms and public areas were clean and tidy.  I was somewhat shocked to find on checking in the hotel charge $100 per night per room (we had 2 rooms) as a retainer fee to cover any room charges and holiday tax they also whack on at $30 per night!.  This meant before we even got to see New York we had be pay of $800 which was a large chunk of our budget!!  The hotel do refund this on checkout less anything charged to the room plus their $30 per night per room holiday tax. I've stayed in other New York hotels before and not had to pay this so called 'holiday tax' so felt robbed!  The other disappointment was that the roof terrace was closed indefinitely which was also another reason why i had booked this hotel.  All in all although we had a good stay and the staff were nice this left a very bitter taste in my mouth and if i had known about this then i certainly would have booked somewhere else!

title: Impeccable hotel
text:
The hotel and staff are impeccable. We stayed for 10 nights from 3rd July 2023 and everything was perfection. Rooms were spotless with everything needed to make it homely. Slight issue when first checked in and all staff went above and beyond to rectify this. Housekeeping staff were lovely and our room was beyond spotless every day. 

We would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Perfect location, great suite
text: Our family of 4 stayed in a suite on the 5th floor, which was not a Times Sq view. The room was spacious and fit our needs. It was clean and extremely spacious by NYC standards. Master bed was very comfortable.The pull out bed was not comfortable, but pull outs never are in hotels! The front desk workers were helpful and responsive to our needs. Room was cleaned nicely each day and security at the entrance of elevators 24 hrs per day put our family at ease about being in such a busy part of the city. They checked each person's key card for access to elevators. Roof top bar was closed outside for repairs, open inside, but kids are not granted entrance. We took a quick peek while our kids waited by the hostess. Great view from this rooftop bar. The location in Times Sq was perfect for our needs. Close to subway and a million things to do within walking distance. There was a little city noise that can be heard from your room, but this is expected in any big city, more importantly there was no noise from any other rooms near us.

title: An excellent hotel in an ideal location
text: We recently stayed at our favorite hotel in mid-town Manhattan, right by the theatre district. The staff at the hotel area friendly, helpful, and pleasant - from the front desk staff to the housecleaning staff. We feel very safe in the hotel and it is quiet at night. With just a short walk to our theatre and its location right next door to an excellent Irish pub - what more could you ask for?

title: Muy buen hotel
text:
El hotel se encuentra en pleno Broadway , dado que está en la calle 45 junto a Broadway , si coges plantas altas como fue mi caso no tienes nada de ruido en la habitación simplemente escucharás el aire acondicionado de la habitación que en mi caso no lo encuentro molesto.
Tiene para cargador de móvil por contacto para que cargues dos Moviles y luego tiene una regleta para usb , además de tener varios enchufes que si eres europeo no te viene mal un adaptador.
Te ponen todos los días 4 botellas de agua y además tienes cafetera para hacerte café diario o te , el café no es de marca , pero no es malo.
La habitación te la arreglan muy bien y la cama es de mucha calidad con lo cual después de un día pateando la ciudad descansar muy bien es más que recomendable.
El baño amplio al igual que la habitación, mucho más que otros hoteles de la ciudad.
Así que puedo recomendarlo sin ninguna duda.
La única pega es que hay sólo dos ascensores para las plantas superiores y hay veces que hay que esperar para poder subir o bajar.
Recordar que por parte del hotel hay servicios añadidos , así que preguntar en recepción, en mi caso pude disfrutar de alquiler de bicicleta por una hora.
Así que puedo recomendarlo sin ninguna duda.

title: Enjoyable weekend with someone special
text: I had a great time in New York.  I will definitely be back and stay in the same hotel.   I was upset that I didn't allow me into having a membership with them.    I am a first class traveler. I travel all the time.  I believe in self care and pampering myself through vacations.  Is long ones in short ones.

title: Destination fee & average value at best
text: Main issue is “destination fee” of over $40 that is not clearly stated on reserving the room and is NOT transparent in the pricing. In addition, these “destination” amenities are pretty sad and touristy and a lot of the attraction “discounts” are not anything exclusive (we used none of these “perqs”). Crowded front desk on check-in and check-out with slow throughput but staff were nice. Checked-in online in morning and requested digital key to avoid such crowds, but no digital key ever came. Elevators are small, stop a lot and were full on all use but one time. Rooms are fairly nice and updated. For the $548 per night charged, I would recommend spending another $100-150/nt all-in and stay at some of the much nicer boutique hotels down in SoHo area.

title: Great location and great service
text: We were in NYC for a family vacation. This hotel was within walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, and several amazing restaurants. The staff was great. The hotel was clean.. Highly recommend

title: No under 21s at the Bar, expensive food market
text: Great location. Rooms OK for the price, but hotel has little in the way of amenities. Bar on 54th floor heavily promoted, but only when arriving do you discover it's over 21's only. No good for us as a family with a 17yr old. Not expecting him to have an alcoholic drink with us of course, but as he was excluded, that effectively excluded all of us. T45 Market on the ground floor is severely overpriced and if you only want a few drinks/snacks you'd do better walking to a nearby convenience store, or the Amazon Go at the Rockefeller Center. Hotel Staff polite and accommodating though.

title: Outstanding hotel with amazing staff!
text: I give the Hyatt Centric Times Square New York City my highest rating and recommendation. If you are planning on visiting the city and want to stay in the center of it all with access to all the sites of the city look no further. This is where you want to stay in NYC.

title: Great place to stay right on Times Square
text: Great location, clean, nice fitness room with Pelotons. Queen beds in a double room is not a frequent find in this area. Second stay here, will stay here again I’m sure. Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Good rooms, AC not working
text: Great location and clean rooms. AC was not working in the original room, so gave a call to the lobby and was told that a technician was on their way up to look at it. After waiting about an hour and when it hit midnight, we decided to just pack and head to the lobby to request a room switch. Our request was accommodated by the management, so everything worked out. Room service was decent. Breakfast order was wrong so had to call them again and request the item that we ordered originally. I guess that's expected in hotels though, so that's okay.

title: Would not stay here again.
text: The room we booked would not sleep 4 as originally advertised, so we were forced to upgrade for an additional $70/night.  The furniture in the room was falling apart and the bed/pillows were not comfortable.  You also did not need a key card to operate the elevator, which isn't safe considering the hotel is in the heart of Times Square.  The Walgreens across the street had everything locked down even the shampoo!  I would not stay here again.

title: Right in the heart of Time's Square
text: Great location to see theatre productions. Plenty of dining options within walking distance. Onsite dining had a great selection of food and beverages but was a bit costly but convenient. 24-hour workout available.

title: 50th birthday trip
text:
Could not fault our stay from the minute we arrived. Michael on reception was welcoming, gave us a lovely room with a view & credit for drinks in bar for my birthday 
The room was a good size, clean and bathroom was very modern. Air conditioning worked very well.
Nothing was too much trouble and we would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Hopeless! Hyatt Centric in New York Times Square is hopeless!
text: Hyatt Centric in New York Times Square is hopeless and everyone should reconsider before booking this place! Staffs are rude and the room isnt clean. Upon leaving there is not even a printer for printing receipts! The gym machines are old treadmills legs mostly broken and one of the elliptical were malfunctioning! Totally bad experience for this price! Hopeless and cannot tell u how sad i am!

title: Holiday in New York
text: Fantastic hotel, great views, great size room, everything we needed in the room including a great little coffee machine. Fresh water left every day for the 4 of us by the brilliant cleaning staff, who made sure the room was spotless every day and were very friendly. No wait times for the lifts, check in was easy, and reception staff were always helpful whenever we asked questions. Have nothing bad at all to say about this hotel, it's a great place to stay if you want to stay in the Times Square area of New York. Will definitely stay here again if we came back to New York!

title: Nothing great but gets the job done
text: Second stay at this property. Great location if you want to be near but not in Times Square. Rooms were surprisingly quiet and large for NYC standards. Housekeeping personnel were great other employees way average. Bizarre hours for tiny restaurant on site. Gym was better than expected. All in all, just ok.

title: My new go-to hotel in NYC
text: Great location, nice views without the hustle and the noise if you are in a high floor. I was offered the upgrade and half the listed price, so I took it.  Thankfully this is a real Hyatt, beautiful room, great coffee, nice amenities.  Really looking forward to come back with my whole family.

title: Great experience in Times Square
text: This is a great, clean and comfortable hotel. The staff and housekeeping are friendly and responsive.  We’ve stayed there twice and have not been disappointed.  I would highly recommend this hotel. It’s close to all the broadway shows, great dining and the subway.

title: Great location, clean hotel, restful stay
text: Highly recommend. The hotel is clean, staff friendly, had an “overlook” of part of Times Square. You’re 1/2 block away from the middle of TS. 3 blocks to Times Square station, so easy to nav Manhattan

title: Lovely Stay!
text:
This hotel is perfectly situated between two major subway hubs, and right in the middle of the Theater District. Just a quick walk across the street to see our shows. There is a convenience and coffee shop in the lobby that’s nice in the morning, and for late night, it’s right next to a Cook convenience store. Views of the city are very nice, and street noise is faint. I grew up with city and airport noise and find it soothing. You’d likely struggle finding any noise-free hotels near Times Square. This hotel is close to it. 

The staff here are lovely and helpful. The showers have rain shower heads and great water pressure, the TV has Google Chromecast capabilities so you can watch any streaming services you have from your phone.

title: Nice Hotel in Times Square
text: Nice clean Hotel in the middle of Times Square. Decent size room. Nice hotel staff. There is a continental breakfast for extra cost with a few good choices. Good for families and couples. Very busy in the area.  You can Uber to shows and other attractions.

title: Café da manhã incluso na diária e excelente localização.
text: O Hotel é excelente, super bem localizado em Manhattan (10 minutos de caminhada até o Times Square, Estação Central, The Vessel, Loja da M&Ms..). O diferencial do Hyatt é o café da manhã incluso na diária... Uma exceção dentre os hotéis americanos. Café super completo, com máquinas enormes de leite e café, chás e chocolate quente à vontade, ovos mexidos, suco, iogurte, frutas e diversos tipos de pães e complementos.. A área de refeição é bem agradável. Os apartamentos são muito bons, ao estilo NY - um tanto compactos, mas com ótima mobília e roupas de cama. Banheiro charmoso, mas bem apertadinho. Nosso apartamento tinha 1 cama de casal, 1 de solteiro e 1 sofá cama. Mas nos acomodamos bem.. 2 adultos, 2 adolescentes e um bebê.

title: Great stay in the heart of Times Square
text: We went to NY for an overnight trip to see a Broadway show. This hotel provided the perfect location for us to walk to the show, stores and dinner. The hotel was very clean and the staff was great (especially Dayna!). We stayed in a suite which gave us a lot of space for our family of 4. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

title: Great!!
text:
Too good to tell, otherwise in further is busy and more expansive :-) great stay there!  Up 30 flor phantastic view. Top roof bar was closed - why?  And B54 was expansive that wasnt good.
But the bar is not the Hotel

title: Perfect location
text: Location was perfect! Times Square is at an arms length, enough for privacy and quick to any activity located at a Times Square. The Professional staff, and room accommodations was great.. Great view at Bar 54.

title: La atencion en el area del restaurante ubicado en el lobby extremadamente malo! La primera noche al amanecer empezaron r
text: El servicio del restaurante super malo, ellos deciden reunirse y los clientes tienen que esperar a que ellos hablen para despues atender! La primera noche en el hotal al amanecer empezaron trabajos que generaban ruidos super molestos que iterrumpen el descanso! Vale destacar que baje al lobby y me informaron que ya habian finalizado el trabajo! Pero sorpresa al dia siguiente continuaron con los ruidos de reparacion super molestos!!

title: Perfect location and service!
text: We booked two rooms for our group, ranging in age from 14-72.  The location was a perfect base for walking and finding transportation to attractions. The rooms were beautiful, clean and larger than expected. My favorite part was the staff! So friendly and helpful; especially our housekeeper. She asked us how we were each day and made sure we were comfortable. Thanks for making our first trip to NYC so special! We loved every minute!

title: Weekend in Manhattan
text: Booked hotel through BA holidays. Room was a 2 queensize bed enhanced view of times square.  We were located on the 21st floor. Room was large and beds comfortable.  Reception staff could have been more friendly, but answered any questions we had. CC charged with £400 on arrival but on check out account settled and difference refunded very smoothly.  Location is right on Times square  but wasnt really disturbed by any noise. In summary, it did what we needed but probably wouldn't return due to high resort fee and little benefits for it.

title: Perfect location & quiet rooms
text: My sister and I stayed for the weekend because we needed a change of scenery and had tickets for Wicked on Broadway. We’ve stayed in other hotels on other visits to the city but we will most likely be choosing the Hyatt Centric again! We had a room on the 33rd floor and it was incredibly quiet - the rooms must be soundproof because we did not hear any street noise, sirens or hallway sounds. Our room was immaculately clean too. I would definitely stay here again !

title: Excellent Hotel with everything you need!
text:
Stayed here for 7 nights with my wife for a holiday to take in all of what New York offers.
Very good location just off Times Square with easy access to subways and a variety of tourist areas on foot. The staff were all very friendly and made you feel welcome at all times. The room was spotless and was cleaned everyday with new bedding and towels daily. Would definitely use this hotel again and would recommend to all who are considering it.

title: Extra clean and large rooms
text: Very impressive by the large extremely clean rooms. The service for very responsive. The roof top bar had delicious small plates and drink. Perfect location for shows, shopping and exploring. They have earned my loyalty

title: Hyatt Centric for a great vacation
text: Great hotel.  Staff was exceptional from checkin to checkout. Hotel is in the middle of everything. Short walks to theaters, Times Square, and many wonderful restaurants. Hotel is extremely clean, roof top bar was great even with the smoke from Canada fires. The restaurant was great for quick breakfast and coffee in the morning.Highly recommended.

title: Great staff and location
text: Great staff and location. Special call-out to Jorge who assisted with my reservation challenges and related requests. Rooms are clean and bright, with large windows that add to the NYC experience. Give this property a try, you won't be disappointed.

title: A gem that won’t be hidden for long.
text:
The hotel has a stellar location and an outstanding team.  Yenny who worked the front desk was very professional, efficient and welcoming.  We arrived early and expected to just leave our bags but were very pleasantly surprised when she informed us their was a room ready for us.  We received the same excellent service and friendliness from every member we interacted with.  

The room would be considered spacious in any market, but in NY it was Yuuuge!   The bathroom was equally spacious and offered a great rain head that reminded me of home.  Overall a great experience and one I will surely be repeating.  Kudos to the entire management team.

title: Great Stay!
text: We chose this hotel because the rooms were bigger than most for NY and it had a fridge and coffee maker, which seems to be unusual in NYC for hotels within our budget.  We were a family of 4...2 adults and our 18 and 21 year old, so we needed some space. The room was great.  Fridge kept things cold. The hotel is central to everything we wanted to do, so for us, the location was perfect.  We did not get a city view room, so we didn't hear any noise at night.  My sister was across the hall in a city view room and it was slightly bigger than ours.  I would recommend the city view room for that reason.  I am not sure if she could hear noise from the street, but she didn't complain, so I think it was fine.  The rooms were clean and, Jennifer, our housekeeper was amazing!  The little market downstairs was good for coffee and a quick bite in the morning. There are many places in the area you can buy food for less, though, one being the Eatery just a couple doors down.  Connolly's was great for late night food and drinks. I have only a couple complaints...one was that there is very little space for storing suitcases and clothing. There are bed side tables where the drawers pull out, but they are not drawers.  They are like extended table tops.  I feel like, with the size of NY rooms, they could have made those actual drawers to provide more space for things.  There was no outlet in the middle bedside table.  This is not a make or break for the hotel.  Just an observation.  There are outlets on the other bedside tables, just not the one in the middle.  One of the reasons I chose the hotel was for the outside terrace, however, it was closed during our stay, so that was a bummer, but Connolly's, next door, had a rooftop bar (kids under 21 are allowed to go up, as well), so we went there a few nights. There is security at the hotel and you have to show your room key after 4pm to go to the elevators.  There is a lot of activity in Times Square, so it made me feel safer having the doormen there to check for keys.  For this reason, make sure everyone in your party has a key or they may have difficulty getting up to the room. If you like all the hustle and bustle of NY, this is a great place to stay!

title: Modern, Clean Hotel
text: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Very close to a metro station and Times Square is literally just around the corner. Bed was so comfy and housekeeping is done daily with towels being refreshed daily. Will definitely stay here again,

title: New York Hotel
text: Great location. Room and Bathroom modern and  very clean . Bed firm and very comfortable. Air con very effective and easily controlled. Food options at the hotel limited but good quality. Friendly staff

title: Great Hotel & Location
text: Love this hotel.  It was extremely clean and the perfect location. I most definitely will be coming back for another stay. Centrally, located so you are close to all the major attractions.  Just around the corner from Time Square.

title: Sehr gute Basis
text: viel zu teuer für das, was es bietet, wenn man es mit Hotels in anderen Städten vergleicht. In New York vermutlich ein ganz realer Preis. Aber ein sehr gutes Hotel in Top-Lage mit toller Aussicht aus den höheren Etagen. Mega Aussicht aus der Rooftop-Bar. Sehr nettes und hilfsbereites Personal.

title: A wonderful stay in the heart of Times Square
text: What better way to get accommodation right in the heart of Times Square, where the action is. Keep up the wonderful service! Will definitely visit again and would highly recommend Hyatt Centric to friends

title: Excellent séjour. Je recommande cet hôtel
text:
Très bel hôtel, bien situé par rapport à toutes les visites.
Chambre,impeccable, spacieuse, confortable avec adaptateurs pour prises électriques, réfrigérateur, cafetière et coffre fort.
Salle d'eau spacieuse  travec le linge de toilette à volonté.
Chambre parfaitement insonorisée malgrè tout le bruit extérieur
Personnel bienveillant, sympathique et disponible.
Etablissement bien situé dans Manhattan pour accéder aux visites.

title: Fantastic stay in very convenient location
text: We stayed as a 4 (2 adults and 2 teenagers) in one of the slightly bigger rooms with 2 queen beds. There was plenty of space for cases and our belongings and the bathroom was huge too. It was a very comfortable stay. The location was great, right beside Times Square but still quiet in the room.

title: Know What You Want
text:
If you love being in the heart of a bustling city sleeping high above the rooftops, then this is a good choice for you. They boast NYC's highest rooftop bar (54th floor) and are located in the heart of Times Square.

Unfortunately, I didn't want most of those things. I wanted something quiet, close to the ground, and without a lot of outside interaction. They gave me the quiet room... but it was on the 34th floor. Once I realized that would be a problem they changed it (7th floor) but the room was now facing the street, so I could hear the constant city noise from below. I also had to clear every single Uber delivery person with the front desk in order to deliver directly to my room. Part of me likes that for security reasons, but it was draining. Also I had issues with the room phone which required even more knocks on the door from the technician (to their credit they did get it fixed that day).

The only meal you could get delivered in house was breakfast, which was quite expensive (though not surprising given the location). With the room price I paid, I expected (and pretty sure I read somewhere) that room service for all meals would be available. But it wasn't.

So while it was super convenient to be down the block from the theater where I was attending a Broadway show and across the street from a 24 hour Walgreens, I would not stay here again. That doesn't mean it's not for everyone though.

title: Perfect NYC trip
text: We traveled to NYC with our 14 year old grandson. It was his first trip with us so we wanted everything to be perfect. Hyatt Centric Times Square played a huge part in making this trip great. From the moment we walked in we were treated extremely well by all staff. Our suite was spacious so we all had our own space. The bathroom was roomy and the shower was outstanding. Twenty one floors up street noise was minimal. The air conditioning kept the room very comfortable. The restaurant off the lobby had great pastries, coffee and grab and go food. Best of all we were less than a block from Broadway and many attractions could be reached on foot. It was also extremely easy to arrange for transportation when needed. We went to see the Harry Potter play, took the Statue of Liberty boat tour, toured the Intrepid, hit the Lego store and FAO Schwarz, went to the Top of the Rock on a glorious afternoon and toured the Natural History Museum on our visit. Hyatt Centric Times Square was the perfect base for our adventures.

title: Great hotel
text: Location, staff, room all were all perfect. I took and up grade and I had a room on the 52th floor, the view of time square and lower Manhattan was amazing. Large room for Manhattan. No restaurant but the grab and go concept works

title: Loved this hotel!
text: Booked this hotel based on reviews and it was a hit!  Room was clean and perfect for the two of us.  It was 1/2 block from all the craziness of Times Square and was surprisingly quiet.  Staff was responsive, accommodating, and pleasant.  We were able to walk to several subway stations and restaurants from this location.  We would definitely stay here again!

title: comfortable clean and great location
text: The staff was very nice and courteous, the place was clean and the room was very comfortable. It's a great location close to all the theaters and the middle of times square. Would recommend staying here and will be again in the future.

title: Memorial Day wkend  2023 - King suite on 7th flr w/2 adults and 2 kids
text: I thought this room was a very good value, clean, comfortable and in a great location. Even though the room was right by the elevator and faced 45th street, it was not too loud.  There was security by the elevators so people without room keys could not go past the lobby.

title: NYC family vacay
text: It was our first time in NYC and I did lots and lots of research on where to stay. The reviews did not steer me wrong, this hotel was great! Great location, easy to walk to multiple subway stations. The room was very spacious and the beds were comfy. Rooms were clean and the bathroom had a rain shower that was perfect after a busy day. We had some issues with our AC not working, but within 30 mins we had a technician in our room and an offer to switch rooms if a resolution couldn’t be met. The staff was great to work with and I could tell they genuinely cared about making sure we had a great experience. If we ever go back to NYC, we will stay here for sure!

title: Great Location and Service!
text: Hyatt Centric Times Square NYC has gone beyond my expectations. I'm a Hyatt member for many years, but this particular hotel, for the fact to be in NYC, had really surprised me with cordiality of all staff, great service, cleaning, location and spectacular views from Bar 54. I strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent place to stay
text: Stayed here Tuesday 23-27 May.  The receptionist who greeted us when we arrived was fantastic and thoroughly informed us of everything we needed to know.  We were on the 23rd floor and each time you came back to the hotel you had to show your room key to access the lifts.  Our room was lovely and the hotel was very quiet - we didnt hear another guest and was at the back so no street noise either.  Our room was cleaned everyday.  The room has a supply of  with coffee and tea but no milk.  We went to the T45 market in reception to buy some and he gave us a full cup for free - brilliant.  The location of this hotel is superb - less than five minutes to the hustle and bustle of Times Square.  Checking out was easy (though I do hate the $30 plus tax destination charged per room per night - certainly added up for our 7 nights in USA).  We asked the man on the door to get us a cab and he informed us that the hotel has its own SUV that could take us to the airport - perfect way to finish our stay in an aircon vehicle with free water - much better than a cab dearer at $120 but much nicer).  Cannot recommend the Hyatt Times Square highly enough.  Many thanks.

title: Daddy & Daughter Trip
text:
Ich war über Pfingsten mit meiner Tochter dort! Preis/ Leistung gerade für NY übersichtlich! Top Lage, mega Personal! Es wurde sich um wirklich alles gekümmert. Von persönlichem Nachfragen bis hin zu einem High End Taxi zurück zum Flughafen. 
Mehr braucht man für diese Stadt nicht. Sauber und wirklich großes Zimmer mit tollem Blick!

title: Key Location
text: Would recommend this location. Quiet at night. Great location for restaurants, Minskoff Theatre and shopping.  Taxis available. Doorman very helpful. Umbrellas available at front desk if needed. My family would happily stay here again.  Starbucks just across from hotel.

title: Weekend in Times Square
text: From front bellman to security, front desk, F&B (breakfast only), housekeeping and Front desk, the service was beyond expectations. No request was brushed off no question ignored. TIP: be nice to the hard working staff and you'll get it back, this is true in all restaurants, bars, etc in Times Square too. Facility was clean and appropriately appointed and could not have been more convenient to our theater, touring and restaurant destinations. Not cheap but well worth the expense.

title: Nice hotel, great location
text: Went to see a couple of shows and could not book our regular hotel so we ended up at the Hyatt Centric. Great choice. Perfect location for everything. Staff were great. Room was clean and recently renovated. We used their valet parking which was super convenient. The only complaint was the destination fee of $30 per day plus tax. The fee came with some discounts but not worthwhile for us and although we pre paid for our room, the additional fee was never mentioned.

title: The Best in NYC
text: Fantastic option for a high level Hyatt at a great price point in Midtown Manhattan.Best staff, clean, beautiful and functional rooms, amazing location. Will be returning with my family next week. Such a breath of fresh air to find this property! Highly recommended!

title: Great stay in NY City
text: We stayed here for eight days on vacation. The hotel is a nice hotel, the rooms are slightly bigger than most NY City hotel rooms. We stayed on the 37th floor and we still heard sirens and honking from Time Square through the night. A true NY experience lol. We had a great time at this hotel.

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
text: Very welcoming and clean hotel, located close to Times Square (but not too close...), Theater District, Rockefeller Center and all the subway connections you could ever need.  Great views over the City and a rooftop bar with an even better view.  Our room was kept very clean and all the staff were helpful and cheerful.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Disappointed repeat customer
text: The facilities have aged a bit since our stay from two years ago, and the sheets were dirty (we found hair on them, and they did not fit properly on the end). The staff sent up new issues that did not fit either. After a long trip, and after driving through Times Square, we were already quite tired. We were disappointed with our stay this time and will look for other accommodations next time

title: Always select Hyatt-Time square
text: Great! Balloons were sent to my room. A birthday card was on the bed. A service car was ready everyday for transportation. The advisor new the area. The bell advisor new the city very informative. I had an amazing time

title: Clean, modern, friendly, great location
text: The Hyatt Centric is superbly located near Times Square and various metro stops. The staff were super helpful. The room was spotless and modern. Wi-Fi was good. everyone was friendly and greeted me coming in and out. There are breakfast options near by and a nice coffee shop downstairs. The roof bar 54 has super views. Overall a great experience.

title: Great customer service at the Hyatt Centric
text: The hotel did a great job of managing our disappointment when we checked in to find that the balcony suite we had booked was unavailable.  We were given a comparable room on a high floor with a good view over the city and given an allowance for the hotel shop which, along with the waving of the destination fee, meant a benefit of over $100 a day.  The room was excellent, one of the most comfortable we have stayed in and the bar with its view over the city was enjoyable, again it was a pity that the balcony area was close for refurbishment.  Overall an excellent stay and we will definitely stay there again.

title: Great location!
text: Wonderful staff!! Incredibly helpful service team - from the valet to avoid the parking headache in Times Square, to the checkout and promptness of their team. Location is literally 1/2 block of Times Square with a parking garage across the street.

title: Amazing view, Amazing service, Perfect Location
text:
With all of the hotel choices it is tough to pick one, we looked at several properties in the Times Square area, all comparatively priced and settled on the Hyatt Centric, based on previous reviews and location and we were not disappointed!  Booked a high room with a city view and they delivered on that ten fold.  Our room on the 48th floor with a perfect view between the H&M building and another tall building that afforded a beautiful view of lower Manhattan and One World Trade from the bed looking out the floor to ceiling windows.

Room was clean, bed extremely comfortable, which was perfect after the many miles of walking and touring the city.  Cap that off with a very friendly and helpful staff and we choose a great hotel.  We've already recommended it to others planning a trip to NY.  It is a pricey stay, but no different than other hotels in the area and of the same caliber.

title: Great time in NY
text:
This hotel is great.
Found the whole experience of New York amazing and this hotel is perfectly situated next to Time Square. All the staff were friendly and helpful especially are room cleaner, Rose, who was always happy and did a great job.
We had an enhanced view of the city and was on the 34 floor, great view and the bed was comfortable,  if we went back we would most definitely stay here again.

title: Good quiet base from which to explore NYC
text: Good, clean, comfortable and quiet hotel with an excellent location. I had no issues - my only small complaint would be that in-room dining options were not as I expected and limited and you had to go down to pick up some fairly basic stuff to eat in the room. But if you plan to eat out and be out this hotel is an excellent base and I would recommend and stay here again too.

title: Great stay!
text:
We came to NYC to see a Broadway show.  The hotel was a block and a half from the theater, which was great.  
The room was really clean, had room darkening curtains, and we didn’t hear any of the outside traffic.  The shower had really great water pressure.  Everyone was courteous, helpful, and welcoming.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect location
text: We’ve been to New York numerous times though this hotel was the best location. Very quiet despite being so close to Times Square. Room was perfect for our needs. All staff very professional and friendly. Will definitely return here.

title: New York may 23
text:
Great location, great room .
So clean and very helpful staff.,
Looked after our baggage on day of checkout without fuss.
As it was my wife’s birthday, they upgraded us to a double queen room which was very much appreciated

title: excellent place for anyone in the theater district
text: excellent location/ great experience  i would definitely recommend this for anyone wanting to be in the theater district.  easy access to all theaters and mass transit   accomodations and service were excellent

title: Great hotel, great location and great view
text:
Stayed here for a full week in a high floor king deluxe room.
The room was great. Lovely bathroom and a massive comfy bed. 
We were checked in by ‘Dede’ who was very helpful and friendly and couldn’t have been nicer. 
The room was peaceful which was a pleasant surprise considering it’s at Times Square. 
The room was cleaned and serviced daily without having to ask for it. Great job. 
Nice coffee machine in the room. 
Shaun on the door was great when getting us a car back to the airport.
The only downside was the lady on reception who checked us out wasn’t interested, basically she wanted the bill settled and that was it. Not even asked how the stay was or a ‘have a nice day’,  Such a shame as other staff had been great. 
Would definitely return here.

title: Birthday trip for my mom.
text: The staff were friendly and kind. The rooms were spacious, updated, and clean. The workout space included plenty of equipment, free weights, and Peloton bikes. The door persons were very knowledgeable and quick to help.

title: Hotel très bien situé, personnel a l'écoute, chambre superbe mais sans roomservice
text: hôtel très bien situer, chambre lit king parfaite avec vue superbe (High Floor vue ville étage 52 et 53 / personnel très réactif et sympathique, manager très à l'écoute. Mais attention pas de roomservice possible (sauf pour le petit déjeuner si celui-ci a été réservé a la reservation mais avec des produits provenant de la boutique au RdC)  et pas de "petit déjeuner continentale" possible : concept est de commander ou aller chercher toute la nourriture en extérieur et la ramené a l'hôtel

title: Very central to Times Square, efficient and attractive
text: The Hyatt centric properties are not meant to be high-end, but also meant to have attractive designs. This property threaded that needle.  we stayed in a suite, which was attractively decorated and functional, but could not be called luxurious. the hotel literally could’ve been in the middle of Times Square it was so close. this was good for the buzz but less good for the noise. apart from that the hotel is very practical with room service delivered in paper bags. Staff were kind and very helpful.

title: Great Value
text: The location, amenities, and condition of the hotel makes this hotel a very good value in the heart of Time's Square.  The property was within walking distance to my meetings and events. Will stay here again.

title: Amazing Experience.
text: It was an amazing experience. I am 18 and have never been to new york especially by myself or with a few friends so it was nerve racking at first. But, they made me more than just welcome I will say that. Although I was younger the staff seemed to treat me with care just as they would any other guest. It was well appreciated and for my first trip alone it was great and one to remember for sure. So thank you and I will definitely be back soon!

title: Trip with my daughter
text:
I took my daughter for her 11th birthday and they went over and beyond. We got a free room upgrade AND had balloons in the room. 

Everyone was very friendly and helpful. There was a note in the computer it was her birthday and they all wished her Happy Birthday.

title: Over hyped
text:
I just wasted £1400 for 2 nights not even breakfast was included. In the amount.

The staff couldn’t help with my bag
I had to carry right from the cab to my room.

I guess I paid for just the time square view

title: Great hotel and location
text: The staff at this Hyatt is always friendly and professional. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. They just raised the parking rate again which was the only thing I could find fault with. Loved the rooftop bar.

title: Excellent stay
text: The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and nicely appointed. It was perfect for our one night stay after attending a Broadway show! The bathroom and shower were exceptionally clean and the shower was a treat.

title: Highly Recommended
text: Our four night stay at the Hyatt Centric exceeded high expectations. Our large room with two Queen size beds had a spectacular view and was stylish and comfortable. Cleaned spotlessly every day, it was a pleasure to return to after a busy day sightseeing. A really great base to explore NY!

title: Trustworthy, smooth stay
text: Hyatt Centric was a good choice. I stayed there as part of a block of rooms for a conference. The staff were excellent. Room was clean and equipped. The gym is also nice and well equipped. Overall, this was a good solid stay in Times Square, where things can feel hectic.

title: Not worth it
text:
Did not live up to the Hyatt standards.
Free breakfast only if you are a globalist, no security really, in the elevator bank(yes, there is someone checking that you have a hotel room key, but there is no hotel room key access required to get onto the floors). $35 resort fee doesn’t get you anything at all worthwhile. Know that the discount on the helicopter tour is actually greater if you go to that website directly to book. There is no such photo shoot at 10:30 AM on the top level, everything other resort fee benefit was also baseless and empty. No access to vending machines or convenience, food or snacks anywhere in the hotel. Our hotel room was not fully cleaned as there was garbage under one of the beds. The temperature control was also really hard to work and we were either freezing or roasting. There was no in between. Outside of that was a great location right in the middle of Times Square but off the Square so that it was quiet.

title: Excellent Stay
text: We loved being close to everything and the hotel was great.  Loved the rooftop bar. Housekeeping staff were great, as well as all the staff in giving recommendations. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Fabulous Service & Location
text: Great location! Within walking distance to Timesquare, theatres & many dining spots. The service here was incredible, everyone is very attentive and courteous. The rooms are nice and spacious and clean. This place is a gem.

title: Just right!
text: Even the sheets were welcoming. Yes, the room was a tad small but there was so much seating it was great! It was clean and smelled like there was care put into making sure we would be comfortable. We were even able to check in early with no issues. The staff provided great security and were so friendly. They made this trip perfect.

title: Excellent stay in Time Square
text:
From check in to check out everything was exceptional the room was well appointed and beautiful 
Breakfast was fast and yummy!   Security checking keys was wonderful especially for female travelers
traveling alone.  Beds were so comfortable a great nights sleep in the heart of the city!   Great stay I will definitely return!

title: Best hotel Great Location All modern tech connectivities
text: Great hotel for work travel. Seamless connection to laptop, wifi and streaming of video to TV. Free 4 bottles of water per day. Room cleaned every day and kept immaculate. Great location you cant complain about it.

title: Not a Category 6 Hotel
text: The rooms felt outdated and small.  The location was ok but disappointed in overall look, feel, service, and amenities.  I wish we didn’t waste our points and stayed at a different location.  There wasn’t even a sheet on the bed - we had to request one.

title: Good experience and great location
text:
Great experience and great location. The room was clean and service was great.
It is not cheap, but the location is very central, but the rooms are fairly quiet. If you look for a central location close to time square, this hotel is recommended.

title: new york trip
text: very nice hotel in a great location close to everything, one step from Times Square. The room was quiet and very clean. The view amazing. All the staff was very polity and helpfull. If we visti NYC again we will definitely choose this hotel again.

title: A pleasant stay and friendly vibe
text: Nice location, convenient, friendly staffs. I felt welcomed during check in. The room I have is a deluxe king on high floor and got a pretty nice view overlooking the broadway street. The amenities are ok. Overall a pleasant stay. It is much better than the experience I had with another big brand bargains with a letter M just around the area. This is overall just a much better stay even this is one star less in comparison. Better value for money.

title: Ok, but nothing more
text:
We booked this hotel based off the very good reviews and nice photos on the website.. the reality is a little different sadly. 

The lobby was shockingly disappointing, we thought we’d walked into a hostel. Very small and trying hard to be ‘trendy’ but failing. 
Check in staff were ok, friendly enough but not especially welcoming or cordial. No offer to assist with bringing bags to the room. 
The lift makes creaking noises and the corridors are outdated, carpeted and dingey. 

The room was small, but adequate and spotlessly clean.  The view was good. 

Downstairs there is a ‘market place’ cafe where you can order food and drinks, but it was very expensive and not particularly delicious. I would certainly expect far more from a four star hotel. 

There is a roof top bar (21+ so don’t expect to enjoy a drink if travelling with kids).. we went up in the morning when you are allowed to go with children only to discover that the terrace is closed because they are renovating. Disappointing. 

One of the strangest things about the hotel are the surly security guards who guard the lifts. I presume they are meant to be checking that only guests and bar patrons are in the building but I was only asked to show my room key once, when I had both hands full. Didn’t feel very secure as pretty much anyone could just walk in and go to any floor. 

One amazing thing about this hotel which I cannot leave out is the housekeeping team- always friendly, flexible and doing the best with keeping the rooms spotless- top marks to them! 

We won’t come back to this hotel again as for this price there are many much nicer hotels in NYC

title: Trip to see Funny Girl
text: Beautiful hotel, great location. Valet parking was quick and convenient.The downsides were: the hot water wasn’t working when we arrived, the blackout shades let a lot of light in, and breakfast was obscenely expensive. We asked for egg whites on the side and it looked like we were charged for a full entree for that.  We had to call for bathrobes and when they brought them up none of them had ties and one smelled musty. They definitely were not plush but worn out and scratchy. The mini fridge was so small that putting restaurant leftovers in it overnight didn’t allow the door to close fully so they had to be thrown out the next morning.

title: Very good experience.  New York-expensive
text: Great staff, clean room, very cool view from 47th floor.  But man, it was expensive.  Really helpful staff enabled us to check in early,  We didn’t experience the bar or food, but they looked good.  Great location, right around the corner from Times Square.

title: Great location and good sized rooms
text:
Check-in was easy, there is a mandatory fee they charge each day ode the city. Separate from the fees Expedia mentioned which was a surprise but not the hotel's fault. hotel was 3 minute walk to 7th avenue. Rockefeller center about 12 minute walk. Central Park and ground zero were about 20 minutes via walking and subway.
Room was spacious but outdated. Mine had a crack with water stain in the bathroom ceiling and black mold in the shower ceiling. There was also a crack in the bedroom area as well. There's a play opening next door April 29th called Grey House which looked fun.

title: Not a 4 Star Property
text: I chose to stay here instead of the Marriott Marquis to avoid the conference crowds, but that was a mistake. I gained nothing by choosing this option, not even cost savings. I would place it in the 3 star category and no higher.The staff are friendly, particularly the housekeeping staff. The rooms are nice - comfortable and clean - but hallways are dingy. There is a cafe on the first floor that provides room delivery until noon, but I would have preferred in-room coffee or kettle. Most importantly, there is a rooftop bar prominently advertised, but there are no significant restrictions for public access to hotel room floors. There is no restricted elevator access to the upper floor rooms which seems as if that's a huge security risk. There are security guards in the lobby near the elevator banks, but over the course of 4 days I was only asked for my key once. Overall my stay was fine, but it is not anywhere I'd go out of my way to return to again, nor would it top my list of recommended hotels.

title: Tolles Hotel am Times Square
text:
- tolles Hotel mitten in NYC
- trotz Nähe zum Times Square für NYC sehr ruhig
- Zimmer im 52.Stock mit dem besten Blick über die City
- für NYC richtig große Badezimmer mit Dusche und Badewanne
- sehr zu empfehlen
- wer aber ein Frühstücksbuffet oder ähnliches benötigt ist dort falsch

title: Super!
text: Nous avons été très bien accueilli, la réceptionniste très professionnelle et souriante! L'hôtel est idéalement situé pour pour pouvoir "rayonner" dans NY. Chambre spacieuse et silencieuse (6ème étage à l'arrière du bâtiment pas trop de passage et loin des ascenseurs, top!)salle de bains correcte, propre et bien équipée (linges en suffisance, produits de douche, café, coffre, etc). Service de sécurité rassurant. Super séjour avec notre papa de 82 ans pour sa 1ère dans la ville "qui ne dort jamais". Nous vous recommandons cet établissement.

title: Family Trip
text: Took a family trip to NYC. KIds first time. We loved everything about the hotel including location, room, and service. Staff friendly. Housekeeping great. Would definitely stay here again! p.s. get the croissants

title: Great location, flat pillows
text:
Pros:  Location. The staff was nice. There was security in the lobby. Valet parking available. Good water pressure in the shower, rainhead.  Room was not all carpet. Clean. 

Cons: Hard beds. Shockingly  flat pillows.

title: Best hotel in Times Square
text: Very impressed with this hotel. The rooms were larger than expected. Housekeeping was amazing! The shower was out of this world and just what we needed at the end of fun but long days of exploring the city. When it was time to leave they even arranged private transportation for us. Location was perfect. We could see Times Square but couldn’t hear it at night. Great experience!

title: Great Hotel, Great Times Square Location
text: Nice hotel, great location (if you wish to stay in the Times Square area). I wish they had a real restaurant and that the Roof Top bar had more space (it opens up a bit more in the late Spring - early Fall when they can utilize outdoor space). There is a Starbucks & 24 hr Walgreens across the street

title: Family trip to NYC
text: If you want to be in the center of the action in Times Square, this is your spot. The rooms were very clean. The staff was very attentive and nice. The only drawback is there is not much of a lobby or a bar area. There is really no room to hang out other than a few chairs near the check in desk. They have a small area with grab and go food (that was WAY overpriced!) Learned that the hard way. There is a rooftop bar for the over 21 crowd. The views are spectacular

title: Great Theater, Dining, and Shopping Convenience
text: If theater, great dining, and shopping are your goals, you're in walking distance of all! This hotel is in the best location for walking and people watching. Yet, when you want quiet, your room will be exactly what you need.

title: Good hotel at times square
text: Overall a nice medium grade hotel in a good location.  Hordes of tourists nearby as expected during Easter break for schools.  I wish coffee and tea are served in lobby but the room had keurug coffee pods.  Staff were nice and room was decent size considering the location.  Sheets and bathroom were cleaner than average hotel rooms.

title: Inadequate breakfast at a deteriorating hotel
text:
We have stayed here several times and left 5 star reviews but this time it has fallen to 2 stars. The main reason was the lack of breakfast options. The hotel restaurant has pretty much closed, leaving a ‘grab and go’ cafe with very limited options. We were forced to go out if we wanted a proper breakfast. You can order room service to be eaten on the site of the old restaurant but again the options were limited so we didn’t bother. 

Aside from this, our hotel room had become tired - it is in need of renovation due to several years of wear and tear (King Suite room 1501)

We raised our concerns about the restaurant and breakfast options to the manager before arrival, who seemed sympathetic, but ultimately there was no masking the fact that we were inconvenienced by the lack of an adequate breakfast offering, which he did nothing about, other than suggest room service at the site of the old restaurant.

title: Incredible Stay
text: We chose to stay at this property due its location to Times Square.  It was just half a block down to all the sites and sounds of Times Square.  We loved this property for it's location, and will be back due it's amazing rooms and property.  The staff was extremely helpful and responsive.

title: Excellent Times Square Hotel
text: We have stayed in or around Times Square many times when visiting family in NYC and the Hyatt Centric is by far the nicest.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are clean and in excellent condition.  Make sure you check out the rooftop bar.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great location for NYC first time visitor
text: Great location minutes from Grand Central Station and dining options. Short walk to the heart of Times Square. Staff very friendly and helpful. Nice room with minimal outside noise although in busy location. On-site restaurant was excellent. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Wonderful
text: I love the stay. The room was not huge, but the view was beautiful , it was nice & it was clean. The location was perfect . We took the train in from Philly and got there really early so they held our bags and even got us in our room around 1030,- 11 o’clock. One of the ladies from the front called me personally when something became available I couldn’t believe how early they were able to get us in. We were so glad to be able to rest & get ready for the show we were attending.

title: less than expected
text: for $400+ a night we got a bed with no sheets on it, the coffee-pods in our room were replaced only once in a 5 day stay, the hotel had no restaurant despite their representative telling us it did 2 days before we arrived, the room was very small and immediately adjacent to an elevator shaft so we got to listen to the sound of the elevator and its cables the entire time, the closet was inaccessible, the room window view was to an alley. The hotel's solution to all of this was for us to purchase a room upgrade. What a setup. The one and only positive: the room was very clean.

title: Great Hotel Fabulous Location
text: Stayed here with friends and was really impressed. Location is great and staff really friendly. The rooms are spacious and beds super comfortable. Had great views of Times Square. Fantastic shower room, great housekeeping and will definitely stay here again. Really close to subway, shops, restaurants and Bryant Park.

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: From the beginning to the last day of our stay, the doorman was wonderful! He was quick to get our things and our car with a smile the entire time.
