When I got to the front desk, our rooms weren’t ready yet which I kind of expected since I was early. I asked them to told my things while we go grab lunch. He was very professional and eager to assist with any questions I had. For the 3 days I was there, he remembered my name and always greeted me with a smile and addressed me as Ms. Sue. The staff was all very friendly. Our room was quiet and clean since we opted for a higher floor. The rooftop bar is nice but they are currently renovating the terrace so we were a little bummed not being able to go out on it. Next time we come to NYC again, I will definitely stay at Hyatt Centric again!

title: Excellent!
text: Our room was spacious, clean, quiet, and the hotel was within walking distance to Carnegie Hall, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, subway and bus stations, and various eateries. We took the Express bus from Newark Airport, got off at Bryant Park, walked a few minutes, and got to the hotel. It was our first time in NYC on our own and we felt safe and had no difficulty getting around. We paid a little extra for a room on a higher floor and it was definitely worth it! The elevators were super fast and we never had to wait long. Will definitely stay there again!

title: Really fantastic - adults, families, location…
text: Great location, cleanliness, safety (security on premise & attentive), and staff (front desk, guest services by phone, and housekeeping). An amazing find in NYC in general but especially near Time Square, Broadway shows, and restaurants, and yet without the noise when you are going “home” to rest. Bottled waters are included in daily fee without fuss and check-in staff are upfront about it and offer it— thank you! Best sleep we’ve had in awhile— I.e., great beds, bedding, lighting, & overall room comfort. Down to earth hotel & staff, yet modern/up-to-date. Excellent price.  Already recommended to friends & family. We will return whenever we are back in NYC. Thank you for making it a comfortable safe place away from home.

title: Really nice hotel! Great location!
text: Perfect location - Located right in Times Square - easy walking! Very nice hotel, great staff too. The coffee shop had delicious coffee but the food was just ok. Comfortable clean  room - beds were great.

title: Amazing views and customer service
text: Really enjoyed everything about our stay here, room was clean, people were friendly and the room was amazing I will be coming back here if I stay in Times Square again. We called down to ask if there was a microwave and we were told that they could bring one to our room, housekeeping was super friendly and helpful. Highly recommend

title: Great location great stay
text: I had a wonderful 3 day stay in NYC at Hyatt Time Square, it's located in such a convenient location, heart of the city, makes discovering NY very easy. All kinds of coffee shops, restaurants around. Friendly Staff, great gym too. Highly recommended!

title: Best Location
text:
The location is fantastic. It’s close to time square but at the same time bit off from the craziness. So you walk just 2 mins from the hotel and the Time Square madness starts. 

The front office staff is amazing and helpful. The concierge was an amazing gentle man. 

Lot of good restaurants, cafes, bars and theatres round.

title: Mediocre stay as a Globalist
text:
Hotel: the hotel itself was in a very prime location and close proximity to time square. We were able to walk nearly everywhere from the hotel and it was very convenient. Valet was available but we didn’t need it as we took a Lyft from the airport. 

Security: my family and I felt safe here. Downstairs, there were always Hyatt staff in the lobby confirming that we were staying there. I liked that the elevators had key card access

Food: Breakfast was served in the café downstairs and delivered to room. Our family enjoyed the free breakfast during out stay. Our orders had mistakes and missing items 2 days in a row but the last two days, the orders were accurate. If we had an error with our food, the kitchen was quick to send the food to our room.

Globalist recognition/Room: The most disappointing part of our trip. I used a suite upgrade award for my family of four and we were given a standard suite. According to Hyatt guidelines, a standard suite is reserved as a complimentary upgrade for Globalist members pending availability. Whenever I have used a suite upgrade award at other Hyatt properties, I have always been upgraded to a much larger suite. I spoke to the front desk person regarding this and they said that the larger suite was available but only if I paid extra for the suite. I was very shocked because I used a suite award prior to booking. My family was very cramped in the standard suite and we were not comfortable at all. I was also not happy with Hyatt booking us in a room with an adjoining door knowing that we had two children with us. I feel like I wasted my suite upgrade award on this trip and Hyatt Centric Times square. I was extremely disappointed and I wish I could have my suite upgrade award back as this award was not recognized the way it should have been.

Rooftop bar: The rooftop bar was closed unfortunately due to “winter” but the weather was beautiful when my fiancé and I went to the rooftop restaurant. We were also disappointed that one can of soda to go cost us $6.00! The café downstairs closes WAY too early and this hotel should provide options for snacks and drinks after hours. A vending machine would even suffice. 

Overall: my stay here was mediocre. I left this property expecting more and this was also my first time in a Hyatt Centric. I’m not too sure I will visit a Hyatt centric again unfortunately, as my stays at other Hyatt properties have treated me more like a Globalist than this property.

title: GREAT STAY
text: The proper00ty was clean and well lit.  My room was on on the corner of the 44th floor, but i had no problem with noise.  I had great views of Times Square.  The room was clean and spacious.  The bedding was clean and crisp.  Everything was just as i had expected.

title: Hyatt Centric
text: Upon arrival to the hotel, we was very disappointed that after traveling for a long period of time (we are international traveler's) we felt as if we was trying to be sold a room upgrade. This was inappropriate due to the time (2am uk times) and the fact we already had one in place. When booking the holiday with British Airways we was able to take advantage of the special offer which was a complimentary room upgrade if we booked before a certain date. The gentleman who was checking us in was very adamant and insisted we was wrong and that room upgrades are only available upon availability. I then had to look through my emails to prove that we was sold this complimentary room upgrade, in which he said that this is at fault of British Airways and I should email them as he does not see it on his system. This is definitely not what a customer wants to hear after traveling all day. I appreciate that a room upgrade given in the end, however upon check in we were made to feel gulled and un-welcomed. Apart from the check-in process everything else was as expected. The location of the hotel is superb.

title: Birthday Treat In The Big Apple 🍎
text: Wonderful stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. Everything from the Staff, King Suite, Bar54, bedding Quality, The Views and House Keeping was perfect we couldn't fault a thing. Thanks for a great 5 day break.

title: Very good experience
text: I went with my family to New York City for the first time and the hotel was better than expected. The location was less than a minute walk from Times Square. They upgraded our room at no extra cost on the 30th floor with a great view of the city. Room was modern with separate bath and shower. Very centralized for hopping on the subway to go uptown or downtown. I was expecting a very small room based on what people wrote in comments for New York City but it was a very nice hotel for the price.

title: Ideal location
text: Hotel is just off time square therefore the location is perfect, down a side street so nice and quiet, walk up thr street and you are in the centre of time square.  There was a lot of school kids around as they do use this hotel for school trips but they were no bother to us at all and didn't hear from them at night etc. You were just aware of them as they were often around the lobby area during the day.  Staff at hotel were all very nice and hotel nice and clean. Coffee machine and bottles of water in the rooms.  Would defo stay here again.

title: Great hotel
text: We will definitely use the Hyatt Centric Times Square on our next visit to New York.  The staff were super friendly and very helpful.  The rooms were clean and comfortable, however the crowning glory was the views from our bedroom window on the 45th floor.  The location was central to all the tourist attractions we had pre-booked.  It was also surprising how quiet the hotel was considering being so close to Times Square.

title: Amazing hotel in a great location
text: We stayed here for 5 nights as a couple on a trip to New York. I had previously stayed at the hotel and decided to return as I had such a great experience last time. The hotel is great, the location is amazing, literally minutes from Times Square but also on a street with less hustle and bustle! There is a Walgreens just opposite in case you need to grab anything. The rooms were very clean and I have never had a better night’s sleep than in the bed there, it was so comfy! House keeping replaced water everyday along with tea, coffee, bathroom amenities. The only downside was the rooftop bar outdoor terrace was closed (not sure why) so that was a bit disappointing, but other than that everything was amazing. Would definitely return the next time we visit NYC.

title: Nice rooms but not value for money
text:
This hotel has very nice, modern rooms, some quite spacious like
the king bed room on floor 29 that we had.  We paid to include
breakfast, but that was a mistake because the Market room where
the food is given out is not a restaurant.  There are no waiters and
most of the food is premade, in plastic containers in a large 
refrigerator. You even have to pour your own coffee. The prices are 
about twice what you would pay in nearby restaurants with actual 
table service.  

Elevators slow at busy times. One couple we saw waited about 9 minutes, 
then walked down from the 29th floor. We were more patient and the elevator
finally came after 3 more minutes.  One annoyance is a daily "Destination
fee" of about $34 which is added to the advertised room prices when you
check out.  It is mentioned in the fine print when you book, but many people
will only find out about it at checkout.  Good hotel but for the same money
you could get equally good rooms and a real breakfast at nearby hotels.
We would not stay there again.

title: Amazing location and excellent hotel staff
text: We saw three Broadway shows and took two tours and never had to get in to cab/taxi/uber. We were right in the middle of everything. The location was unbelievable. We just came and went all day long without a care. Shopping, eating, touring, it's all at your fingertips. The beds were comfortable, the showers were nice, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again upon a return trip.

title: Great midtown NYC hotel
text:
Great hotel for a weekend in NYC
The room was spacious and bathroom was a decent size.
The staff was very nice. We were told we could check in at 1:30pm and we arrived at 2pm and they said we had to wait and then they rectified the situation and gave us a room that was ready 
The rooftop Bar was a great spot to have a drink and. Enjoy the Manhattan sites

title: Overall good, with some caveats
text:
I was in NYC on business for over a week. Office is Times Square so I always want to stay within about a five minute walk. Previous experiences at another hotel had not been great, the most recent one involved water heavily leaking through the bathroom light fixture - so wanted to try another place with decent reviews. This hotel entrance is much better than some others, with a good sized lobby and adequate staff. Check-in was good but could have been better - why do I need to do the whole thing with a human instead of picking up room keys from a kiosk? Why do I even need room keys? 

On the good side, ironing board was close to full size and iron was great. Room size better than expected. Bed comfortable, sufficient towels for me to avoid room service my entire stay. In-room coffee (uses pods) was good enough and front desk gave me pods when I asked. Good that the hotel provides bottled water in the room. Desk chair not great, nor is the desk surface. Lighting controls were quirky but the blackout curtain worked well enough. Elevators and lobby could end up mobbed by huge groups - there was a group of perhaps a hundred kids with chaperones several days I was there and just getting an elevator between 6-9pm could take thirty minutes! Also, with rooftop bar, lots of folks using up precious elevators every evening.

title: Quick trip to NYC
text: Stayed 1 night at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. Hotel was nice, check in was smooth and quick. Had a 2 Queen room, room was very clean and comfortable. The only issue with this hotel is the elevators. They can be SLOW at times. We waited 25-30 minutes for an elevator the day we were leaving. We were told that a very large group was checking out and that was the reason. If the hotel knows that a large group will be checking out, they should assign them a liaison and designate 1 or 2 elevators for the group so that other guests want impacted so much, just a thought.

title: vistas tourists
text: We loved our stay here. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. We asked reception staff about an electric kettle and one was delivered to our room moments later !! Would definitely stay here again if visiting New York.

title: Good service and convenient
text: Perfect location, steps away to Time Square. Room is clean. Staffs are very friendly and offer good service. Bottled water and coffee is compliment. My family is happy about Hyatt and will stay there again if we visit New York in the future.

title: Birthday Break
text:
Totally exceptional in all areas
Highly recommended for its location and their ability to deliver such a wonderful service. Cleanliness of room and the maid service throughout our stay was thoroughly professional.

title: S. Jackson
text: Great location to a lot of venues and stores to shops. The check-in process went smoothly and they were able to store our luggage while we go out to shop around until our room was available. I will return.

title: Great experience
text: Great location. Just off Times Square. Easy in Easy out with Ubers. Close to everything and central to do what a tourist needs to do. If you are a walker, great central place to walk all over. We were on the 54th floor facing the H&M building and it was epic. Amazing views, kind staff. Room was clean and a great use of space. As a frequent traveler this hotel exceeded expectations. Gym was good and had 2 pelotons, free weights up to 50, kettlebells up to 40. Coffee bar in the base floor was very helpful for quick bites to eat.

title: Fabulous Times Square Stay
text: Loved this hotel! Welcoming and helpful staff, great little lobby, tons of amenities. Wish I had made it to the gym or bar, but the view from my 21st floor corner room was stunning and the heated bathroom floor so lovely in the snowy and very cold weather. Neat, clean, and modern. Great location with easy access to subway, Rockefeller Center, Broadway, etc. It was low season, so very reasonable but we will certainly be back another time for a stay. Food options in hotel limited, but a plethora right outside the door! Rooftop Bar 54 breathtaking look at Times Square.

title: Great hotel, oversized room was fantastic
text:
We loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again!  We booked an oversized queen room (for 2 adults and 1 child) and it was fantastic, so much extra space compared to a normal NYC hotel room. 

Pros
- very friendly customer service at front desk
- excellent location, one minute walk and you’re in the middle of Times Square!  3 min walk to the Lion King
- luggage storage available, no charge
- very comfortable beds and our floor was very quiet, we didn’t hear any neighbours etc
- store on main level was very convenient, but wish it was open longer hours (closed early Sunday/Monday)
- Starbucks and pharmacy directly across the road and McDonalds right on the corner was also super convenient
- free water and in room coffee was great, as well as the mini fridge
- very clean and spacious room, housekeeping was excellent and very attentive, and toiletries in our room were refreshed daily so we never ran out of anything (shampoo, conditioner, body wash, soap and lotion were all very good quality)
- also brought us robes and shower caps upon request
- good security at elevator to ensure only guests accessing the hotel, provided added level of comfort 

Cons
- elevator issues our first day so it took forever to get an elevator, but luckily it was fixed by our second day.  It took 20 mins+ to get an elevator down and we were late for our dinner reservation…  so we would have been really frustrated had this issue continued any longer.  
- no concierge, we asked for recommendations one day but were given a very generic answer… so we used trip advisor for everything after that!!

title: Great place to stay right in Times Square!!
text: Love this hotel!  Love the people who work there! You can't ask for a better location. The staff at the hotel were so kind and helpful. You could tell that they love their jobs. Best customer service I've had in a long time. We stayed in a suite with a King bed. It was so spacious and super clean. Despite being right at Times Square, it was very quite. The housekeeper and the front desk staff were awesome.  The only thing I wouldn't recommend is Bar 54. They advertise the 'best selfie' from the deck but the deck was closed and is closed all winter, so we weren't allowed to go out there. We also didn't have a seat by the window, which we had requested. I understand that just because we request a window seat doesn't automatically guarantee that we'll get one, but there were seats available and we were not allowed to switch (reason stated: they were filled up with reservations). However, when other people came in after us and asked to move seats, they were re-seated... and by the time we left (1 1/2 hours later when our time was up), there were still a ton of seats available.  Despite that, I still give the hotel 5 stars. I didn't let that one experience ruin my stay!

title: Some hits, more misses
text:
Pros:
- location: if you want to be in tourist central, this hotel can’t be beaten.
- cleanliness: housekeeping is excellent and efficient, our room was cleaned to a high standard daily.
- Quiet: despite being close to Times Square, our room was very quiet, no problems sleeping.

Cons:
- location: also a con as the hotel is basically IN Times Square with all the attendant problems (smell of drugs, loudness, bouncers in the lobby 24/7 presumably to keep guests safe).
- room quality: the room is pretty tired. Bedding and duvet are the thinnest I’ve ever seen. Blood stains (admittedly tiny) on the bedding were a particular low point. 
- Amenities: there are none! No in-room dining option other than grabbing a bag of food from the ludicrously pricey downstairs deli. No restaurant at all. No glasses in the room, just plastic cups. 

This hotel has generally strong reviews. I’m not sure why. Perhaps this review is more a reflection of us than the hotel but we wouldn’t stay again.

title: NYC visit
text: Great location to Times Square and Broadway shows. The room was very clean and spacious (for NY) enough for our family of 3. Noise was minimal and it was a great place to rest at the end of the day. Will stay again when we visit next!

title: Fabulous
text: Excellent location, two minutes walk from Time Square. Coffee shop, deli, bars and restaurants right on the doorstep. Staff could not do enough for you. Hotel was clean and excellent value for money. Would have no hesitation in recommending

title: Nice room conditions, but no breakfast
text: The room conditions and views (especially in high floors over 30th floor which costs more) are awesome. But do not expect any dining experience here; this hotel does not have a full restaurant for breakfast, and the breakfast room service is absolutely overpriced for the value.

title: Quiet, clean, friendly!
text: Smack dab in the middle of Times Square action. Amazing staff, comfy beds, big rooms and so quiet! Loved the big bathroom with walk in shower and the option for 2 queen beds. Most NYC hotel rooms are cramped but this one was roomy. TV was easy to sync up to our phone to steam movies. Our new favorite NYC  hotel!

title: Excellent stay
text: This was an excellent stay. I want to thank the Housekeeping staff in particular for going above and beyond to anticipate my needs, but all staff members were helpful and friendly. Location in Mid-town Manhattan was excellent.

title: First time in New York
text: Our first time in New York. We weren’t sure where to stay, friends recommended Grenwich, Chelsea or Soho. We’re glad we stayed here though, in the middle of everything we wanted to do and can easily get subway everywhere. Hotel was spot on, nice room, nice bathroom (shower is fantastic, very powerful), nice staff. Only complaint would be the pillows, they go flat as a pancake! Would definitely recommend to others.

title: Great room, friendly staff, wonderful location
text: If you're looking for a place to stay near the Theater District, look no further than the Hyatt Centric Times Square! It's one of the few hotels that offers rooms with two queen beds, which makes it a perfect place for a trip with a friend or a small family. The room was spacious and clean. Very friendly, knowledgeable staff. Great coffee shop on the first floor and beautiful, destination bar on the top floor. Highly recommend!

title: exceptional service
text: superb location, couldn't ask for better!  the staff was fantastic, courteous, happy to help, available, was greeted every time I walked through the lobby.   Room was clean and  comfortable.   My son slept like a baby hugging the pillows!  Will definitely stay again,  thank you Team Hyatt, you are awesome

title: Clean, comfortable hotel in heart of Times Square
text: Sparkling clean, comfortable room and accommodating staff made for a wonderful overnight stay. The location is right in Times Square which was very convenient. We arrived in the city around 11 and stopped at the hotel to store our bags until check-in. We were pleasantly surprised when woman at the desk told us our room was ready and we could check in early! The rooms have water and coffee. My only complaint about this hotel is the destination fee which I think is a waste of money for most people. Overall, it was a great hotel experience and I would stay here again during our next visit.

title: Nice rooms, great housekeeping, mediocre lobby experience.
text: I'll keep it short and simple.  Front desk staff friendly.  Housekeeping friendly and efficient.  Security guards not very friendly, nor do they treat you like a guest.  Makes you feel like you're in a jewelry store shopping.

title: Hyatt times square
text: Appeared like a 3 star not a 4.5 star. Lobby was average. No assistance to bring luggage to room. No robes and slippers in room had to request. No hot water when showering. The hallway and room smelled like food. Can hear outside and street noise. Close to Times Square convenient location. Lots of charging ports in room. Expensive for what you get.

title: Amazing Time at Hyatt Centric Times Square
text: I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough.  It's perfectly situated and the whole experience was fantastic.  We were on the 45th floor and the view was incredible. The room was a good size, very clean and modern, with a big comfortable bed.  The staff were really friendly and helpful and we loved Bar 54 and their amazing cocktails!  Thank you so much to everyone there - we would return in a heartbeat...

title: Excellent location, large rooms, helpful staff
text: We really loved our stay at Centric Times Square. Everything requested was provided with a smile and the staff was incredibly helpful. We stayed in a suite which was large and beautiful. Bed was very comfy. The location is a half block from Times Square, you just couldn't beat it, in my opinion.

title: Nice hotel for a quick business visit
text: Stayed at this location for 2 days (1 night) and will be visiting again should I need to be in the Time Square area. Attentive staff, and rooms a small box as some other hotels in the city. Everything was clean, just what was needed for the trip.

title: Splendido soggiorno
text: L'Hotel si trova in posizione eccellente per visitare NYC. La vicinanza con Times Square consente di uscire agevolmente alla sera e di raggiungere in breve tempo la metropolitana o i bus. Le camere sono spaziose, con molta luce e pulite. I letti sono confortevoli e garantiscono un ottimo sono. Mi sento vivamente di consigliare questo hotel.

title: Surprisingly spacious and quiet
text:
A lovely experience overall with great and accommodating staff. 

First time staying with Hyatt (I am usually a Hilton fan) but was staying here for a work event and like I said was pleasantly surprised by how quiet the hotel was. The rooms were spacious with upgraded bathrooms and nice amenities and for being right next to timed square you do not hear much street noise.

title: Family break
text: Lovely family break. Excellent location on Times Square. As a family of 4 (2 teenage boys) we stayed in a 2 queen room bit more spacious on a higher floor. Bathroom was nice and big. Rooms were serviced every day. Staff all very friendly. Rooftop bar pleasant. NYC is very expensive so after researching other hotels this was the most reasonable for the room we had in the location. Would definitely return

title: Lovely
text: We had a double queen room with a bathtub which we were told is a bit more spacious than usual. We were on the 53rd floor and the view was nice. It was fun to see the weather for the day- fog, sunny and snow flurries. Elevators were fast since they were dedicated to upper or lower floors. The many lights were controlled by number of switches but they were all well labeled which was super helpful. You call in breakfast orders and they’re delivered to your room. We only did this once during our three night stay. The breakfast was hardy but our scramble was supposed to come with bacon and it didn’t. Fruit included was a whole red apple and a banana. They serve until 12noon which was nice since we slept in.  The rain shower and long bathtub we’re great and we had plenty of towels for the family. Since we were late risers housekeeping always greeted us and checked if we were ready for them which was nice. Beds were firm and pillows were comfortable. Mini fridge was handy for left overs and ice was available on every floor. There’s security at the entrance checking room keys which was reassuring. Our last day we were able to store our bags until our flight for free. The location made it easy to visit all the places we needed to be between Central Park and Soho. All in all a great stay and we look forward to returning!!

title: Excelent hotel, service and location
text: Todo perfecto, como esperado. Por poner algún "pero" diría que el sistema que tienen para el desayuno es tipo "market", mucho mas caro y escaso que el tipo "buffet", yendo con familia este último es mucho mas práctico y asequible.

title: Consistently Excellent
text: Consistency is the word that best describes this Hyatt.  It is always clean, and I have found the staff to always be friendly and efficient.  The location is central and convenient, and the security staff is excellent as well.  The roof top bar and staff are awesome.

title: Stay at Hyatt Centric - Times Square NY
text: Excellent hotel to stay just few steps away from NY Time Square. Very attractive cost and elegant building and rooms. Clean rooms and great attention from hotel staff. I would love to see a more formal restaurant, but the area is full of restaurants around, no issues at all.

title: Feb stay
text:
Stone throw away from Time Square, despite this there was barely any noise from street heard in bedroom.
Staff were helpful, esp on checkout. Offered to secure luggage after 11am checkout. Offered water etc whenever needed. Offered to book transport if required.

title: Excellent stat
text: My family and I recently stayed here in one of the larger/high floor rooms and it was exceptional! I've never had such a spacious room in midtown nyc. The room was very clean and quiet. The bathroom was big and had both a shower and a tub. Housekeeping was excellent and the front desk was friendly and helpful. Perfect 4 day stay. Will definitely stay here again.

title: First timer in New York, great hotel!
text: Great hotel, we stayed on the 41st floor with 2 queen size beds, bath tub and separate shower booked via BA package holiday. Great size rooms and very clean. Close to everything, time square is literally just around the corner, lots of subway entrances (use google maps to determine which line to take and therefore would direct to closest entrance). Would stay here again. Great Wi-Fi connection too.

title: Bware!
text: If you book during holiday weekend please try to get in as soon as possible. I booked 2 queen bed a month in advance only to find out at check in the could not honor it and my son had to sleep on a rolll up bed

title: Great hotel in a great location !
text: This hotel was booked through a British Airways holiday package. My wife & I stayed for a 6 night city break and were very impressed with both the standard of the hotel & amenities as well as the friendly & knowledgeable staff. The hotel is a 1 minute walk from Times Square and very close to the subway. Would definitely recommend!

title: Great hotel for family city break
text: Great hotel for family break. Great location for all midtown sights. Hotel feels modern, room was very clean and a good size for 2 adults and 2 children. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. Well worth paying a bit extra for a room on floor 40 or higher…the floor to ceiling windows give breathtaking views!

title: Best hotel in NYC!
text: If you are looking for large rooms, family oriented hotel and close to Times Square this is your place. Was very clean, staff was super polite and you are in walking distance of everything. They also have great security to make sure quests are safe.

title: Great place to stay in the heart of the city
text: Stayed here for a quick weekend trip to NYC. The hotel is just a short walk from Grand Central Station and half a block from Times Square. Room was clean and comfortable. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent stay near Time Square
text: First time visiting this hotel. It is located on 45th street very close to timesquare and other attractions mid town. Hotel is still very new and everything was working as expected. Roomy room for NYC standards. We did not get to try the breakfast nor the market or the rooftop bar, but will defniitely go back soon.

title: Hotel close to time square
text: This hotel is only a few steps away from the time square, it is really close to the downtown area. I used a suite upgrade award in this hotel.  Although the room is in the lowest floor, the sound proofing is quite good. The decorations are quite modern and new, it is a good place to stay near the time square. The only pity is that the breakfast is served in a cafe which doesn’t have any continental breakfast option.

title: Amazing 5 days in New York
text: Myself, husband and two sons stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square for 5 nights in February.  Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, everyone was really helpful and friendly.  The hotel itself is lovely, very clean and modern with towels changed daily.  The beds were super comfy. Great location.  Would definitely return if in New York City.

title: Great property in the middle of everything.
text: Not a perfect place but pretty fantastic. If you want a city view, pay for high city unless it’s basically a billboard. A few steps from pretty much anything. Staff is friendly. Rooms are clean. Shower pressure is good.

title: Weekend with family at Times Square
text:
Wanted a hotel in Times Square and spacious for a family
Of four. This hotel was clean,
Spacious and comfortable. The oversized room allowed for
A big bathroom
With both a shower
And tub. We would recommend this hotel which was in close proximity to
Everything.

title: Superbe!
text: Situation exceptionnelle, à 2 pas de Time Square mais très calme. Très grande chambre avec vue incroyable au 38. Un personnel aux petits soins ( merci encore pour les ballons d anniversaire😁), souriant et qui a à coeur de vous faire passer un séjour inoubliable. Salle de sport propre. Possibilité de commander des petits déjeuners en chambre, copieux et variés : le top pour démarrer une journée de visite🤩. Merci encore!

title: A special place
text:
I'm just back from 4 nights at the Hyatt Centric Times Square  staying in a terrace suite on the 40th floor
The bed was comfortable, the living room,while small was perfect with a comfy sofa and a 2nd tv with lots of movie and entertainment & sport channels and ppv
You won't be using that  too much but you can and that's what's important 
I had been watching 'The last of us' at home and caught the latest episode on HBO for example
There's a fridge too,so you can take back some food from the stores or eat take out from and host friends there
It's unusual not to have an in-house restaurant but honestly the coffee shop off the lobby did the nicest and healthiest of breakfast rolls and similar for later
You can also order in
Location : Everything is in walking distance 
The front desk team were superb and friendly,such consumate professionals who remembered my name as I'd come back after a long day out and were so free with their time and enthusiastic with you if you needed something 
Management and Hyatt should be really proud
Next door there's a super Irish pub that does quality food
Across the street there's a Starbucks and a 2 minute walk and you're in the heart of times square with a myriad of other eating options plus the obvious things to see and do
I could go on but suffice to end by saying I'll be back
and in a nutshell I loved this place

title: Small space that needs updating
text: The hotel was in a prime location to Times Square. However, the bed was uncomfortable, the bathroom configuration was really small. The shower head was spewing water in different directions other than the one direction it needed to go. It just wasn’t worth the price that was paid for the location.

title: Great hotel, top Location: beware Destination Fee
text:
Well appointed rooms: quiet, and we really enjoyed choice of Tub or Shower. 
Only gripe was Destination Fee, which we were not able to credit against Breakfast nor Bar 54…..in England we would call this extortion

title: Terrible Front Desk agent
text: Overall the staff were friendly and the hotel location is excellent and the facility is satisfactory. But the front desk agent greet us with no smile and simply told us there was no room ready when we arrive at the hotel early having taken a red eye flight. This agent didn’t offer any help, didn’t check with house keeping, didn’t let me speak to a manager as I had requested  and just simply said that the “guaranteed check in time is 4pm” while there were clearly rooms available. This is the weekend that NYC had a minus 15 degree windchill , but I felt colder standing at the front desk.  I am even one of Hyatt’s elite members, imaging how she would treat a random traveler who might just be walking into the hotel?

title: Enjoyed our stay!
text:
We came into the city for one night and decided to stay at Hyatt's Centric brand.  I've never stayed at one of the Centric hotels and wanted to experience how it compared to Hyatt's other brands. In my opinion, this Centric is a step up from a Hyatt Place or a Hyatt House. We were staying on points so not sure what the rate would have been. 

Upon entering the hotel, the lobby is very small with one sitting area to the left. Eva at the front desk welcomed us as Hyatt discoverist members and quickly checked us in at 12:30pm. We were thrilled that our room was ready so early and she also offered us a 2:00pm checkout the next day (perk for being a Hyatt member). 

Our room was on the 46th floor with floor to ceiling windows and a great city view. The room was a decent size considering hotel rooms in nyc are usually tiny. The room was clean, had a decent size closet, nice clean bathroom and four bottles of complimentary water. The bathroom also had a floor to ceiling window but had a shade for privacy. 

There is a rooftop bar that is open from 4:00pm-midnight but unfortunately we did not get a chance to utilize it. There is also a coffee shop to the left of the lobby that had some nice sandwiches, salads, specialty coffee's etc. 

The location is perfect for midtown. We drove in and found parking a block from the hotel ($63 for 24 hours). The hotel is less than a block away to Broadway. There is a Starbucks and Walgreens directly across the street and a million places to dine and explore. 
 
We would definitely stay at this hotel again next time we need to be in midtown!

title: Nice big, modern, clean rooms with a view of Time Square
text: The rooms are  big, modern and very clean and has a good view of the Paramount Building and of Time Square. The bathroom and rooms was very clean. The Bed was comfortable and large. The Staff were friendly and accommodative and gave us extra water to drink, whenever needed. Can highly recommend.

title: NYC 2023
text: Great location. Large rooms for NYC. Clean rooms with nice views. Staff was amazing. Just steps from Times Square and the Theater district. Only downside was breakfast grab and go, but I get it. It’s NYC and there’s a lot to pack in in a day so why waste an hour or so eating breakfast in a dining room.

title: Great experience
text:
We enjoyed short stay of two days. The staff was friendly; Diana at front desk guest services was quite welcoming. The room was clean and request for room supplies was met quickly, The location worked out great as most of the viewing attractions are within 15-20 minutes walk if you can or reachable by transit. 
Overall, highly satisfied and recommended.

title: Nice Hotel and Very Courteous Staff - Avoid Corner Room on Windy Days
text:
This Hyatt is literally only 1/2 a block away from Times Square and the theater district.  We could very easily walk everywhere, including to a restaurant we had at a Michelin restaurant located in Hell's Kitchen - about a 15 minute walk.   Staff was very friendly, gracious, and accommodating. We felt very welcome, and the proximity to Time Square and Broadway is hard to beat.

The rooms were clean and nicely furnished - though an extension cord might be nice to pack as the number of plugs is a little limited depending on which side of the bed you're on.  The rooms were decently sized for a NYC hotel, with all the usual amenities - in-room safe, refrigerator, free Wi-Fi, shampoo/conditioner/body wash, etc.  Each room is equipped with a shower, which has a rainfall shower head in the ceiling, and a hand-held sprayer you could switch to on demand.

We initially had a corner room, which was larger than the regular sized rooms, and the bathroom for the corner units have heated floors, which was a really nice touch since we were in NYC on one of the coldest days ever.  Air temp of 2 degrees F, wind chill of -15 degrees F.  The drawback of the corner room was that if the wind was blowing a certain way, there would be a "tea kettle" whistling effect that could be heard almost constantly throughout the night.  I sleep very soundly, so I didn't hear it until perhaps 4-5 a.m.  My wife and daughter heard the whistling sound all night.

We asked the front desk to change our room for the next day, which they did to the room next door.  This was not a corner room - thus no heated bathroom floor.  We could hear the whistling effect in the corner room while moving our luggage to the new location, but it was quiet in the new room.  Fortunately, the tea kettle effect was just confined to the corner room.  This is a nice hotel, with super fast elevators - a plus.  The elevators are so fast that you can feel the air pressure change in your ears.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Always a pleasure to stay at this hotel. Rooms are fantastic and we recommend the 40th floor suites with terrace - the bedroom / living room aspect is excellent and the view from terrace is absolutely fabulous!

title: Great business hotel in midtown
text: Great property for business travel.  Have stayed at nearly all Marriott properties in midtown, and this is the best for experience at a reasonable price point.  This will be my go to for visits to New York.  Room is spacious for Manhattan, not tripping over things.  Standup shower, wireless charging, decent desk are nice features.  Like how you can check in entirely on mobile and skip the front desk for check in.

title: Great room, staff & location
text: My daughter (24) and I spent 5 nights in a oversized, 2 queen bed, high floor room.  This was her first time in NYC so we had a big list: sights, museums and tickets for 3 shows.  Location was perfect and more importantly, the room was neat, very clean, updated & included a small fridge, Keurig, lots of outlets, plenty of closet & drawer space, a separate shower and soaker tub and very large windows.  Not a lot of hangers for 2 women and we didn't have the robes that were supposed to be included with  our room but I am sure if we would have asked, they would have brought them. We are pretty self sufficient so we didn't need any assistance or concierge service but found the front & housekeeping staff to be very professional and very friendly.  Also enjoyed the cocktails and staff at the rooftop bar!  Will definitely return here on future trips- I think for the price category and Times Sq area location, it is a great find!

title: Best Stay Ever!
text: I'm not a frequent traveler, but often enough. This was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had! The service -- from check-in to check-out -- was exceptional! Staff were friendly and very helpful, especially with helping us catch cabs. Our rooms were very clean, beds were comfortable, and we had a fabulous view of Times Square! Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great location!
text:
My 3 daughters and I stayed at the hotel for one their birthdays. We upgraded our 2 double bed room to a high floor room on the 53rd floor which was great. The last night we moved to a suite on floor 18. The suite was beautiful, but the noise from the street was surprisingly loud..The springs in the pull out bed in the living room was also extremely noisy and you can feel the springs through the mattress. We all decided that the double bed room on a higher floor was the way to go. 

There is a great cafe attached to the hotel but unfortunately it closes early and you can’t get any late night food from it. But, it’s New York, there are still plenty of food delivery options.

Gym was nice and clean. If we would have been there in the summer we probably would have missed having a pool. 

Overall great hotel with a great location for what we wanted to do.

title: Brilliant location, immaculate rooms, accommodating staff.
text: Fantastic location, lovely room,  friendly and accommodating staff. Considering where the hotel is located - the rooms are extremely quiet! The only reason we did not give 5 stars is due to the lack of room service or restaurant which would have been lovely for breakfasts.

title: Great Location!
text: Such a fun location for a first time in New York CIty.  Room was really great, plenty of space, clean and comfortable.  Staff was friendly, kind and great!  Take advantage of opportunity for guests to visit the 54th floor everyday at 10:30, amazing views and great pictures!

title: New York Weekend Trip
text: Hotel was very clean and staff was extremely polite, courteous and helpful. I fully recommend this location to be close to Times Square. The workout room had the latest equipment and the hallways were clean and quiet. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms had heated flooring, an added plus!

title: Great location and great hotel for families.
text:
Great location for sight seeing…clean, modern & tidy.

Great staff who offered good recommendations.

Would recommend higher room for the views.

We chose this hotel mainly because we are a family of 4 and the beds were queen size so bigger than other hotels, double beds always annoy me in hotels they are far too small.

The bar looked great but unfortunately we couldn’t visit because we had children.

Great little shop within the hotel which offered food and drink .

title: Good location
text: A good location for a short stay in Manhattan. The room was clean and well maintained and the staff were very helpful. I was disappointed at the lack of a proper restaurant but not a big problem given the number of options available locally. My biggest gripe is paying a $34 daily resort fee for ‘benefits’ I neither wanted or needed (15% off valet parking - really!) I used none of the alleged benefits but still had to pay for them which is just a con. Next time I will look forward accommodation without this fee.

title: Mr
text: I have been last week, and I can say that the hotel is my best that I have stayed in New York, for the first time that I have had the room exactly the one I booked!!  I often come to New York and I can afford to say that it is much better than the Sheraton that I have stayed in a lot !!!  the room was spotless, the staff was really friendly!!!  Thank you and continue to give this kind of welcome!!  it will be my favorite hotel!!  Thank you

title: Perfect as always
text: This was my 6th stay at this incredible hotel and I can honestly say it just gets better every time. I go to NYC every year to enjoy a week of theatre, museums and as much as I can fit in during my stay. I travel solo on this trip and have always felt extremely safe, comfortable and looked after during my stays here. Everyone on the staff from top management to everyone in between goes out of their way to be as kind, helpful and welcoming as possible. I wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else as the Hyatt Centric Times Square has truly become my home away from home. Already looking forward to returning next January!

title: Great Location - one block from Times Square
text: This was my first stay at a Hyatt property - the room was very clean, bed was very comfortable and the view from the 52nd floor was fantastic! Great location for seeing Broadway plays 5-10 minute walk to many theatres.

title: Nice location in NYC Times Square area
text: Really nice location for attending NRF. Nice, modern accommodations. Bar on the 54th floor is really nice and has a balcony with an awesome view. The Fitness center is nice with dumbbells, benches, machines, treadmills, ellipticals, and bikes.

title: Atendimento impecavel
text: Tirei 35 dias de férias, passamos por 3 estados e 4 hoteis, Hyatt NY foi minha melhor experiência. Um atendimento diferenciado e limpeza do quarto impecável. A localização do hotel é excelente (entre brodway e 6th ave). O vallet é um pouco apertado pra uma via estreita (46th) e o preço um pouco salgado ($90), mas fui muito bem atendido,.

title: Wonderful experience!
text: I’m so happy we choose this hotel! Our flight landed much earlier than our check in time but the staff were so  accommodating and kind that we had a place to stay and rest as soon as our arrival. 10/10 would recommend this to anyone visiting NY and want to be closely located to all the tourist attractions!

title: Great stay with teenagers
text: My teenage daughters and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hyatt Centric. Great location. Very clean. Service was great. Rooftop bar was very expensive but a nice adult evening nightcap option. Highly recommend.

title: Great spot for a weekend trip
text: Fantastic location. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean. Would definitely stay here again.  Right at Times Square. Perfect location for a weekend trip to see some shows and do some sightseeing. Room was ready early which was so nice.  Irish pub next door with good food and friendly staff. Starbucks across the street. And a market and rooftop bar at hotel.

title: Incredible
text: We had a great visit to this hotel, welcomed by very friendly staff, our room was a lot bigger than expected with a beautiful view of Times Square. It’s in a great location and has all the amenities you could need.

title: Housekeeping destroyed our shower!
text:
A couple days into our stay we came back at around midnight from a day visiting the city, to find that our shower handle (used to turn the shower on/off) had been unscrewed and removed, taken away presumably by housekeeping.

I tried calling the front desk using the in-room telephone that I had used the day before, but to my surprise the front desk number had been erased from our telephone. It seems whoever took our shower handle away also went to the trouble of erasing the number so that we would have to go downstairs to get help. It's absolutely insane!

The hotel then moved us to another room in the same floor, which was appreciated.

The other interactions with staff were OK, but based on this interaction I cannot recommend this hotel.

As an aside, the pillows in this hotel were rubbish. The bed was good though!

title: Enjoyable Hotel, Fun Location!
text: We came to New York to enjoy my girlfriend's birthday and this Hyatt New York Centric property really helped us enjoy a memorable weekend experience. All of the staff we interacted with - front desk, doorman, onsite restaurant T45 staff, Bar 54 staff, housekeeping - were positive, responsive and professional. We booked a city view room and would highly recommend enjoying that visual amenity. Bar 54 located on the 54th floor offered good drinks and yummy appetizers plus offers a great city view from bar table, and even better view when venturing out to the open air balcony. (We were there January 7 and enjoyed looking down at the famed New Year Eve's ball!). Our room service breakfast was served in a bag and was yummy, enjoyable and nicely casual. And maybe best hotel asset of all is the location which is in the ttheatre district and extra short walk to Times Square.

title: Very Happy with our stay at Hyatt Centric Time Square
text: This location is wonderful. If the budget allows, get the terrace suite…absolutely wonderful views. The staff, overall, were accommodating from start to finish. We will be staying here again on our next visit.

title: Great
text: Great stuff, very customer oriented, clean , location is great for tourists, offers extra features for same charge, rooms are larger compare to other hotels in the city, attractive price and still a great quality of product

title: Just perfect
text: We stayed on the 42nd floor, looking over time square and it was breathtaking. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful, the room was clean. I don’t have a bad word to say about my experience. The view was so good we would, bring take out back to the room and eat their.

title: A great place to stay.
text: Checked in on 2nd January 2023 for a City break. The hotel itself is situated just up the street from where it's all happening for tourists at Times Square and fast food etc is a stone throw away. There are loads of sights to see all within walking distance for a relatively fit person, even after a mince pie filled Christmas like me. Upon entering the hotel we were greeted fairly warmly by the workers and first impressions were good. We stayed on the 46th floor and the room was lovely with impressive views even in January in the rain. All the modern tech worked well, coffee machine, WiFi, TV, Iron etc were all brilliant. The bathroom was spotless and the room was maintained well upon leaving for the day. The rooftop views at the bar are jaw dropping and was a nice ambience about the place. We ordered a breakfast bagel for room service which was amazing and well timed, although a bit on the expensive side, I guess that's paying for convenience and taking into acount that New York is the most expensive city in the world right now and definitely the most wallet bashing I've ever been to. I didn't feel any awkwardness about tipping in the hotel due to the fact that upon arrival they inform you that there is a destination charge which I've interpreted as cover the tips for the workers. This is $30 dollars a day so be prepared, on checkout, with our Bagel room service the final bill was $200 ish dollars which was a sickened but again, that's nothing against the hotel, from what I gather and experienced, ist the going rate to stay in the city. Overall the stay was pleasant and if I can ever afford to go back I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. A point worth noting is that there is a nice Irish pub right next door to finish the busy days of sightseeing of with a drink.

title: A Room and Bathroom That Exceeded My Expectations
text: The room at this property was outstanding! Contemporary, large, comfortable with abundant lighting. The bathroom blew me away. One of the best hotel showers I have experienced with two shower heads (rain and handheld). Plus, the bathroom floor was heated! I thoroughly enjoyed my two nights in that room.

title: Perfect hotel where the action is!
text: Excellent location if you want all the action of Times Square. Close to all subways, theaters and many restaurants. Clean, comfortable rooms and helpful staff. Great rooftop restaurant but missing the downstairs casual restaurant for sitting. You have to ‘grab n go’ prepackaged items or order room service for breakfast…or have to go out and bring back what you want.

title: Excelente
text: Fue excelente nuestra estadía. La habitación cómoda y limpia, tenía de todo y las camas cómodas. Excelente localización al lado de Times Square. El staff muy atento. 100% recomendado de seguro regresamos.

title: perfect stay!
text:
the room and hotel were very clean overall, location to times square is excellent, approximately 1/2 block. 
 The staff was very helpful.  Bar 54 was an excellent addition to our stay!!  A wonderful place to stay, will definitely come again.

title: Don’t stay here - go to Mariott or Hilton instead
text: They tried to charge us for 2 rooms but we had already paid for one on Expedia and it took an hour for them to sort out. They were rude and tried to make us pay the different room rates because they checked our guest into the wrong room that was at a higher rate. It’s a bummer because the hotel was nice, but the customer service ruined it

title: Perfect hotel
text: Central to Times Square, literally everything we needed and more. Beds so comfy, amazing view from the room, roof top bar was amazing. High floor room as requested and a birthday touch for my partner!  Perfect!! Thank you

title: Great stay
text:
Traveled w/my 19yr old daughter from 12/28-12/30 to see Hamilton & Phantom of the Opera on Broadway.  We were tired from a redeye flight that was booked last minute on Delta thx to Southwest Air cancelling our original flight in what I call the awful “Southwest Air Meltdown of 2022”.  So, our arrival into NY around 9am was not planned.  Uber ride from Laguardia to hotel was fast and we walked into the hotel at 10am not optimistic that a room would be available.  

Indeed, there were no rooms available for an early check in.  We were able to leave our luggage there, however, and went to explore the city.  Received a notification around 2pm that room was ready so that was nice.

We had a 2queen room on the 20 th floor.  The room view was blah but not a big deal.  There was a mini fridge and Keurig in the cabinet below the tv.  Beds were comfy and there was plenty of storage space.  No upgrade available as my booking was thru Amex The Hotel Collection but those are not guaranteed.  They did deliver a bottle of small pinot and wine glasses to our room which was appreciated!

Utilized the bfast room service once, as I had credit through Amex The Hotel Collection, which I was thankful for as the menu is limited and pricey!! My order came within 20min of calling - super fast! It was packed great with all condiments.  In fact, I didnt notice that my side of sausage was missing until I received a knock at the door 10min after delivery and a staff member with the missing item apologizing for not including it!  Ordered the pancakes, egg scramble with side of sausage and juices.  It was hot and good and I liked that we could dine in the room.  Wish there was an all day room service option!  

When I didnt want the room cleaned one morning, the staff member still gave me extra bottled water, coffee and tea pods, cups, and face towels and asked if I needed anything else.  Great service.

I will def return if visiting the area again and the price is right.  This was the most cost effective choice of The Hotel Collection offerings and the location was great.  The only downside is the lack of an onsite restaurant and the rooftop dining is 21+.  I traveled with my 19yr old daughter so this was not ideal, but theres so much nearby within walking distance.

title: Excellent location, excellent hotel
text: Visited NYC for 3 nights to kick off the new year. This hotel lived up to the many positive reviews. We arrived on an early flight, and without hesitation got us into an available room well before our check in time. That allowed us to rest, freshen up and get the most out of our day. It is more a boutique type hotel in my opinion - so the lobby is small; however, I actually preferred this. Elevators are quick - not much waiting around. Staff were super friendly. The room was spotless and spacious. I’ve read some reviews about the noise. I mean, it is NYC - and Times Square at that - but did not prevent us from sleep or take away from the experience. Finally, the best feature is that it is steps away from Times Square - location, location, location. I would not hesitate to stay here in any future NYC trips.

title: Favorite NYC hotel
text: I’ve been to NYC a many times and this is my favorite hotel to stay at. The staff is super friendly and rooms were very clean. Our room attendant was amazing. She greeted us in the mornings and asked if we needed anything in addition. Service like you would want!

title: Great stay in NYC!
text: Our family thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the rooms and service was great. The fitness room was well equipped and I enjoyed using the Peloton. We also enjoyed a visit to the rooftop bar - amazing view of the city.

title: Disappointed
text:
Only one place to go for food (breakfast cafe)  really bad customer service, received somewhat racial discrimination from the cashier. 
Terrible housekeeping service. 
Will not stay again at this location.

title: Great location with a nice vibe!
text:
We stayed here right after the New Year!  I thought NYC would be a bit quieter after the holidays, but boy was I wrong.   The Hyatt was a nice respite from the crowds.  We stayed here a few years ago and we were just as happy with our accommodations this time as last.  The lobby is a bit small, but very sufficient.  The valets were attentive.  We drove so we had a car to be parked.  There was a bit of a wait to check in.  As I mentioned NYC was very busy and many large groups were checking in, so the wait was understandable and another staff member was added to the desk to quicken the process.  

Our room was a 1 bedroom suite.  It was perfect for us.  We had the king size bedroom and our teen had the pullout sofa in the other room.  It was spacious and comfortable.  Nice TVs in both rooms. The bathroom and shower were very good.  The view was ok, but it’s Time Square.  Lots of building roofs.  My only complaint was the ice machine had some kind of black stuff coming out with the ice.  We called the front desk and they promptly sent up a bag of ice from the kitchen.  

We were very happy with this hotel and would recommend.

title: Très decu
text: Chambre non conforme à la réservation, bien que membre du programme de fidélisation . De plus, chambre sale, taches multiples, buée sur toutes les fenêtres, limite insalubre, clim et extérieur atrocement bruyant . Personnel à la réception très aimable et réactif et Professionnel pour rectifier la situation et nous garder dans l’hôtel, mais le niveau était si médiocre que nous sommes partis. Le problème de cet hôtel est que l’hôtel est médiocre, un excellent personnel ne rendra pas les chambre agréables malheureusement …

title: Great family trip!
text: Great location and great security and service. Steps to Times Square and a 5 minute walk to so many other attractions. Right next to the broadway museum and an excellent pub and bodega. Rooftop bar was pricey ($35 per drink) and hotel cafe was overpriced. But so close to other great options

title: NYE Stay
text: Convenient location, but prices match the location. The value is in the location. Nice room, good view of Times Square. Market downstairs is way overpriced. Just go to the Walgreens across the street lol

title: Nice, but there are Better locations in NYC
text: The hotel was very nice. They don't refill your coffee in the room, everything needed to be by request. The additional fees were $25/day more than the hotel we stayed at in Downtown NYC. So busy getting in and out. If you need to stay in Times Square, it's a good choice as far as location goes. If you can stay elsewhere I'd stay in downtown Manhattan and then take the subway to the midtown area for your sightseeing.

title: Fantastic location!
text:
Stayed in a King Suite (also called an "Executive Suite" by Hyatt). 

Pluses:
• Location is excellent for touristy Christmas stuff. Most everything is walkable and useful major subway lines are a 5 minute walk away. Being a 1 minute walk from the middle of Times Square was really cool. Just an absolutely fantastic location in midtown that can't be beat.  
• King Suite was quite spacious for a NYC hotel room and a family of 4. Bedroom is separated from the living room with two pocket doors. Not too sound proof but having some separation from the kids while they slept was great. The sofa itself is uncomfortable to sit on but the kids had no complaints about the sofa bed. 
• Housekeeping was excellent and staff was friendly.
• The room-service-only breakfast was tasty and quite quick (always under 15 minutes). Would have liked some more options though and wasn't the most comfortable to eat in the room. 
• Bar 54 has some good views and very tasty but very expensive ($23+) cocktails. Also did the family friendly 10:30am daytime viewing which was cool. 
• Heat worked great considering we were staying during that Christmas cold snap with wind chills around -10F. Never felt cold once in the hotel. 

But there were some negatives: 
• I found the bed really firm and never slept that well. My spouse and kids thought it was fine though so YMMV. I do prefer soft beds. 
• Outside noise (on 12th floor) facing 45th street could sometimes be **extremely** loud with insane honking, blaring music from cars, and emergency vehicle sirens. I have no idea what possesses multiple people over multiple nights to decide it's a good idea to blare a car horn for 20 seconds straight at 3 in the morning but that's a thing that happens outside this hotel. I'm a very deep sleeper who has lived and visited downtown in other cities (including other hotels around NYC) without an issue, but this was unreal.
• The resort fee is a scam and their justifications for it are absolutely ridiculous. Just add it to the room price if you're going to do that. 

But overall I enjoyed the stay, mostly due to the size of the room and the excellent location. Maybe just ask for a room not facing 45th street if you're not going to get a room with a view anyways.

title: Times Square Gem
text: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric over the New Years holiday and it was perfect!  The room was clean, comfortable and quiet (super important when right on Times Square).  Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend it and will stay there again next time we are in NYC.

title: Disappointing experience
text:
There is no restaurant and machine coffee and pre-prepared food was all that was available.
No Concierge services were available: this is difficult for first time travellers to New York City.
We were there for the New Year’s Eve Celebrations but no advice on how to attend this event we’re provided.
A roof top bar was advertised but an extra $1500.00 was required to attend-non of this information was provided prior to arrival.
Overall a disappointing experience.

title: Stunning hotel in a central location
text:
My husband booked a surprise trip away for my 30th Birthday - we were due to go in December 2021, but with Covid, unfortunately we had to postpone a year. My husband emailed the hotel directly and we were overwhelmed by the generosity of the Manager who agreed for us to push to booking back with no penalty fee or money loss involved. We will always be grateful for this gesture.
When we did finally get to go to New York in December 2022, every extra second waited was worth it. We arrived at the hotel at around 2pm - we were greeted in a friendly manner and were politely told that our room wasn't quite ready, but we were more than welcome to leave our bags with them and return later - which is exactly what we did. We got a message a little while later telling us that our room was ready. When we returned to the Hotel, we were met by another extremely friendly member of staff, who had read on the booking that our stay was a Birthday treat - she gifted us $50 to spend in the bar as a "Birthday gift from Hyatt." 

Our room was on the 40th floor and there was something quite special about heading up in the lift, knowing we were going to have a view over Times Square. I was not prepared for the beauty of the room or the effort the staff had gone to - putting a personalised, hand-drawn card and balloons in our room. Thoughtful and very much appreciated. Our room was truly wonderful - we had a large living space which comprised of a desk area, sofa, table, tea/coffee/coffee machine facilities and a flatscreen TV. Beyond the living space was a lengthy balcony which had the most incredible views - the balcony also ran parallel to our bedroom. The bedroom had a bigger than king-sized bed, clothing storage including a well lit wardrobe, drawers and units, flatscreen TV and aircon/heating.

The bathroom was well stocked with shampoo/conditioner/moisturiser/soap/toilet rolls/tissues and drinking water as well as having a waterfall shower, handheld shower head and bath - all were fantastically warm and of good pressure.

We visited the Rooftop bar once - mainly to use our $50 and to make the most of the stunning views, and although we didn't have a reservation, the staff found a table for us. Personally, I felt that the drinks were a little on the pricey side, but having been gifted the credit, it was nice to put it towards a drink!

Throughout our stay, nothing was too much trouble. We were greeted with a smile every time we passed reception, the doors were open for us and we were frequently told to "have a great day." The Hotel staff who maintain the rooms always ensured our bed was made, we had fresh drinking water and clean, fresh towels. 

 On our departure day, the Hotel staff kindly looked after our bags and booked a cab for us - we did however cancel this can at a later hour as they were charging $110 to JFK, where we knew that the standard yellow taxi's have a flat rate. The Hotel were fine with this and did not make us feel uncomfortable or awkward about cancelling their option.

The Hyatt Centric is probably one of the most central hotels you will find to Times Square, with it taking approximately 30 seconds to get from to door to the Square! I couldn't have asked for a more perfect hotel experience than the one we got from Hyatt. 

Thank you so much for everything.

title: Great stay over Christmas
text:
The hotel couldn't be better located. Only 1/2 a block from Times Square and walking distance to any broadway show. Service was friendly and they even let us store our luggage after we checked out since we had an evening flight.

Only complaint would be that we requested two conjoining rooms and there were issues with this. They had a door that closed a private hallway to our 2 rooms, but that particular door was broken. I called the front desk to fix it, they sent an engineer, and he didn't fix it. And they never updated me. Not a huge deal since we only slept for a few hours, but as a family with 4 kids, having conjoining rooms was one of the reasons we chose this hotel.

title: Disappointing experience
text: Overall poor experience at Hyatt Centric. Very uncomfortable lobby, and we've had better rooms at a Hilton Garden Inn. Check in and check out was poor, with them obviously understaffed. There are many better hotels in the area, particularly for the price we paid. Would not recommend.

title: Best goed
text: Het verblijf viel wel mee, was niet super, maar “goed”. Wij hadden een kamer op de 22ste verdieping, met een stadsuitzicht en dit was wel heel rumoerig, hou dit zeker in gedachten! Ook de muziek in the market beneden, waar je koffie enzo kan kopen en nuttigen was heel erg luid. Zo luid dat we moesten vragen om dit stiller te zetten aangezien we anders tegen elkaar moesten roepen om ons verstaanbaar te maken… Buiten de drukte (niet de schuld van het hotel, maar van onze periode) en het lawaai wel vriendelijk personeel, zowel aan het onthaal als de kamermeisjes.

title: Not what we expected
text:
When we arrived, the sofa bed was not made. Since it was so late, no staff could be found to make the bed. Comment at check in: not all guests use the sofa bed. My answer: I understand that, but we are three people and currently we only have 2 beds available. 
So we had to make the sofa bed ourselves! It was also very cold but only 1 thin blanket was available for the sofa bed. The quality of the sofa bed was unfortunately also very poor.
A lot of noise comes through the windows. Noise from outside came in all the time even overnight.
The location is good but responsible for a lot of noise.

title: Great Hotel Excellent Staff
text: Very friendly and accommodating staff, great room service and lovely location right on Times Square. Valet service was very friendly as well as front desk. We’re traveling with a special needs child and we really got taken care at this hotel. We’ll definitely return.

title: Great Stay at the Hyatt Centric!
text: I just wanted to thank the entire staff at this great hotel! There was another guest checking in with my exact name, and the staff did everything they could to make sure that my huge reservation was correct. This hotel is GREAT. The location is great, the hotel is clean, the staff is wonderful. This will be our Go To for family trips to NYC. Thanks Hyatt! WELL DONE!

title: Holiday Stay
text: Excellent hotel right in the middle of Times Square---walking distance to many attractions! Hotel staff were excellent! Room was beautiful and clean! Perfect spot for walking around Times Square and Broadway! A few blocks away from a Broadway show I was seeing!

title: Great location, nothing special.
text: Location convenient to Times square and Rockefeller Center.  Hotel was okay but nothing special.  No common areas to relax in, no restaurant, and convenience store seemed to be closed a lot.  There is a bar but 21+ so not ideal for families.  Watch out for $30/day destination fee.  Plumbing is definitely old, probably common downtown but expect issues.  One bright spot - housekeeping is exceptional.  Always cleaned room as soon as we left and very pleasant.

title: Great location!
text: I was very happy with this hotel.  The location is great, the staff is friendly and the rooms are updated and clean.  I would select again.  There is also a great roof top bar for those 21 and older. There is no pool, but there is a nice size gym. I had the kids with me and it felt safe, even though you are basically in Times Square.

title: Terrible experience!!!!
text:
I stayed 12/25 - 12/27. We came from Alabama by car so we used valet service. They made my car big dent on driver side and it made so big cracking noise whenever open the door! Hyatt said it’s not them they are using 3rd party and 3rd party also didn’t take care nicely just put in case for accident and talked to me just wait for 3 business days they cannot do anything. What kind of service it is when they made customer car’s so badly broken. We should come back next day so we couldn’t even fix the car and going back to Alabama. So much disappointed and regretting for using Hyatt. 
Bathroom also so dirty not cleaned well. Used shampoo and others kept in.
Only the 1 good thing is it’s in time square. That’s it.

title: Great Location
text:
Close proximity to Times square ...   We could access the entire shopping , eating and theater district on a walkable distance .

Central location for taxi , Uber's  and more , Great Staff and Amazing breakfast .

title: Extraordinario
text:
Tenia grandes expectativas por este viaje familiar. Despues de no haber podido viajar por tanto tiempo por el Covid. 
 Me anime a reservar el Hyatt Centric de Times Square por los comentarios leidos. 
El hotel y el personal hicieron que mis expectativas quedaran pequenas con mi reciente estadia.
Desde el servicio antes de mi llegada, gracias a Jorge en reservas, luego a la llegada,  la atencion impecable de Alana fue insuperable. Los porteros se portaron de maravilla, ahora mismo solo recuerdo a Byron que nos ayudo con los taxis y sugerencias.
La habitacion muy amplia y limpia, los edredones de ensueno. Las camas muy comodas.  El hecho de no haber alfombras fue un plus ya que mi menor hija es alergica.
Al tener menores no fue posible ir al Bar 54 durante la noche pero el hotel ofrece visitas durante la manana para tomar fotos. 
Muchas gracias a todo el personal por unas vacaciones inolvidables!

title: Disappointing
text: I was expecting better customer service from a brand hotel but each interaction was less than customer oriented. Take it or leave it attitude. No bathrobes in the rooms. No slippers. Uncomfortable beds. Broken elevator.

title: Spacious suite
text: Obviously, location is everything and this earns an A-PLUS for that, but we were especially impressed with the size and space in our King Suite. Well appointed, tons of space and the perfect fit for our family.

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square
text: Great location withing walking distance to many venues.  Great Christmas time visit.  Don't miss this very festive area.  You should take in Ellen's Star Dust diner for a special lunch time or dinner experience with all the waiters and waitresses singing like Broadway singers.  Don't miss this.

title: Outstanding location
text: The absolute best location! We walked everywhere. Rooms were clean and quiet (we had a room on the backside). I only wish they offered free breakfast but at the same time, there were so many places to eat just outside the hotel. Starbucks across the street as well as Gumption Coffee (great craft codfee!) We also enjoyed nearby John’s pizza and Junior’s for lunch.

title: Love this hotel
text: Perfectly located hotel. Very clean and spacious. Love the Bar 54. Our room was so comfortable and clean. Staff was very helpful. Maid service was spot on. Stayed a few times. Had problems with electrical once but staff came out and helped quickly.

title: Amazing staff and service
text: From concierge to housekeeping to management, everyone was committed to our comfort and enjoyment. A wonderful hotel with caring, hospitable staff and a great location. The rooms were very clean and well-sized.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is just steps away from all the action! We could walk 75% of the places we wanted to go in NYC. The staff was very friendly and outgoing. We got great cleaning service from Rose and Byron outside was very helpful in getting us a cab when needed!

title: Highly recommended!
text: Remember that episode of Seinfeld where Kramer gets that black-market ultra-high-pressure shower head installed? Yeah, pretty sure that’s also where they got the shower heads at this hotel. Awesome water pressure! Also very nicely renovated rooms which were surprisingly spacious for New York. Love the timber floors too – feels much more hygienic than grubby carpet. Gym was well equipped too.

title: Nice hotel near times square
text: Lovely hotel! Very clean rooms and very comfortable beds! Staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful!!  This review requires 200 characters but I've said all I want to say and am now just wasting time

title: Great stay
text:
We had a great stay.  The only thing that would make it better is their breakfast.  The cafe is reliant on outside deliveries, so they only had everything bagels and plain by the time we got there around 9 am.  Cold brew could use some work. That is personal preference.
We always stay at this hotel as it is in the center of everything.  Our Housekeeper checked on us every morning, and the day we arrived.  She was the best.  Great time.

title: Great location, great rooms
text: Used World of Hyatt points for this trip, which were an excellent value! Location is great - within easy walking distance of Times Square, theatres, etc. Room was surprisingly large by NYC standards, and very quiet & modern.

title: Great Girls Long Weekend
text: Perfectly located and great accommodations for 4 gals enjoying NYC in December.  We were able to walk to much of what we wanted to do, and the subway was very close for those other places.  In room coffee was much appreciated.  Even the sofa bed was acceptable for the 2 of us who slept there.

title: Great Location
text:
Updated hotel in the heart of Times Square! Noise was not a problem….except for a neighbor across the hall.
This is a beautiful property. Can’t wait to go back. We are going to make this a yearly family outing.

title: very good great location
text: Very nice hotel, staff friendly able to check in early and helpful with questions. Room was fairly good size with great view. Great location close to everything in Times Square We . love the roof top bar

title: Satisfied all my basic needs from a great Hotel
text: Everything was clean and presentable. Wish somethings like toothpaste was provided already in the room but we had our own so that was fine. View for a standard good was solid. Shower was nice, always appreciate the complimentary waters.

title: Centric but not Hyatt
