text: Overall lower standard, many things didn’t work in the room, no breakfast, no priority to rooftop, no bar, no waiting area. There are much better hotel at a lower price in NYC, when you pay 600$ a night you expect better service and better amenities.

title: Awesome.  Just Awesome!
text:
This hotel is wonderful.  It’s affordable, situated near the center of Times Square, and the service is really good.  The breakfast tastes good as well.  The rooms are nice and clean just like the rest of the hotel.

I think they should add lunch and dinner since the breakfast is so good.  Also, the lobby is dark and grey and they should make the colors brighter and warmer.  However, these take nothing away from your stay at this hotel.  I highly recommend it.

title: A port in the Storm
text: This hotel is a safe haven in the storm of Times Square!!!  A few steps from Broadway is a quiet upscale, clean respite to help calm the chaos of New York's crazy 24 hour non stop cricus street...right in the middle of the Theater District!!!

title: Lovely place to stay
text: Highly recommended, staff very friendly, we liked the room; was big and very clean my. family and I really enjoyed stay at Hyatt centric Times Square. Other thing I loved there are many restaurants close to it,

title: Great location in the midst of everything
text: Was in town for work trip. This hotel is in a great location with access to tourist, food and for me, work related locations. Front desk was quick and responsive. Note the elevators serve specific floors so read the walls to know which one to board. Room was large and clean. Great views of the city. Incredible shower with great pressure and hot water when you need it. Note room service is a breakfast only event. The lobby restaurant closes at 7pm mid-week. Not sure about the roof top restaurant.  But this is New York, walk outside turn any direction and you will find food. Also Duane Reade/Walgreens is right across the street for those things you may have forgotten at  home. I would easily stay here again.

title: False fire alarm ruined an otherwise great stay.
text:
I stayed here two nights. If it was just the first night, I would’ve given 5 stars. Let’s start with the reasons the hotel is great

Very clean hotel. Very nice staff. Great location. Quiet hotel. Treated like a VIP, even though I don’t ever stay in Hyatts. Bathroom floor was heated. 

Now why they lost two stars.  Just as I was falling asleep on the second night (around 11:30pm), a fire alarm starts blaring. I jump up and stay getting dressed.  Just as I’m opening my door to walk down 49 flights of stairs, a voice comes on to tell us to ignore the alarm. Ok. Here’s the part that angers me. I go downstairs, as I couldn’t sleep and the front desk is talking about how it was the rooftop again. So, this is a known issue that they’ve failed to address. The last part is the reason I’m angry. It destroyed my nights sleep and I had to be up early for an all day conference.

title: Great Stay
text: Location was great! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was a good size with a Keurig machine and mini frig. The bed was very comfortable. Overall I would say everything was great and I will definitely stay here again. We stayed on 33rd floor.

title: CHRISTMAS VISIT 2022
text: This hotel was such a find. Clean; excellent staff; great location; new well maintained rooms; nice cafe in the lobby; 24 hour security; great housekeeping; totally helpful and accommodating doormen. A diamond in the rough!

title: Location Location Location!
text:
From the day we arrived to the day of departure the doorman provided exceptional services . They are truly the front for this hotel . 
All within walking distance - Time Square , Minskoff Theatre , Time Square Ball Drop,  and Walgreens right across the street .

You won’t be disappointed.

title: Spacious Room & Nice Accomodations
text: My stay was less than 24 hours for business, but the room is larger than any other room I've stayed in the area (I had a King).  I prefer rooms with flooring vs. carpeting and was happy with the accomodations.

title: Ok hotel, beds were terrible!
text:
Hotel was in a great location. We could check in and use a digital key all through the app so we had zero contact with the front desk, which we loved! Room service breakfast was served fast and in “to go” style, we also loved this! Made it very easy for a quick meal and then out the door.  
The beds were absolutely TERRIBLE. Comparable to sleeping on a park bench. We slept horribly which put a damper on our trip.  For $1000 a night we expected a comfortable bed. Very disappointing.  We will not be staying here again.

title: Different
text: Interesting… rooms are not carpeted, room service comes in a to-go bag, wall switches have lighting option buttons and must use app to enjoy reservation only hotel bar.  Check in was smooth and quick, concierge answered promptly when called.  No coffee maker or microwave in the room, does have fridge. Mattress was the firmest I have yet to encounter. Pillows are soft and squishy. Store off the lobby for food items open limited hours. Bagged breakfast was delicious. (Scrambled eggs, peppers, onions, melted cheese over potato wedge home fries.) Overall it was a good experience however, having to travel frequently I enjoy the expected known factors such as how to operate the wall light switch when coming in late to a dark room. Once figured out, one can appreciate the novelty of the “mood”and“night light”button options but is novelty what you want in your hotel room when traveling?

title: Highly Recommend
text: Great location, very clean, wonderful staff. Everything was easy, which makes the vacation that much better. Zero issues and would for sure stay here again. If you’re looking for easy come, easy go within walking distance of pretty much everything I say this is your hotel.

title: Great Property with Awesome Guest Service
text: Stayed at the Hyatt for a short vacation with my family and the staff went out of their way to address any issues we had.  From things as simple as taking us to our floor on the service elevator when the elevator banks were busy to getting us a cab on Friday afternoon with no notice the staff took great care of us.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Times Square Hotel
text: We loved staying at the Hyatt in Times Square. It was convenient to everything. Bar 54 was great. Our room was incredible and the customer service was top notch. Definitely will stay there again on our next visit.

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square
text: Special thanks to JB and the entire crew at this Hyatt location for allowing my stay to be nothing short of exemplary. I thank all check in Ladies as well as housekeeping and all that make my trios feel like home. Location is unmatched as well as their clean amazing rooms . See you soon my friends ❤️

title: Prime Location
text:
This is the hotel to pick to be in the middle of all NYC has to offer. Midtown is very walkable from here and even downtown is a quick car ride. 

Staff was friendly, room was clean, breakfast was awesome. Can’t go wrong at this location.

title: Spacious room in Times Square
text:
Favorite hotel in Times Square. This hotel has me branding out from Marriott/SPG. Mainly because of the spacious (for NYC) rooms with separate shower in the standard room and separate shower and bath in the upgraded suite. 

Pictures attached are in room 2006. 

Everything was lovely. I couldn’t figure out how to use the heated floor in the bathroom (will update if I figure it out).

As others have said, street noise and lights were tolerable (it’s Times Square not Nebraska!) 

Loved the wireless charging station. (Worked for my iPhone)

Staff is super friendly!

title: Hyatt Centric Was Great
text: We’re staying here now and this place is great. Definitely deserves more than a 5 star review. Clean, comfortable, and in a great location. The best part of the stay is the staff. Very polite and on it when it comes to customer service. They made the kids laugh and are always smiling. The rooms are very clean. Can’t say enough great things about this place. If you’re thinking of staying in New York, this is the spot. Thank you to all of the staff, all of you made this a great trip.

title: Thanksgiving/Birthday Family Vacation
text: The location was perfect for what we wanted to do/see with kids. The hotel has done a great job in cutting down the city noises. The rooms were spacious, the bathroom was huge (separate bath and shower) My family of four was able to spread out and have plenty of room for our four pieces of luggage. On the upper end of what we spend on hotels usually....but zero complaints.

title: Perfect location, exceeded expectations
text: The staff were overly accommodating! From the care package for us and our baby with toiletries when we lost our luggage, to being patient when a card mixup occurred, to helping me print a page, helping us get the stroller and our luggage in and out, I really enjoyed this property. Every single staff member was friendly and helpful. The room was amazing and clean. The custodial staff also were so friendly. I will be back 10000%. Can’t say one single bad thing about our stay. Already missing the view and the bed.

title: Vacation
text: Our family had a great time at NY, staying at Hyatt Centric.  It's so so conveniently located, unbelievably beautiful location.  I would love to stay here again on our next vacation and recreate and relive the memories.

title: Fancy and fabulous
text: Visited NY to see a play with my friend and this hotel made our stay extra special.   Everything was clean, beautiful and classy.  The room was spacious and the rooftop bar is a MUST visit.   Can't wait to return.

title: Overpriced
text: A 4 star hotel without toothpaste in their high end deluxe room. Not transparent with fees and well overpriced. I asked for a room that would offer a good view, preferably higher up. I was informed that it will be taken care of at my arrival. Upon arriving, I was told that it would cost me $45 (without specifying "per night"). Quite disappointing considering the price skyrockets when you consider the additional destination fees and hotel taxes.

title: Awesome Stay!!!
text: Awesome place to stay with great staff and I loved the location.  It was also much quieter outside of this hotel than a typical hotel near Times Square.  The only thing that could be better was the pillow and mattress.

title: Perfect experience!
text: We went to NY to celebrate a special birthday. Our travel agent made the reservations at the Hyatt Centric. What a fabulous place to stay!  Room was great, service excellent, staff personable and very accommodating!  We would highly recommend staying there -  you won't regret it!

title: City Staycation
text: I was greeted promptly and warmly by the front desk staff. I loved that our room was immediately ready (2 hours before check-in)and that staff even accommodated a last minute birthday request to make our visit that much more special. The room was very spacious especially for nyc with clean and updated decor and furnishings; my only negative feedback were the pillows were all paper thin and could use replacing. The rooftop bar had amazing views and friendly staff however the overpriced drinks fell flat or overly sweet, my particular drink was also very messy (We tried 4 different types of drinks). Would stay here again but the price didn’t match the overall experience; I guess that’s just New York City pricing though.

title: Business Trip
text: I highly recommend this property, it was in a great location, very clean and the staff was super friendly. I will definitely stay here the next time I visit NYC. It was walking distance to several eating facilities as well as Time Square and a broadway show theatre

title: Dump
text:
This place is a dump. I really don’t know why anybody gave it a good review.   There doesn’t appear to be a concierge, no doorman, the beds do not have a top sheet so you get to use the comforter that everybody before you used. 
This is an overpriced Holiday Inn. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Lotte Palace.  We thought we’d mix it up this time and seriously regret it.

title: Adored it!
text:
This is my new favorite hotel in Times Square! I absolutely adored it. The staff was very kind and welcoming, it felt very safe/secure, and it was clean and modern. 

The rooms were adorably decorated! Small, like most hotel rooms in NYC, but as a solo traveler it was more than adequate. Compared to other Hyatt Centric properties I’ve stayed at, the rooms had a pop of color and some fun decorative touches. It was bright and airy and radiated positive vibes. The condition of the room, from the furnishings to the linens, was absolutely impeccable.  Bathroom was small but well appointed with good storage space and warm water/solid water pressure. I never got her name but my housekeeper on the 38th floor made my trip very special. In addition to her exceptional skills as a cleaner, she couldn’t have been a kinder person who went out of her way to warmly greet me and ask how my day was going. She was a very genuine person and went above and beyond to make my stay memorable.

Beds were comfortable, I appreciated the mini fridge and decent in room Keurig maker, Wi-Fi was consistently reliable. 

The hotel was very centrally located and a perfect “home base” for seeing all New York had to offer. Several subway stations were within walking distance and it was very easy to get a cab/Uber/Lyft. Walgreens/Duane Reed is directly across the street from property.

Finally, I was pleased with the soundproofing of the rooms. You’re in the heart of Times Square, so it’s unreasonable to expect that you won’t hear an ambulance, or someone honking, every now and then. However, compared to every other hotel I’ve stayed at in the area, this was significantly quieter. I never heard any other guests and they did a good job of blocking out as much of the road noise as possible, and I’m usually fairly sensitive to this. Turn on a sound machine and you’ll be golden!

Overall this was a great hotel that exceeded my expectations. I look forward to returning one day soon!

title: Great location and nice rooms, but loud
text: This hotel is in a great spot near Times Square and Central Park. It was great for the marathon. Room was large and bed was comfortable. My main complaint is that, even on the 22nd floor, I could hear trucks all night, as there was no soundproofing in the windows, which is wild for being near Times Square. Several plugs in our room didn't work, and the TVs worked but not all their features did, so this was a little disappointing. Breakfast room service was quick, but expect to pay big bucks for it if you don't get it free as Globalist ($20+ avocado toast)

title: Upsell and Predatory Pricing. Terrible service.
text:
I have been to this property before. The location is great and that's why this time I'm bringing my child as he hasn't been to NYC. But this turned out to be the worst experience in my entire Hyatt career.

1) Room service was terrible. The hotel restaurant is renovating, and instead of using the rooftop bar (which it is capable of) for breakfast, the hotel forced us Globalists to use "Room Service". But room service was only some brown paper bags with takeout food in plastic trays. The presentation and taste are worse than any Uber Eat or Doordash. Further, the room service never managed to get our orders right for all six nights we stayed. One day, it's missing coffee. Another day, it's tea. It's honestly a random lucky draw. 

2) Upsell & unfair pricing. As a Globalist member, who had my fair share of Hyatt hotels, this is definitely the worst Hyatt Centric -- and the worst Hyatt property -- I have stayed. Service hasn't been attentive at all. Check-in also felt that the property is trying to squeeze out every penny from its guests. We have stayed at this property before. And last time, we upgraded to the suite. But this time, the hotel forced us to pay $50/night + tax and fees for the EXACT SAME suite on the same floor (Rm4901). While during check-in, the staff made it sound like a big upgrade, we were shocked when we realized that it was the same room we stayed in previously. How's that an upgrade and why do we need to pay additional amount for it if we had stayed there for free before? The staff even realized that we stayed in that room before (for free) and told us about it when we brought it him to him. If so then, why did he charge us? It felt like predatory pricing. A few days before check-in, I also noticed that the pricing had come down, especially on other non-Hyatt websites. And when I tried to price match it with your staff on Facebook, they come up with many non-sense reasons such as I paid a non-refundable Advanced pricing (which turns out to be more expensive than the normal price selling later). In the end, I didn't get the price to come down even though the hotel was already selling at a lower price elsewhere. After that, I have lost confidence in Hyatt's price guarantee.

3) Additional. And at every Hyatt property, we as globalists would receive some recognition, be it a piece of chocolate, fruits, or as simple as a letter. But nothing at this hotel. Nada. The F&B was so bad that I took my son to Park Hyatt NY, which was great!

title: Outstanding service and great location!
text: I spent two nights at this Times Square Hotel and took just 3 minutes to wal to the play we were seeing.  The rooms were immaculate and the staff was attentive to out requests throughout our two-night stay.  I would definitely return.

title: Perfect spot
text: Nice clean Hotel, very well situated,  a few steps from Time square and the theater district. A beautiful roof top bar also. Staff very helpful with all demands. Valet parking, a must in New-York! You won't regret your choice!

title: Hyatt Centric Midtown NYC
text: A Nice Hotel, great to stay here if going to the Theatre District. No hotel restaurant but a great Irish Pub a few doors away.  The Museum of Broadway is next door.  Cook Eatery nearby for morning coffee and breakfast.

title: October half term family visit
text:
Great location next to Times Square and friendly and helpful staff on Reception

We were on the 36th floor and didn’t notice any noise from street level

Went with the kids on our first day to Bar 54 on the early morning hotel residents visit as our kids ( 17 and 14 ) had never been to New York before and this was a great way for them to experience the skyline for the first time 

No restaurant in the hotel and we used the deli next door ( Cook ) and Irish bar ( Connelly’s ) for morning breakfast.

title: Sehr zufrieden im  Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
text:
In den letzten Jahren haben wir uns bei unseren Aufenthalt in New York ,im Hyatt Centric Times Square immer sehr wohl gefühlt . "Übernachtet" (gewohnt).
Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral und zu Fuß ist der Times Square und viele Theater leicht zu erreichen.
Es gibt auch in der Nähe einige Subway-Stationen, und mit einer Tages- oder Wochenkarte ist es kostengünstig in der Stadt  von "A nach B" rasch zu kommen.
Vom Betreten bei der Ankunft bis zur Abreise ist jeder Mitarbeiter sehr freundlich und hilfsereit.
Zimmer sind sehr sauber.
Wir werden für unseren nächsten Urlaub in NY gerne wieder ein Zimmer in diesem Hotel buchen.

title: NYC Marathon weekend
text: My family of 5 had a wonderful stay here while there for the NYC marathon.  The location was fantastic.  It was so easy to get around everywhere we wanted to go.  The hotel was very clean.  Showers always hot.  Staff were very helpful. Nearby restaurants were excellent as well. Highly recommend!

title: Clean and friendly staff but disappointed!
text: The hotel room was very clean and spacious and certain staff were helpful however the facilities I had booked the hotel form eg spa and restaurant were closed and I was not made aware of this at booking and discovered this on arrival which was very disappointing. Hotel very close to Times Square so good central location.

title: Amazing Experience - Highly Recommend
text: The staff was very friendly. The hotel is very clean, inviting and feels safe. The room was very clean, inviting and most importantly for a NYC hotel, roomy & quiet. The location is perfect to Times Square & other nearby NYC Mid-town happenings. The roof top Bar has delicious food and a great atmosphere. Also important in NYC - the elevators are FAST! Wait times to get up and down are quite minimal. I definitely recommend this hotel!!!!

title: Bien
text:
L’hôte est très bien situé juste à côté de Times square et de la 5eme avenue.
Les chambres sont correctes mais la Clim était un peu trop bruyante à notre goût et la température soit disant réglable ne fonctionnait pas.
Chambre propre et personnel agréable.

title: Great location!
text: Right in the heart of Times Square and the theatre district. We stayed there to shorten our walk to TKTS and 5 shows, including a Tony Best Musical - A Strange Loop -  right next to the hotel. In the heart but a little outside of the congestion. Also right next to the future Broadway Museum. Had a room w a great view too.

title: Honeymoon visit
text: Was a great hotel and the room was great but the price to attain it was a little on the high side. Also wished they would label the additional costs they take out come the end of your visit but definitely a good stay.

title: agréable séjour
text:
nous avons passé de bons moments dans votre hôtel dans un quartier central de New York à Manhattan
ravis d'avoir profité de la vue sur les buildings au 46ème étage
Hôtel moderne 
Dommage qu'il n'y ait pas de salle de petit déjeuner

title: My Stay
text: The rooms are great and staff are very friendly.  The location is very close to Time Square. The only issue is that  host on the 54 BAR (great view by the way) takes his job too seriously and is a stickler for the rule. If he doesn't want people to sit at a table, He can easily put a "reserved" sign on that table. Every time, I went to the bar, there were many tables available (mostly inside but outside too) and he was asking people to sit at this table but not that one. It came to the point that on the 3rd night when I went there, I just avoided him and sat where I wanted and when he came, I gave him a look that said "dont F with me" and he walked back to his stand

title: Would stay here again
text: Fantastic location with great amenities. Access to Bar 54 is reason enough to stay here. Comfortable bed in a quiet well appointed room. Staff we amazing and the check in and out process was easy. Highly recommend, and would stay here again on return.

title: Strategically located near Times Square
text: Times Square can be a noisy place, but this hotel is remarkably quiet. Rooms are well-appointed, clean and roomy (by NYC standards). All staff members we encountered were helpful & polite. Close to the theater district and great dining venues. We were within a 10-15 minute walk from everything we wanted to do.

title: Maravilloso
text:
Excelente en todos los sentidos con una ubicación muy buena 

Limpieza, comunicación, extraordinario, estupendo, formidable, agradable . Calidad de servicio con personal con basto conocimiento.

Las instrucciones me parecieron de muy buena calidad con mucha limpieza en lo general y un respeto agradable con una sonrisa

title: Great hotel but street noise can be heard
text: I had a great stay at the hotel and the location was central and great.  I was surprised at the amount of street noise that could be heard, specifically the building / drilling that appeared to go 24 hours a day

title: Mom and Son
text: My 5 year old son requested a visit to NYC as he had never been. Great location. Close but set apart. Very safe feeling. Only disappointment was he was unable to go to the rooftop bar since he was under 21. So I was unable to go since I was not going to leave him in the room alone.

title: Great Experience!
text: The room was always clean, friendly housekeeping and attendance staff, and easy process to check-in and check-out.  Valet staff willing to coordinate transportation and were very friendly.  Make sure to have your hotel card ready to show when you return in the evening. Safety measure for guests. Great price compared to other hotels nearby.  Safe area to walk around late at night and close to everything in Time Square including metro.  Will return to hotel for my next visit.

title: Great location and quality of accommodation
text:
Placed just round the corner from Times Square, noise was not an issue, room was fair size, clean and well provisioned.  Just query any charges on check out as they tried to charge us for destination charges which I have no idea what they are, but were not expected or paid.  
The roof top bar is great, but need to book early.

title: Perfect 3 night stay
text: Just off of Times Square, so away from the frenetic lights and activity just enough, but still close. We loved the location. Extremely friendly woman at the check in desk. Made us feel so welcome. Upgraded us to the 42nd floor. Heads up that the window in the room does open, like to the city air without a screen, which from the 42nd floor was a bit unnerving. But also cool. Comfy beds, free bottled water and Keurig coffee and tea in the room. Safe available. Awesome Rain shower head and fog free bathroom mirrors. No waiting for the elevators. Rooftop bar on the 54th floor is strictly 21+, however, every day at 10:30am, they have family rooftop viewing. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Why not stay here
text:
This hotel has good location.  Only good thing about it.
Rooms too small.  Internet did not work most of my stay.  Have had bugs in ice dispensed by ice maker twice.  ( seen this noted by other reviews as well).  Lots of loud talk and noise in the hallway during the night.  And there is charge for “destination fee” that no one explains what it is for; but gets added to the bill at the end; it is not mentioned when I made the reservation on Hyatt.Com.

Have been to other places in time square and tried something different.  Not staying here again!  Many other choices.

title: Great Location you are in the heart of Time Square
text: What a great location for visiting New York, you are in the heart of Time Square.   Staff are friendly and extremely helpful.  The hotel itself is modern and is very clean with very comfortable beds and well equipped bathrooms.  We had to adjoining rooms both had excellent views.  If you are lucky enough to get a room with a view it will certainly show you that New York never sleeps.  One note there is some construction work being carried out on the sidewalk outside the hotel, but this did not detract from our experience.  Thank you Hyatt team great stay and hope to visit with you again.

title: Modern base for daily exploring
text:
Just stayed here for a 5 night NY city break. 
Located literally 1 min walk off Times Sq is a perfect location for exploring North, South, East, West - by foot of 5 min walk away from Times Sq Subway (10 mins if busy with crowds). 
Room was modern, clean & spacious, also with comfy beds - ideal as a base which other than sleeping we spent little time in. 
Staff really friendly & very helpful - helped us pre arrange birthday balloons in our room for a family celebration, also stowed our luggage on our last day & helped organise private transfer to JFK (little more expensive than NYC taxi) but 100 times more luxurious, cleaner & safer ! 
Really good hotel in a top location.

title: Great
text: Was a family stay,  room on our high floor  very and private,  all the staffs we have come in contact so friendly,  efficient and helpful.... overall 5star experience.  Hotel's location right at the action center of Times Square great bonus

title: Basic
text: This was as basic as it gets but it appeared clean. There is no coffee maker in room or available in lobby. No top sheets on beds. I’m sure they want you to believe that the the duvet cover is changed after each guest but cmon let’s be realistic. Since I was traveling solo I stripped the second bed and remade the one I slept in so I had a top sheet…

title: Good not great.
text: Nice, clean and right where you want to be but a little pricey for the level of hotel. No restaurant. Just a bar. No room service, breakfast sack poor option for this level of hotel. Plenty of food option around though.

title: Perfect stay.
text:
Loved it ! Perfect location, very kind staff.
Well on this trip We were celebrating my wife’s BDay, so they left a nice note and little detail in the room. Room was perfectly clean, tha housekeeping girl was very nice ! 
Thank you. For sure we will be back!

title: Great people providing exceptional customer service
text:
Great property and love Hyatt Globalist benefits.  We arrived shortly after the street to the hotel was unexpectedly shutdown for repairs. Call to front desk brought Joe out to help and he was great!

Always a smile and ask if they could help throughout our stay.  Innovative response to breakfast area being converted to a marketplace - great food provided hot without having to leave the room. 

When bellman were helping guests check in while I needed help with luggage for my late checkout. A young woman working the front desk left her post to find Shawn and both of them were great making sure all our items were brought down and loaded into our car. 

Peloton bikes in the fitness center were a nice surprise. Everything was clean and well organized in our room.

title: family trip
text: love love love this hotel super close to times square. the room are super nice and clean. the staff are wonderful. If you go ask for YENNY at eh front desk she is the best and very friendly. 10/10 will stay again

title: Central Manhattan Stay
text: Great location just a little away from Times Square. Modern safe hotel.Helpful professional staff. Excellent room which provided all we needed and more. Bathroom well appointed and re stocked with toiletries each day.

title: Great Hotel!
text: It was the perfect location with perfect views and the kind of service and quality you get from a chain, everything felt modern and nice and clean. Everyone was a buzz about the bar on the rooftop and it was a site to see!

title: Excellent
text:
Went for a party, decided to stay closer to the venue, was an amazing location for the local access to the clubs. The front door was a bit tucked in my
Opinion, but the staff were nice and the service was excellent.

title: Marvelous
text: Prime location, excellent rooms, super staff, all in all a very good value for a holiday break. Second time around and this time with the whole family. This will certainly be our chosen place to stay in next time we visit NYC.

title: Never again
text:
it saddens me to say this but I was so unsatisfied with the stay at Hyatt Centric Time Square. Especially for the amount that I had to pay for the total days including the view upgrade and all. I found so much better deals around Manhattan and especially in time square but I chose to stay in Hyatt centric because i thought this is going to be the best option I have. I was also embarrassed I told my friends to stay there as one was celebrating her birthday and she was also not satisfied with her stay and I feel embarrassed because I convinced them to stay there even when having to pay more for each night. Our room was extremely small and we did not even have a closet to put our clothes in to hang and most of our clothes were all wrinkled and on top of that we were going to have to pay extra to use the laundry so our clothes look decent and not wrinkled because we had them in the bag. I’ve honestly never been to a hotel without a closer to hang out clothes in. The shower kept making really loud noises and bothered anyone trying to sleep in the room so had to wait on my girlfriend to wake up to be able to take a shower. 

The most frustrating thing was the AC. After we talked to the front desk about our AC issues we were greeted with attitude from the front desk lady which I was not going to cause an issue about at first. Then we were told that the AC is by motion and people have to be moving for it to stay working. I’ve never ever heard that in my life, am I expected to move around at 3-4am just to keep the AC on? Every morning we would wake up drenched in sweat because the AC would stop working middle of the night. I woke up multiple times just to go to the thermostat and turn it off then back on for it to work again and again. I paid almost $2,000 for only 3 nights and I’ve traveled almost all around the world and I’ve never had to deal with anything like that for a place that I had to pay this much for. I honestly really wanted to love the hotel but all these things kept on happening and we didn’t even have one single good sleep during our stay. I’m sorry I’m having to complain about all this and I really don’t usually do so but I was honestly so disappointed by it. I hope you can fix the AC issue so that the next guests don’t have to go through the same thing as it was really frustrating. After all this I also had to pay an extra $260 cuz of the room upgrade that was offered to us when we were checking in but I was really not satisfied by any of it and didn’t want to complain because I was on vacation and wanted to have a good time.

title: A solid optio in NYC
text:
This is more like 4.5 stars, but will round it up.

The hotel is conveniently located in the center, but some streets away from the madness of the TS. The hotel is relatively new, so looks good inside with interesting design ideas. Food and everything is nearby and getting in/out is quick cause there is almost no lobby. Half star away for the policies of a very early checkout even for Explorists and a bit mechanical, but efficient front desk. This is NYC, so can be expected.

title: Great location
text: This is a well appointed hotel, 1 minute walk from Time Square. Great location for local attractions, but also for getting to see the main attractions of Manhattan. As we were staying for 7 nights we upgraded our room and had plenty of space on the 43rd floor. Beds were very comfortable and the whole room clean and pretty well appointed. Hotel also has one of the highest roof-top bars in New York!!

title: Perfect weekend getaway
text: Wonderful experience! Everything and everyone was accommodating. From check-in to check out. Bellman was friendly. Perfect weekend getaway! I will stay here again!! Thank you for making our weekend getaway perfect!

title: Excellent
text: Loved my stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square NY, very ideal location and walkable to practically everything. Loved the clean room and the excellent customer service from the front desk as well as the staff. Great Job everyone! will most definitely choose this again.

title: Added the Hyatt Centric to our "A" list for future stays!
text: Service was great, room was very clean and comfortable.  The quietest room I've ever stayed in while in NYC!  Great location, close to attractions, shopping, restaurants, Broadway, and all that makes New York, New York!

title: Great location!
text: Location is really great! Very close to all of the shops and food locations. However, rooms are small and compared to other nearby hotels several hundred dollars more expensive! We will be back to NYC but will not stay at Hyatt.

title: Not the best of the Hyatts
text: I was surprised by the lobby and the room. Lobby is small, not the usual Hyatt size and attractiveness. The room was noisy from hall noise. It was small. No stationery, no mini-bar, no robes and no floor access security (same elevator as the rooftop bar). The TV cabinet had a broken hinge and hanging door over the few days we were there. The shelf the safe is bolted to could be yanked out. The provided glasses were plastic and the coffee cups cardboard. On the plus side, besides excellent location, was the comfortable bed, decent rooftop bar (although limited view due to surrounding buildings), good wi-fi and wireless phone charging. There was a Keurig coffee machine, but not the promised unlimited stash of coffee. There was a fridge, hair dryer and iron with board. In general this is an ordinary hotel. Not bad, but nothing special for its $500+/night tariff.

title: Excellent locationManhattan.
text:
The experience staying was a great one. Wish to have a continental breakfast, not a room service. Always good to have a place to eat in the morning especially traveling from overseas and struggle to sleep with jet lags. A roof top could be open for breakfast?
Also, yellow cab calling service reservation is good to have. Not all wants the professional car services, but don’t want to catch cans on own.

title: Excellent hotel!
text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff was absolutely pleasant. I loved how warm and inviting all the workers were. I particular appreciated the fact that you all allowed me to leave my bags until it was time for my flight. This was so helpful for me!

title: A hidden gem
text: What a great place! If you want to be closw to Time Square at a great property for an amazing price…. This is the place! It is close to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment. I will stay here often.

title: Not what is written on the tin
text: Excellent location. Dirty decoration outside, giving a bad first impression. Poor lobby design, looking like one is getting into an office block. Very disappointing suite, despite (or maybe because) I am supposed to be a top tier client of Hyatt - old furniture; worn out stuff; empty in room fridge etc. Absolutely counter-productive business practices, incl officially incl breakfast but asking clients to take their breakfast in their room after waiting 30 min to get served (which practically means no breakfast at the hotel) + overbooking the bar with external guests and then refusing access to hotel guests despite the bar being visibly empty. All in all not a good horse in the usually very good Hyatt stable. I won't be back.

title: friendly staff but room condition not so good
text: booked a suite but was dissapointed at the room condition. no carpet, floor was extremely dirty, sheets caused skin irration and i found hair on the hairdryer. the hotel staff were freindly though and the location is good. overall hotel feels outdated.

title: Stay at this hotel!
text: The Hyatt Centric Times Square has much to offer, including its proximity to the Theatre District. More importantly, the experience of staying there is superior! The staff are always friendly and efficient.  The rooms are always very comfortable, clean, and quiet. The Hyatt Centric is a good value for the quality of the stay you'll experience.

title: Hôtel topissiiiiiiiime & hyper bien situé !!
text:
Hôtel topissiiiiiiiime & hyper bien situé !!
Chambres très grandes (surtout pour NY) et très propres : le ménage est très bien fait :)
Services impeccables & immédiats : ils ne rechignent jamais quand vous demandez quelque chose :)))
Quant à l'emplacement : the best place ever in NYC !! (plein de lignes de métro à proximité, boutiques, stands de hot-dogs, boutiques, bref : génial !!!!! Nous reviendrons assurément : merciiiiiiii Hyatt Centric !!

title: bel établissement mais aucun service que l'on attend d'un 4 étoiles
text:
j'ai séjourné avec un ami 4 nuits dans cet établissement en septembre pour un voyage d'agrément.

Au niveau accueil : le personnel est souriant mais c'est très minimaliste, pas de services que l'on attend par exemple pas de pc ni imprimante à disposition ni de documentations.

Il est par ailleurs étonnant que l'accès à l'hôtel ne soit pas plus sécurisé avec par exemple un filtrage avec badges dans la cabine d'ascenseur.

Seul un vigile fait un vague filtrage le soir.

Aucun service de petit déjeuners à part un service ne chambre très minimaliste.

Par contre point positif les chambres sont assez vastes et étant au 46 étage on a une vue fort sympa.

Il est étonnant de trouver les toilettes dans la salle de bains ce qui n'est pas franchement "style" 4 étoiles.

Points positifs ; produits de toilette de qualité, le nettoyage des chambres est très bien fait, il y a chaque jour deux bouteilles d'eau minérale et dans un tiroir une machine à café.

La clim est un peu bruyante.

Il y a un bar au 54 étage d'où la vue est ouf !

title: Great location, great staff…
text: The hotel is located one block from time square and close to all the theaters. The staff went out of their way to ensure I was satisfied, Elizabeth is a rock star. Very clean and great staff! The bartender on the rooftop was great, the manager there was very friendly as well. It was a very busy Saturday night, but they all kept their cool and my cocktail was delicious. When I checked in, I wasn’t too happy with my “city view” room. Elizabeth came upstairs and let me check out two more rooms in the same price category and allowed me to choose the room I liked the best. I felt like a VIP! The hotel was very clean. I would stay here again, I don’t have a single complaint.

title: Perfect location in NYC
text:
Perfect location to catch a Broadway show.
Clean modern everything you would expect.a nice touch was a card and balloons in the room for my birthday. Must mention on our departure day most of the roads nearby were closed due to a celebration carnival style possession with floats ect ( great to watch)- very thankful to the concierge whom really helped us out after our taxi didn't arrive. If it not for him definitely would have missed our flight (wish I could remember his name) he went over and above ! 
We literally only slept here, very comfortable 
No breakfast option only room service.
Nice convenice store next door for snacks on the move.

title: Great location in NYC!
text: So close to Times Square & most important all the fantastic restaurants in Hell’s Kitchen and BROADWAY!! The area outside of hotel was very clean and many HYATT staff were there to assist w/directions, taxi’s etc. very pleasant experience.

title: Pay attention before you book
text:
you may want to consider if this hotel is good for you before you book
(1) location - Very Good
(2) breakfast is served only as room service, there rooms are small and not fun to eat there .. so better go out to eat outside
(3) expensive hotel - no concierge available
(4) rooftop - entering only above 21 - if you book because of the roof top and you want to eat there with children  - forget about it

title: Convenient, quiet and comfortable
text: This hotel is very nice and convenient. The rooms are spacious and quiet with nice amenities (coffee, water, toiletries and umbrellas ). The staff is lovely and bar 54 is fun with a great view. My only complaint is the horribly strong perfume smell in the lobby and elevators which is offensive to my nose each time I walk through the lobby. Fortunately the smell does not go to the rooms!

title: Week long trip to catch some shows
text:
Great hotel.  Surprisingly large and clean.  Has luxurious heated bathroom floors! Felt safe and secure with doormen verifying guests entering elevator bank. Friendly doormen!

Problems at check-in when the credit card NFC reader didn't work - made me second guess my credit card and forced me to call to verify if there was something wrong with my account. Also a problem when I booked an additional room the next day.  The front desk seemed reluctant to sell me a room.  But housekeeping was very friendly! Replenished water bottles each day no charge! (Don't forget to tip housekeeping each time you have your room cleaned!) Floors felt safe to walk on since there was no carpet -  no weird or sticky carpet stains. Includes a refrigerator but it's tiny. 

Very close to the action in Times Square.  Walkable to the the 3 shows we saw that week.  Walgreens, a bodega, a restaurant and the Lyceum Theater showing "A Strange Loop" are literally next door.

This hotel experience makes me want to build up my Discoverist membership and switch brands from my Hilton Diamond.

title: A very good Hotel
text:
We stayed at the Hyatt centric from the 8th September for 4 nights.
Reception fast and very pleasant on arrival.
Baggage brought up to room
Room very spacious and clean with a good view of time square .
Great bathroom with a good shower. 2 large beds and the air con worked a treat, as it was hot outside.
Great position for Time Square, Central Park , 5th Avenue and all the Broadway shows. Starbucks opposite although there were coffee making facilities in the room.
Booked a table at bar 54,  book in advance about 2 weeks prior.
Was worth it for the views, the cocktails and the food 
Been to New York a few times and this was a very good choice of hotel . Def recommend it. I would return for sure.

title: Enjoyable business stay at Hyat Centric
text:
Enjoyed my 3 night stay at Hyat Centric. I needed a central place where I could work comfortably during the morning, and easily go exploring in the evening. Room was clean and the service staff that I interacted with was very friendly and helpfull.  I had a kingsize bed with balcony. The furniture on the balcony was a bit simple, but the view was great and the room had a big desk to work on. The desk had all kinds of relevant ports (usb, usb-c, hdmi). Big pluss for the wireless charging station! The chair was a bit uncomfortable to sit and work in for longer periods. The wifi was stable enough to use for work. The safe was big enough for a 16’’ laptop.

The hotel is located right next to Time Square so do expect a lot of traffic and people in the nearby streets. There is a rooftop bar, but did not get to go there for a drink since it was reserved for events during my stay. However, they offered a viewing for guests 10:30 AM which I managed to get before I checked out. The view was great, and I imagine it is spectacular at night. Did not try the gym, but it looked quite decent.

The hotel is on the pricier side and european guests should be aware of the «Destination fee» + tax, which is around 35$ per night. This cost is not included in the price you see when you book.

title: Worthwhile Stay
text: Great location, very courteous and friendly staff. Always greeted with a smile. Our room was right next to the elevator which was assigned if when not requested. Perfect location.Loved the overall stay.

title: Modern and Friendly
text: I arrived about 11am and front desk was friendly.  Our room was ready and we were about to check in early.  Valet was also friendly and very helpful.  Rooms are clean and on the smaller side (but it is NY)enough for what we needed.   Really no complaints.

title: Globalists avoid this party over rated property
text: No club lounge, drunk people in halls looking for other drunk people to go to reservation only bar, to which Hyatt members have no privileges, executive suites don't accommodate a cot, suites are small, appliances and lights not pugged in, no charm or warmth.

title: 전반적으로 괜찮았지만...
text: 도착할 때 길을 막아놔서 여행 가방 끌고 가는데 너무 힘들었습니다. 타임스퀘어 주변이라 혼잡해서 걷기에는 좋지만 차를 타는 것은 좀 어려웠네요. 그 부분이 참 아쉽네요...

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square
text: I was overall very happy with the experience. The cleaners did a good job and came when we requested. If we ran out of bottled water they would bring us more, when we drank the waters provided they would leave us extra for the next day. The man who was at the elevator most of the time was very friendly and kept the elevator in order because it got very busy at times. We needed extra hangers and go them immediately. One day my grandmother stayed back for part of the day because she wasn't feeling well and the cleaner came by. She was extremely friendly and even helped my grandma with the coffee maker because she couldn't get it to work.  We had 2 small issues one with the front desk and with one of the security guards. Overall I would go back again.

title: Modern and convenient
text: Great location with modern, well-planned rooms. One of the most modern rooms I've stayed in any hotel. The staff was friendly and met all of my needs. Easy access to great restaurants and sightseeing.

title: Great hotel
text: Great reception staff and concierge, brilliant room size for 3 people with a large bathroom. House maids cleaned the room every day, changed towels, made beds and restocked water, tea/coffee etc. Had a fridge in the room. Blacked out curtains were great, you did hear sirens and some crowd noise but your in the main area so you can't complain, being near everything makes up for it. Went to the roof top bar and were meant to sit outside but it was drizzling with rain so they accommodated us inside. Would definitely stay again.

title: The absolute best near times square
text: This would be my recommendation if you need a more spacious room. I dont like feeling like a sardine trapped in can. So if u feel the same you'll appreciate this hotel. Absolutely 💯 amazing 👏 The bathroom was great, the bed was comfy,  you have a fridge and a coffee maker. Unlimited tea and coffee they gave use real creamer too... free shampoo and conditioner not 2 in 1 plus lotion and shower gel and the staff was so accommodating! I would absolutely stay here again.

title: J y retournerai avec plaisir
text:
Très bonne situation,
Chambre double impeccable.
Très propre et spacieuse 
Vue super et calme .
Salle de bain magnifique.
Accueil du manager vraiment sympa .
Honnêtement rapport qualité plaisir,ça vaut la peine .
A conseiller 
Autant déçu de l hâyatt centric midtown autant hayatt centric time square vaut la peine .
Ne vous trompez pas en réservant vous ne serez pas déçu .

title: Top of the Heap!
text: Truly memorable experience made possible by an awesome TEAM. Clean, comfortable and relaxing atmosphere, with an attentive staff dedicated to excellence. Very rare in the industry and even more rare in NYC!

title: Great Experience
text: Everyone was very friendly and we had a great 10 year anniversary weekend here. We used the valet parking which was convenient and the rooftop bar was happening, don't forget to make a reservation for the roof top.  The perfect pint is right next door if you forget your reservation so we hit that place as well.

title: Loved it!
text: Perfect place being near time square and subways.  Will stay here every time based on proximity to everything including great food venues, broadway, transportation, entertainment, etc.  Great gym area as well.

title: Hotel cumple con las expectativas
text:
El hotel está bien ubicado, detrás de Times Square, pero la calle en si no es muy ruidosa p lo menos en el piso 20 con la ventana cerrada no había ruido. Se oía un poco de una de las habitaciones contiguas. Tampoco entraban ruidos del pasillo. La limpieza muy bien. 
El tamaño de la habitación adecuado para 4, lo único que se queda pequeño es el baño y la cantidad de perchas en el armario. La decoración es moderna, alguna pieza de mobiliario estaba un poco deteriorada. La habitación dispone de minibar vacío para tu uso, lo que en agosto es muy práctico para poder meter agua a enfriar. Todas las mañanas reponían la botellas de agua. El personal amable y servicial. El check-in y el check-out super rápido y eficiente.

title: Great hotel for a short NY Break
text: Stayed for 5 night in August, easy to get to and from the hotel, staff were very helpful and room cofortable and nicely designed. Street outside can be quite busy which makes gettig a taxi slow but if you just walk half a block to 6th avenue then you can get one here no problem.

title: Excellent location
text: We really enjoyed our stay, most of the staff were really helpful and any questions we asked were answered quickly by friendly staff. It was a shame that under 21’s couldn’t visit Bar 54 other than in the morning. My older teens would have loved to see the view at night.

title: Location location location
text:
This hotel is literally a 5 mins walk from Times Square down a side street. There is a macdonalds on the corner if your turn right outside the hotel and if you turn left  there is an irish pub and a shop/restaurant that does breakfast. We didnt eat at the hotel so cannot comment on that.
Tip: get a room higher than the 25th floor as there is quite a bit of road/outisde noise. 
Room was large and clean and the staff were lovely.

title: Nice Times Square Hyatt
text: My week stay at Hyatt Centric was great. It started with an upgrade to a suite as a Globalist member. Especially for New York, the suite was spacious and clean. I ordered breakfast daily on-site and it was delicious as well. The staff was friendly, and housekeeping had great attention to detail.

title: Mixed experience
text:
This location a few blocks outside of Times Square is very convenient. The lobby of the hotel is dark and small but the staff are friendly and generally helpful. Elevator moves quickly and there two banks, one for lower floors and another for upper.  Our two queen bed room was spacious by NY standards, modern, clean and fairly hip. Note while the bathroom was spacious, the most countertop I’ve ever seen in NY, with a ledge the width of the entire bathroom, our room did not have a bathtub. The shower is large.  Helpful to have a mini fridge and unlimited bottled water from the front desk. Good a/c.

Lighting in the room is plentiful but one of the bedside lights did not turn entirely off and flickered all night. Half of the outlets didn’t work which was problematic for phone charging and coffee maker.  No restaurant on site, just a 54th floor bar with incredible views.  Breakfast bag room service available and a Starbucks across the street.

Note they charge a $35 a night resort fee and they give you a card that offers several discounts. One is $15 off a night for parking bringing the rate to $75 a night instead of $90. Very expensive.

Overall there are some great things about this property but some improvements needed.

title: Best Weekend Ever
text: Such a great place to stay, right in the heart of the city, great views from the 54 floor for dinner and drinks, much more quite than I ever thought it would have been, so clean and very comfortable.  We loved this hotel and plan to go back.

title: Weekend trip with family
text: The Centric was a clean and modern hotel in a great location - half block outside of Times Sq.  The location is an easy walk to the theatres, shops and restaurants in the area. All our activities were within a 10 - 15 minute walk.  The staff were wonderful - very pleasant and accommodating.  We will definitely consider this location for future visits to the city!

title: Not so nice staff were very rude
text:
Sappers rude at time of check in 
Your front entrance smelt like urine there was a homeless gentleman peeing on the side of your building and it smelt very bad I am a Hyatt member and I was traveling with friends on business and I was very disappointed in the service I received and I brought I potential customer of mine for business not a very good look

title: great location for broadways shows!
text: Awesome location in the Times Square area and was great for us as we were seeing Broadway; Since it's on a side street, not noisy at all. Very comfortable room with two queen beds. The staff was responsive and helpful.

title: Best Time Square location yet! 1 minute from Time Square!
text: The room was very quiet and very clean. We didn't hear the noise of the city at nignt. Helpfull staff and friendly. Nice view from room. Ask for floor 30 and up. You can park on same street on the other side of Time Square for 35$/day. 1 minute walk.

title: No Customer Bar, Restaurant, or Room Service!
text:
This HYATT hotel is not honest with its amenities. There is no bar or restaurant. After the Broadway show, I wanted to take my party to the bar for a glass of wine, but  I needed a reservation to get into the bar! So I made the reservation, and the show ended later than I thought, so I canceled. They still charged me for it! No bar for the guests!!!????? Then I went to my room and tried to order room service.

At least you could have packaged sandwiches or some food, not requiring a kitchen. NO ROOM SERVICE FOR $400 a night!!!! The Hyatt should make the very clear on your website with a needed acknowledgment. Just very disappointing for an HYATT. The Manager offered me a discount, but I did not want money. Could you fix this?

The Bar in the hotel should be for Hyatt's customers. For room service, maybe a small menu supported by a local restaurant. I am sure there is a solution to these issues with creative thinking.

title: Not as good this time
text:
We had previously stayed at this hotel in 2020 and thought it was great so we had no hesitation in booking to stay here again this year.  Unfortunately, our stay this time wasn't as good.  

On the plus side, the location is great, the rooms are a good size and the beds are super comfortable.  I can't speak for all the rooms but our room on the 24th floor had a good view, which was nice to look out to in the evening.  Staff were attentive and when we required more towels and water, it was replenished aplenty.  

A few things marred our stay.  The room seemed clean but the bottoms of our socks were black with dirt before we even left the room each day.  This would indicate how dirty the floor was, even if it didn't look like it.  I was also bitten on my leg in the night and it has remained to be painful despite using ointment to minimise the itching.  The shower was very weak.  I took forever in the shower as it took a lot of effort to rinse the shampoo and conditioner out.  Not only was this frustrating but this isn't good for the environment.  Lastly, the toilet paper is ridiculously thin.  I expect better for the price paid for the hotel.

Based on the above, I don't think I would choose to stay at the Hyatt Centric again, which is a shame due to all the plus points.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location & Great Staff
text: We celebrated our daughter's sweet 16 in NYC this past week.  Hotel treated her like a princess. Room upgrade, complimentary room service breakfast one of the mornings, and passes to a nearby attraction.

title: Great Hotel
text: The hotel is perfect if you want a super clean, great staff hotel.  There aren't a lot of frills, but that's not what I wanted.  The room was VERY clean, modern, and well kept.  They provide online check in and check out, which is super convenient.

title: Good sized rooms, good location
text:
I really liked this hotel. The room was a good size for NYC, clean bathroom with a nice shower. There was no tub, for those who care about that, I don't. All staff were great, check in was easy, security at the elevator did their job along w being friendly and the room cleaning staff were excellent. We stayed on the 47th floor and it was a good view. Also the elevator was really fast! The modern design and decor was nice and fresh, love it!

Times square is just up the block, there's a Starbucks across the street and it's very walkable to 30 Rock, subway and ubers had no problem getting in there. I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent location
text: Excellent location just a 2 minute walk from Times Square. Decent sized modern rooms with good air con. Was expecting a better view from our hotel room description. The receptionist who checked us in was so lovely and engaging. I have removed 1* as had a very rude receptionist who checked us out, made me feel guilty for leaving luggage and kept cutting my conversation. My daughter was shocked at the way she spoke to me. Room 2502/2503 checked out on Tuesday 23/8 - hopefully management read this and take action as have read other reviews complaining about rude staff.

title: Great customer service and convenient location
text: Visited NY to see MJ with my sister and 16 year old. Arrived early and thankfully we were able to check in early and get settled. Check in was professional and courteous and Yenny went above and beyond to provide recommendations for activities beyond the musical. The oversized Double Queen was spacious considering normal sizes for NY. Additionally, the room was very clean. We had an issue with our mattress and ended up using the app to contact support at 2am! Thankfully they came and resolved and we were able to get a good nights sleep. Overall an A+ stay. Too bad we didn’t have time to check out the rooftop bar.

title: Oops
text: I totally spaced on my reservations and had my check in a day later than when I showed up to Hotel.  I had a quest from Seoul, Korea with me showing her NYC for the first time and it could have been a very costly and embarrassing mistake.  Hyatt staff could not have been more understanding and quickly changed my reservations, so I didn't miss a beat in check in and continuing with our site seeing vacation in NYC>  Thank you so much!!

title: Habitaciones muy amplias y camas estupendas
text: Tienen unas habitaciones conectadas para familias que son estupendas. Las camas son maravillosas. Es una pena que no haya restaurante para desayuno y que no te dejen subir al rooftop con los niños a verlo por la tarde.

title: Perfect Stay
text: Staff are friendly and always very welcoming. Needs and requests are always met in no wait. Tidy and spacious rooms. Bathrooms are always clean. High speed elevators. Functional fitness center. Amazing front desk service. Perhaps they could install water refilling stations every floor. It gets hassle when you have to go down to the lobby just to ask for bottled water.

title: Very Nice hotel, Excellent staff, great location
text:
An Amazing location, 3 min walk from times square, very close to a few subway lines, Great staff, and very welcoming (everyone I faced during my stay was great!!). 
My room was Deluxe King on the 43rd floor (4302) and it was a nice room with a great view of Time square and the rest of the city.
The GYM is well equipped and really in a good size.
Lucas at the door was great, nice, welcoming and so helpful on my way in and out and he make a great service to the hotel image!!

On the downside, The hotel is not new and the elevators are a little small for such a hotel. The air conditioning in the room was great but too noisy and made an unpleasant noise while starting and stopping.
The hotel does not have a real lobby so do not plan for any business meetings there.

To summarise, I loved this hotel, usually, it is too expensive but if in a reasonable price (like this time) I would surely come back.

title: Great location - Excellent accommodations, very friendly employees!
text: Fantastic stay at Hyatt Centric Times Square. Nice clean, comfortable, updated rooms. Very friendly and accommodating employees. Great views, nice roof top bar on 54th floor! Couldn't be happier with our stay.

title: G
text: Good experience in stay Hyat centric. It's location and room cleaning service is excellent and for family it's very good hotel for stay and safe. I really appreciate of staff those guys so professional and helpful.

title: Accommodating, clean hotel
text: Staff here went above and beyond.  Centrally located; could walk to basically anywhere within the city, provided you like to walk!  Very clean and highly recommend!  Plan on staying there again when I'm in NYC.

title: What can we do to make this right
text:
As a person that has owned numerous businesses if or when something went wrong the frist and only thing we as a company would say or ask was WHAT CAN WE DO TO MAKE THINGS RIGHT.
That being said we were there for an anniversary stay upon checking into the room we noticed the AC had been turned off, so the room was warm we turned the temperature down and left for a while waiting for the room to cool down rather that enjoy the serenity of out suite yes suite on the 50th floor as we had planned on do before heading out for the evening. Upon returning the room had cooled off a bit but nowhere enough, We proceeded to get ready for our evening out and left thinking and hopping the room would be cool. Wishful thinking upon our return it was warmer than it was when we let almost as bad as it was upon our arrival when we found the AC turned off. Maintenance was summoned to the room near midnight to repair the problem after 20 some odd mins in the room the employee felt he had corrected the issue. Warm as it was, we were tired and decided to go to bed and hope it would cool off it did not. So when we both woke up at 4am sweating we decided to try and go back to sleep and tolerate the heat as we had to be up by 8am. upon checking out I was able to speak to a very nice young woman about the issue she listened and offered to not charge us the room fee of $30 sum odd dollars that would have been charged at check out. I decided not to right any reviews till I thought more about the entire situation, so I do not believe I am writing this in the heat of the moment. Considering everything, I now reflect back to my customers and feel it appropriate to say Hyatt you can do better 
WHAT CAN WE "HYATT DO TO MAKE THIS RIGHT
I saved the best for last we have a service dog that was in the room enduring the heat

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square is a beautiful property!
text: Very, very clean. Our room was spotless to the point it felt like we were the first guests actually occupying the room. Staff experience was fantastic. They were friendly and very helpful. Hotel bar 54 was awesome! Drink were a little on the pricey side, but good.  We would definitely stay there again.

title: Great hotel with fantastic location!
text: We stayed in a corner room with amazing views, it was modern, spacious and very clean. Comfortable beds and pillows. Short walk to Times Square and many restaurants.  Staff was friendly, no complaints, we will stay here again!

title: Another great stay at this Hyatt Times Square. Rooms are clean and comfortable.  Location is exemplary.  My go to
text: Another amazing stay at this exemplary Hyatt.  Always my go to location great clean rooms that include views of Times Square and look to book the rooms that have balconies with friendly and helpful staff from management to bellman check in to security

title: So close to everything
text: The Hyatt Centric Time Square is centrally located to Time Square and very convenient to shopping, theatre, and great food.  The staff were personable and friendly. They were very helpful and enabled us to get through our 'to do' list.  Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to NYC!

title: Gran hotel
text:
Hotel  céntrico, muy bien situado, a un minuto de Times Square,  con instalaciones muy adecuadas para una agradable estancia en el centro de NY.
El personal no especialmente amable,  en toda nuestra estancia en recepción no encontramos a nadie que hablara español.  Dede muy antipática, quiso cobrarnos un desayuno que no habíamos consumido en toda la estancia haciéndonos parecer a toda la familia delincuentes, por otro lado Alana muy amable al mostrarnos el mirador de la planta 54.

title: It does the job
text:
The locaton is very good.
The hotel does the job: nothing nice nor bad to say.
There was no way for the concierge to book us a taxi to drive to the airport the day of our departure: we had to book a Huber by ourselves.

title: Très bien situé, mais service bof
text:
Hôtel super bien situé (coin de Times square) avec un starbuck juste en face pour le petit dej.
Par contre nous avions demandé une chambre dans les étages…placé au 35 eme…réveillés à cause des ambulances ou police ou autre…c était pas très cool alors que demande bien longtemps à l avance…
La chambre etl hôtel sont propre. il n y a pas de coffre dans les chambres. Le service est sans le plus….aucun effort pour parler lentement si on ne comprend pas bien l anglais…
A l arrivée empreinte de la CB pour 300€ de caution en cas de dégradations,compréhensif…mais le lendemain de notre départ on reçoit par mail une Facture de 135$ pour avoir accédé durant 3 jours à la Wifi…et forcément prit sur la CB car ils avaient l empreinte, ça par contre on l a en travers…car rien donné au moment du départ.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: From beginning to end, we had a great experience. Really great location next to Times Square. Added plus that there was dedicated valet parking in front. A few other hotels we have stayed at didn’t have this and stopping in Manhattan is stressful enough. We stayed on the 37th floor and upgraded to a larger room with two queen beds. You can’t go wrong booking with this hotel and the size of rooms!! The rooms were also nice and clean and airy!! The staff at the front desk on both days/nights were so kind, as was the older gentleman that requested fist pumps from our teenaged kids while we searched for our key card to go up the elevators (night security)! The only one downfall, which wasn’t a concern of ours, but it was noticeable was the different temperature in the hallways and elevator, really warm. But, once you are in your room it’s nice and fresh or whatever you set the thermostat to!! This hotel will be our go to!!!

title: Très bon Hôtel
text:
1er séjour à NY à 4, chambre au 45ème étage très grande (plus de 40m2 très appréciable), très bien insonorisée. Ménage fait tous les jours, cafetière et bouteille d'eau chaque jour.
Emplacement idéal pour un 1er séjour
Personnel extrêmement réactif pour tout demande et très à l'écoute du client.
Pour le dernier jour nous partions à 15h30 et l'hôtel nous a gratuitement laissé la chambre.
Je recommande.

title: Great hotel from location, rooms and staff, highly recommend
text: The staff were very accommodating after a dreadful experience in another hotel that made has book the hotel at very short notice. The hotel itself is in a great location, the staff very polite and professional and the rooms were great. Highly recommend if you want to stay in Times Square.

title: Exceptional Hotel and Service.
text: Easily the best hotel experience I have had in many years of my travel to NYC. I will give 5 stars for the hotel, the location, the quality and cleanliness of the rooms, and more importantly the service from reception to room cleaning was just the best.

title: Perfect spot in nyc
text: Perfect location to visit time square and see broadway shows .  Close to great restaurants. Clean comfortable rooms.  Friendly helpful staff. Knowledgeable about great local  places to eat and visit. Great views from top floors.

title: Not a great stay!
text: My family and I stayed in Hyatt Centric Times Square New York for 4 nights. The best part of the hotel is the location and the worst part is the hospitality. No matter how busy the hotel is, you expect the staff to be courteous, but that was not the case here as I found them rude and ill mannered. Apart from that everything else was alright.

title: Noisy hotel, unfriendly staff and hidden extra charges
text:
Stayed in three hotels during our recent trip and this was by far the worst. Unfriendly/ bordering on rude reception staff. Very noisy hotel so had to sleep with ear plugs every night. Also the smallest bedroom of the hotels we stayed in.

Also hidden charges to stay at this hotel - was presented with a mandatory per-night destination tax to pay on leaving. When questioned about this was told this was for large hotels (but the Hilton I stayed in New York did not charge me this). I was then told it was to stay near Times Square - which if I’d known then I would not have booked here considering the noise levels and smaller room size.

Was also not allowed to visit the roof terrace to take photos as I had two teenage children. Apparently you have to book to access the roof terrace and can only visit at 10.30am in the morning. So glad I was charged a destination fee but then wasn’t allowed to visit part of the destination itself!

Don’t waste your money here - book somewhere a few blocks away (e.g. Hilton) where the rooms are larger and quieter, the staff are polite and courteous and you aren’t stung by a “mandatory” destination fee.

title: Lovely stay at Hyatt Centric
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Centric Time Square. Staff was very friendly, especially the housekeeping, and made us feel welcomed. We stayed on the 10th floor. The room was spacious enough and had queen beds, unlike many other hotels in the area. It was super quiet on the 10th floor. Excellent location- right next to Times Square and walkable distance to subways that we used most (42nd st & Rockefeller). Lots of restaurants and pubs nearby. Agree with other reviews- breakfast is ridiculously expensive and did not make any sense of that pricing/offering. On the bright side, there is a nice breakfast place/store just 200 feet away :). Having said that, we would definitely stay here again and our overall experience was very good!

title: Great place, great staff, perfect !
text: Perfect place to be in NYC. Staff is sooo helpul ans sweet ! All around us, all was clean. The room was perfect (3705) with a good vew on time squares. Thank you so much, I RECOMMEND this place. We were there for honeymoon. we felt so loved. THANK YOU.

title: Excellent hotel!
text: My stay there was truly perfect!  Location is great, as it is within walking distance to many places of interest, theaters, subway station, bus tour stops, stores, restaurants, etc.  Staff are extremely helpful and pleasant.  I do hope to return to NYC and stay there again.

title: Ice cold showers
text:
Shower door would not close and there was no hot water 
We had to take ice cold showers.  It was miserable.  
The staff did fix the shower door but both mornings all of us had to take cold showers.  They did not do anythig to assist us

title: would surely recommend to all our friends and family
text:
we were checked in by Dyana and Ritchie and both were very friendly and made our first day a pleasant one... thank you both hope you can see this and know I really appreciate that
the room is very clean and exceeded our expectations

title: Perfect stay
text: No complaints except for the pricey drinks at the B54 bar.  Otherwise excellent location, clean rooms and helpful staff.  Rooms air-conditioned.  Wifi good.  Honestly cannot complain about anything much.  Highly recommend this hotel

title: Terrific stay
text: This was a great hotel. Room and bathroom were large by NYC standards. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean. Beds and pillows were comfortable, and the hallway was quiet. You do hear some road noise, but we connected our white noise app to their fancy alarm clock/speaker and that eliminated any sound. Great location within Times Square. Starbucks across the street and plenty of food choices nearby.  Great rooftop terrace - you need to be 21 but kids can go up at 10:30 each morning to take in the views. Will stay again.

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square NY
text: Lage ist sehr zentral und das Hotel freundlich und sauber. Hier und da könnten in den Ecken mal eine Erneuerung stattfinden aber alles im Rahmen . Würden das Hotel wieder buchen. Wasser und Handtücher immer gewechselt und kostenlos . Vielen Dank

title: Home away from home
text:
Hyatt centric Times Square never fails to make my vacations the best they can be.  The cleanliness and quietness of the hotel are appreciated. The staff: Yenni, DeDe, DaShawn, Aleisha, Luis, Diane, Eva, Latoya and Sayed. Thank you so very very much which started from your smiles on ending the hotel. 
Housekeeping thank you for immediately responding to our requests.  Breakfast was convenient and enjoyable.  Location. location!  The quietness of the hotel to the wild excitement of Times Square just s few steps away! You guys will definitely see us soon.
Thank you once again

title: OK but noisy
text:
my room is on 37th floor, face the HM building. the room is small and tidy, and is enough for my business trip. i was happy until ...

3am, i woke up, feeling like i'm sleeping on the street. I can hear the music from the street corner so clearly. the room is filled with the music. the glass window wall is not noise cancelling at all.

i asked front desk is this night noise common? he just said "the city never sleeps" lol

the music started at 3am and didn't completely stop until 4:30am. for the whole time i cannot sleep, the noise is just so loud. and after 4:30am i can't fall sleep again.

title: Ein gutes Hotel im Herzen NY
text:
Ich war mit meiner Familie 4 Tage im Hyatt Centric als Stopover nach Las Vegas und wir waren sehr zufrieden.Das Upgrade auf eine CornerSuite in der 47 Etage war hervorragend.Wichtig war uns vor allem der Blick aus dem Zimmer und die Lage.Beides wurde zur unserer vollsten Zufriedenheit erfüllt.Nicht sehr viele Hotels in NY bieten das.Die Hotelbar ist ebenfalls klasse,wobei wir den selben Ausblick aus dem Zimmer hatten.Die Drinks sind nicht gerad preiswert,aber sehr gut.
In der direkten Umgebung gibt es alles,was man braucht.Die Mitarbeiter  und der Service sind ebenfalls hervorzuheben.Einach gut und sehr freundlich.Für meine Bewertung ziehe ich keinerlei Vergleiche mit anderen Hotels  hinzu,da man nicht vergessen darf,wo man ist und für was man zahlt.Natürlich ist es die Lage und der Ausblick ,die dabei eine große Rolle spielen.Jederzeit würde ich dieses Hotel wieder buchen.

title: Perfect Base for our Family Trip to NYC
text: I stayed with my two teens in a two Queen room for a long weekend vacation. Room was typical size for NYC but well laid out and made good use of the space. We didn't spend a great deal of time in the room so not a major concern. Room was very quiet - both in terms of street noise and other rooms, hallway, elevator, etc. Great location if you want to be near the action; Hotel is less than 1 block from Times Square, relatively close to several subway stops, very close to several popular Broadway theaters, and walkable to Rockefeller center, Grand Central station, and Empire State Building. Rooftop bar requires reservations and is 21+ but guests can get drinks to take to their room.

title: Great stay and location
text: We came in for the the night for a last minute stay to celebrate our daughters birthday. The valet/bellman took great care in getting us in as soon as possible as the street was bumper to bumper cars. Check in was easy and our room was fabulous with a view of Time Square. We had a suite that gave us more room for the 4 of us.

title: Hôtel au top
text: Hôtel moderne, propre, ascenseurs rapides, nous étions au 34eme étage et c'était très silencieux. Personnel agréable. Situé juste à côté de times square. Pour resumer, je recommande vivement cet hôtel!

title: Great stay at Hyatt Centric NYC
text:
This was my second time staying at the Hyat Centric.
Another great experience from Jorge in reservations to the front desk - everyone was incredibly helpful!
Steps away from Times Square, restaurants, theatre - all within steps from hotel.
King room with floor to ceiling windows and incredible views of the city.
Can't wait to go back!

title: DO NOT use the valet
text:
I was charged for a movie I did not rent. 

I also had to wait 1 hour for my car from valet.  I was told 20 minutes.    After 30 minutes I was told I was the next car up.  After 50 minutes no one answered the phone wherever they were calling and he said my car was not listed on the computer which meant it left the garage but he couldn’t tell me where it was or contact anyone about it.  I waited another 15 minutes for my car to finally arrive.  I cannot believe I was charged $75 for this service.   I will not be staying there again and this is where I have stayed the past couple of years for my daughters end of year gift to the city.
