title: Great location and base
text: Lovely large hotel bedroom with a great view from the 29th floor.  Room and bathroom were kept immaculately clean by housekeeping.  Bed was very comfortable and air con worked brilliantly.  Fabulous location just yards from Times Square and a perfect location to use as a base to explore New York.  Reception staff excellent, apart from on night of arrival.  Very unhelpful and prolonged check in which was not ideal after a long day of travelling.  No issues after that.  Gym very good and never that busy.

title: In the heart of NY, pleasant stay with friendly staff and well kept rooms. Try the roof top bar!
text:
Good location though in a crowded part of NY but easy to walk around Manhattan. Clean, functional rooms, friendly staff and housekeeping teams. 
Rooftop bar is refreshing, do ask for outdoor seating - this is bit pricey due to cover charges but nice experience nevertheless.

title: Excellent base for family trip to NYC!
text: We stayed for 5 nights as a family of 4 with 2 daughters aged 12 & 14. The hotel was perfectly located for exploring NYC with Times Square literally outside the door. We walked to Grand Central, the Edge, 5th Avenue, Central Park, Broadway and the Rockerfella, all a nice walk taking in the views and everything NYC has to offer. Big thanks to Michael Benitez on front desk who sorted out a trip up to Bar54 during the afternoon for my family to see the views from the roof.

title: Great stay and super friendly staff
text: Stayed over 4 days at Hyatt Centric for a family holiday. Great location to explore Manhattan a stones throw from Times Square and the nearest subway only 3 streets away on 42nd. Our 2 rooms were great on the 37th Floor with a great view of Times Square and with a corner room could see all the way down to the Hudson River and a stunning sunset. Special mention to Mike on reception who was super helpful as initially we couldn’t get an adjoining room with our two daughters however he did a bit of shuffling and the result was perfect and made the holiday a great relaxed experience and top customer service. Bar 54 was a great night, pricy but great views and the patio is a must especially for couples as the 2 seated tables are up against the glass…..just don’t look down! Overall would highly recommend.

title: Great NY hotel
text: check in was smooth, we were welcomed like family. We were greeted each time we came back over our three-day visit to NY. The room was fabulous, the shower was the best ever!  Checkout was online and easier than check in.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Très bruyant
text:
L'insonorisation par rapport à l'extérieur pour les chambres avec vue laisse a désirer.
Le dernier jour nous avons essayé a 17h d'aller prendre un verre au bar mais on nous a dit que ce n'était pas possible car privatisé !
Le plus la situation géographique.Sur la chambre et le ménage rien a redire.

title: My new go-to hotel whenever I’m in NYC.
text: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The room was very spacious by NYC standards. Service was top notch and location could not be beat. Bar 54 on the rooftop is a plus. Cocktails and views were amazing. Highly recommend.

title: Great location, super clean & quiet rooms
text:
My daughter, granddaughter & I (all over 18) shared a double queen corner room. Plenty big, contemporary & bright & very clean & very quiet. No carpet!  Convenient walk to TS.  Only negative, no cafe. 
Staff was great.

title: Room is not ready after 5 hours waiting
text:
We arrived at 4pm, was told the room is not ready and offered another room to stay temporarily. We were also told the room we will get will be on the same floor.  5 hours passed, room is not ready, and we ended up being moved to another floor.

Also, It is my fault to not pay attention that our car does not get the in-out privileges.  We were charged another 90 for this.  But seriously, after you made us waiting 5 hours for our room, how could you give me that firm face saying I need to pay this 90 and not providing any flexibility?

title: Great central spot for touring NYC!
text: The hotel was lovely and well appointed. The staff were very friendly and helpful with any questions.  We were on the 26th floor and could see some of Times Square. We had a corner room with two queen beds. Our group was four women and I was nervous that the room would be too small for us, but I needn't have been. It was plenty big for us and our stuff! One other thing that surprised me was how quiet it was. Very little traffic noise. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Located within a short walk of Times Square, Broadway, Ellen's Stardust Diner, subways and more amazing food and attractions that you can count! Summit One Vanderbilt is close and a great evening (dusk) activity.

title: Convenient Location
text: My friend and I had a wonderful time at the Hyatt. You can't beat the location - right in the heart of Times Square. We were so close to many restaurants and theaters. The staff at front desk were all very nice and the room was clean and neat. The only negatives were that the water pressure in the shower wasn't very strong and the $28 breakfast that we ordered wasn't nearly as filling as it should have been for that price.

title: MODERNO Y CENTRICO
text:
La ubicación del hotel es buenísima, es un hotel muy moderno y con  buenas instalaciones.
Las habitaciones son amplias y cómodas y tiene un bar terraza en la planta 54 que merece la pena visitar. También tiene gimnasio disponible las 24h.

title: Hyatt Times Square
text:
The Hyatt in Times Square was a great location.  Staff were friendly and our housekeeping staff were wonderful!  
The USB port did not work in either room- so be prepared. The ice machine didn’t work on our floor- you had go to a different floor for ice.
We had a king suite adjoining to 2 queen bed room.  Our rooms were clean and very nice. The living room was a great place to gather with our family.  Being in Times Square, it was quiet- only hear the occasional siren.
The beds were just a bit harder than we prefer and there is no dedicated space with a mirror to get ready other than the bathroom. 
Close to all the action of Times Square! 
We would definitely consider staying here again.

title: Great hotel and staff!
text: Staff was friendly and helpful which wasn't common in other places in the area. Room was very clean, great views. We checked out the rooftop bar which was nice. Felt very safe in hotel and it was a 1 min walk to Time Square area. There is a Starbucks right next to hotel lobby also. Great location walkable to TimeSquare and Rockafeller center. Short Uber drive to Central Park.

title: Super service, very clean, great location
text: The staff was very friendly, especially the valet service was great in assuring us to take our time when we arrived (very busy traffic!!).  Needed a bottle opener and one was brought to our room in a couple minutes.  Room was very clean and nice.  My only suggestion for improvement would be to replace the pillows with better ones.  The bed was decent.  There's a bit of noise but that's to be expected given the location.  The benefit being that you can walk to the theatres! (Wicked, Hamilton, Strange Loop).  I'd go again.

title: Fabulous hotel all across the board
text: Staff are friendly and courteous at all times. All are ready to lend any assistance you might require. Rooms are immaculate and the beds are fabulous ! Views are breathtaking !! My absolute favorite place to stay when in the city !!

title: Hotel in the middle of the action
text: This was the perfect location in Times Square to attend multiple Broadway shows and to be near all the action!  We were within walking distance to numerous shops, restaurants, and shows.  The ball on time square is literally around the corner.  The hotel is quiet and very clean. The staff is very friendly.  We really enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

title: bon hôtel mais
text:
avons séjourné 7 j dans cet hotel qui est très bien situé 
le seul souci est que notre chambre située au 19° étage était assez bruyante...
pour le reste rien à dire à part que nous avons eu un, supplément de 241 usd pour les taxes ,... ... pour3 pers pour 7j...
sinon idéalement situé et présence d'un vigile à l'entrée à partir de 16h pour monter dans les étages --> très sécurisant
sinon chambre TB rien à dire.
avons petit souci avec le coffre fort de la chambre qui ne fonctionnait pas --> souci résolu en 15 min service technique très réactif '(souci de piles du codeur)

title: Excellent!
text: Wonderful experience with hotel staff - great customer service and so accommodating!  The room was large, clean, and great for a family of four.  Location is great and easy access to so many places - but on a side street so it was not noisy at all, considering Times Square was half a block away.  Loved our stay!

title: Great NYC accommodations in Times Square
text: Excellent location, walking distance to theatre, great food, Central Park, and  shopping.  Hotel was modern, and welcoming.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  The most important aspect  was the enjoyable quiet place to rest after the high energy and sounds of the city.

title: Weekend Broadway Haven
text: For my money this is the hotel to good for a weekend of Broadway.  We have spent many weekends with them and can say without concern, that for us, the Hyatt Centric is a prefect haven for a weekend on Broadway.  You can walk to the ticket booth in 5 minutes, see the sites of Time Square, and and never worry about a cab, subway ride, or a long hike across the city.  We walked to Phantom and Book of Mormon from the hotel, stopping for dinner before, and then back without ever breaking a sweat or worrying about transportation.  If you are doing Broadway... book here... the hotel is great... the location is magic... and the team is very helpful.

title: Good location
text: Clean hotel. We were missing a lounge or nice place to sit together with our kids (other than the room). The bas is not accessible to kids so you have no nice area to have some relaxing time with childrens in the hotel. The restaurant was closed during our stay but we were not aware of this when we booked.

title: Great location. Super rooms
text: Stayed here twice now and both times it has been superb. Location is great. Gym well equipped. Rooftop bar really special (and the cocktails are too!). The rooms are large, well appointed and spotlessly clean. Highly recommended.

title: Location and rooftop bar to die for!
text: Room had an amazing view of some of times square.   The bed was very comfortable and the combo wet room for the shower tub was very spacious for NYC.   The highlight of this hotel is the rooftop bar.    breathtaking views of the city 54 floors up.

title: Central NYC
text: Excellent location for the hotel, friendly and very helpful staff. Large A/C rooms with Tea, coffee and water made available. Also included fridge, safe large shower and a small seating area. Not disappointed!

title: My NEW favorite hotel in NYC!
text: I have already stayed at this property twice this year, and it is a wonderful property!  Staff is wonderful.  Staff is kind, courteous, and efficient.  Check-in is easy and quick.  Food and drinks are good.  I have dietary issues (hard-boiled eggs) and the hotel is ALWAYS able to accommodate my request.  Rooms are clean, and if there are any problems ( I like a top sheet instead of just the duvet...house-keeping comes right up and puts one on).  The hotel always goes the EXTRA mile to make the hotel guests feel welcomed.  I appreciate the managers and staff.  It makes for a wonderful experience.  And, it is a great location.  I will be back soon.

title: Boutique Hotel Right Tucked Away Right Next to Time Square
text: Overall, my stay at this hotel was fantastic. The hotel's front desk staff and the bellmen were kind and very helpful. I felt safe going to my room because I noticed that they have staff checking guests before they get on the elevator. Our room was very modern, clean and the bathroom was great. It had good counter space, nice size shower, and standalone tub. I loved that I could set the bathroom lighting to a "nightlight" setting. It was exactly what I need to find the bathroom in the middle of the night. The hotel is very close to Times Square, so we didn't need a taxi for dinner, shopping or the theater. And, the hotel has a nice bar on the rooftop with good (but pricey) drinks along with a great view. We came for my birthday, but I would definitely stay at this hotel if I need to come to New York for business too.

title: Loved It Here
text: We stayed for 4 nights for a city break in NYC.  Pleased with the location, a short distance from Times Square.  Our room was a good size, modern and very clean.  All staff we encountered were pleasant, particularly the concierge, and we would use again.  Recommended.

title: Great location, Safe and clean!
text: Great location, Safe and clean!  Small family of 4...loved the 2 queen size beds. Close enough the everything and a short walk to the subway.   They had security ensuring guest only enter the elevators.  Felt really safe!   They clean or ask if you need cleaning daily, you don't see that often anymore.  A Perfect 5 out of 5 star rating!

title: Quick Trip to NYC
text: Perfect location for a Jazz Concert nearby. Close to everything.  Bar 54 a big plus! Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be in the heart of NYC.  Very modern and clean and a great staff to welcome travelers of all kinds.  🤗

title: Times Square NYC hopping
text: What a great night in the heart of NYC. The bed at the Hyatt was one of the best I have slept in. Clean and modern, the hotel was quiet , safe, perfect. The lobby was clean and front staff were always there assisting.

title: Vacay nyc
text: We stayed 4 nights for family vacay in NYC. Convenient location right next to Times Square. Hotel condition was new and clean. Guest service was prompt. They provided bottles of water for free unlimited which was very helpful as we walked so much for city tour.

title: Excellent location, easy to get in and out.
text: Great customer service. Loved the smaller lobby and quick elevators. We could easily get in and out of the hotel. Loved the heated bathroom floors! Will recommend to others and hopefully we will be back.

title: First time family trip to NYC
text: This hotel location was perfect. The hotel staff was welcoming to our family who arrived wide eyed to the hustle & bustle of the big city. Modern and comfortable, close to everything you might need. And time square was just around the corner.

title: Everything you want and need!
text: This is the place to be on Times Square. Staff is friendly and fun. Rooms are nice and clean. New York is dubbed being full of rude people but this is NOT the case at Hyatt Centric Times Square. Amazing staff makes a place and it made this place perfect!

title: Great Stay!
text: Our family enjoyed our stay at Hyatt Centric Times Square. Rooms were very clean and spacious. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was convenient since it’s a short walk to Times Square, Broadway, food and shopping.

title: Great location for tourists but not a "grand" hotel.
text: Hyatt Centric Times Square is at a perfect location for tourists. Right in the heart of Times Square, only a half block away. The hotel itself is quite small. Unlike a regular hotel, there wasn't much common areas for guests to sit and relax. The only common area is basically the lobby which only has a few chairs, front desk, and elevators. The room itself was okay. Our room was a double queen room on the 50th floor. Great view, room and bathroom was big enough. Furniture in the room felt cheap and old. The room needed drawers and more cabinet space. There just wasn't enough space to store items. The floor was laminated hardwood so the sound tends to bounce around and it can get loud easily - which means we could also hear our neighbors easily.  Overall, the hotel was at a perfect location, size of room was perfect, but the value for money was not so much. The hotel did not feel luxurious enough, especially with the furniture they had.

title: NEW YORK TOUR WITH FAMILY
text: Hyatt was as expected , There  was check in delays due to late check out from previous guests . Overall satisfactory . But third day checkout staff was a  bit less friendly with questions about July 04, and reluctant to check our bills for destination fees that was originally promised to be waived

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text: The hotel was perfectly located for our theatre visits, yet wasn’t too noisy at night. The room was large and the staff were friendly and helpful. The pillows weren’t comfy so you needed aboutv4 on top of each other to sleep but overall a great experience and I’d stay there again.

title: Hyatt Centric on the Mark
text: My wife and I spent two nights at this hotel in late June. We were warmly greeted by the front desk staff with easy check in. Our 50th floor room was extremely clean and very comfortable, especially the bed. We enjoyed an excellent view of Uptown from our window!  One special room feature we truly enjoyed was the heated floor in the bathroom - so nice. The hotel is in a wonderful midtown location just off Times Square allowing us to walk to the theater and restaurants. We found all the hotel staff to be very courteous and helpful!  Highly recommend this excellent hotel.

title: Very nice
text: We stayed here during our family vacation. It is in a great location, about a block from Time Square and four blocks from Central Park and easy access to the subway. I get up early every day and would walk to time square every morning and watch Good Morning America from the sidewalk. The rooms are clean, 2 queen size beds that were very comfortable and friendly staff. No open restaurant but room food service if you would like. Close to everything. We loved it.

title: NYC with family
text: Great place to stay when visiting New York with family. Convenient location near Times Square, with lots of restaurants and public transportation options. The staff was attentive and helpful staff in all our interactions.

title: Friendly. efficient and cool
text: the staff is prompt, courteous and very attentive. the bartenders on BAR 54 are amazing. the staff responds to issues quickly and goes out of the way to help. thank you for a great 10 days. I look forward to returning.

title: Excellent
text: Great hotel amazing location 30 seconds walk from Time square. Subway stations all very close. I booked a two double bed room which was a great size for NY we were able n the 14 floor & had a lovely view of the city. When booking I would request a room at a higher floor as Times Square can get quite vibrant in the early hours. Bed linen was such good quality & beds extremely comfortable, cleanliness of room was perfect. Reception staff were plentiful & always at hand to offer assistance. My son availed of the gym & was surprised for a hotel gym as to the amount of equipment available which was great. Fantastic deli literally a two minute walk by Connollys pub for breakfast or up a block to the Manhattan Deli both delicious A perfect location to access all theatres & short subway rides to East Village Soho etc

title: Great (no frills) Hotel about 100 yards from Times Square
text: I liked the hotel but especially the checkin process. Usually from the car to the room you spend and extra $20 getting your luggage into the room. Not here. Note that help was available but you weren’t bombarded to use their services.

title: Best place by Times Square!
text: Outstanding hotel, with outstanding service and rooms! All with an ultra convenient location adjacent to Times Square! The view from the upper level floors is outstanding! We had the executive King Suite! Great Room!

title: Good location, modern & clean rooms.
text: Overall I am satisfied with my stay as the rooms were modern and clean. Hotel location was great. There was a lack of spacious lobby and amenities but staff were helpful & friendly. I prefer a hotel that makes me feel like I’m on vacation-this site was more of a place to sleep but I understand that the location and Centric brand limit those opportunities.

title: Great hotel in the heart of Times Square
text:
Stayed here for a week on business near Times Square.

The hotel is in the heart of Times Square. You'll see people around at all times and its very lively. The room is comfortable and clean with great views of the area.

Stayed here for a week on business and it did not disappoint. The entire team from front desk to housekeeping was exceptional. They really went out of their way to take care of us on our stay here.

The housekeeping staff on the 36th floor really went above and beyond - checking with me everyday when I'd like the room cleaned, and apologizing profusely for any minor mistakes (which happens). The manager here wrote a letter to apologize for a minor mistake after so too.

Even when you dial in to talk to the staff for any questions or issues, they are very helpful. I'd left a pair of sunglasses and called to have Caitlyn pickup and you could hear the energy in her voice.

If you're looking for an affordable hotel to have a comfortable stay near Times Square, would recommend this one. It's also a close walk to Midtown South or towards Central Park area.

5/5 - stayed for business and proximity, left impressed with more.

title: Great place to stay. Fabulous service. Close to everything
text: Had a lovely time in New York. The staff are so friendly and helpful. It’s worth a trip to the 54th floor to see New York, especially at night. Unfortunately the hotel restaurant was closed but there were lots of options nearby.

title: Ok Stay
text:
Hotel location was good, rooms small but clean and nice. Staff weren't rude but not welcoming either. Exception was the cleaning staff - very nice.
My big complaint is Bar 54, Friends recommended it and we were excited to check it out. We were a family of 5 adults in 2 rooms for 5 nights. Plenty of money spent on those. Two family members went for a drink mid-afternoon but were told a reservation was needed and that there was a $50 minimum. There was not a person on the patio. They left. I then made a reservation for a couple days later, waited for a table outside, were seated and told it was a $50/person minimum. We only wanted one drink each before turning in. We left. The bar is not for guests like us. Very disappointing.

title: Great property and fine service
text:
Stayed 2 nights with my two teens.  Excellent service.  Rooms were very nice, well appointed.  Service from everyone we encountered was superb.   Lack of a restaurant is a bit of a disappointment, but not a big issue given the location.   

Hyatt Centric Times Square will be my preferred choice for my future midtown/ Times Square stays.

title: June 2022 NYC trip
text:
Booked 2 rooms and was surprised how big each room was. The room for the boys had 2 queen size beds and had views of Times Square, our room was a king size bed, bigger than uk size king.

Staff were very helpful and had no issues giving any extra water bottles when requested.

title: Great value
text: I was disappointed that the restaurant was closed, but overall, this is a really good value for a family on vacation.  The venue is ideally located, just 2 blocks from the center of Times Square, thus not directly in the high noise zone.  Staff is very friendly and very helpful.

title: Quick Business Trip
text: Only in the room from 11 pm to 7 am. It has good amenities for plugging in business electronics. Front office staff was good. Rooftop restaurant had nice skyline views if you like congested cities,  that is.

title: Sehr gutes Hotel
text: Schönes und sauberes Hotel mit nettem Service direkt am Times Square. Perfekte Lage um die Stadt zu erkunden. Zum Times Square und Metro sind es nur 1-2 Minuten zu Fuss. Einige Frühstücksrestaurants in der unmittelbaren Nähe

title: Great stay and great people
text: Perfect Hotel! Nice rooms, best location. Nice people working there. Wonderful hotel with new rooms and super clean property. Most secure with great amenities. Walking distance to everything. Right on Time Square.

title: Happiness at the Hyatt!
text: I've been to NYC numerous times and this is my favorite hotel by far. The rooms (and bathroom) are spacious, well appointed, clean (I love the hardwood floors - so much better than carpet), and chic. We had a view of Times Square that was fabulous. Our housekeeper was so charming and did a spectacular job. The bedding is pristine with a cozy mattress, duvet, and pillows. The shower has both a rain and regular head you can use. The staff is welcoming and warm - every time we walked in we were greeting with a kind hello. The rooftop bar has fabulous views. This hotel has a boutique feel and is surprisingly quiet for being in Manhattan. We loved the location since we were primarily there to see theatre. Everything was walkable. We plan to recommend and stay at the Hyatt Centric again one day!

title: Nice hotel in a very good location
text: Nice hotel, new and clean. Everything working and required comforts all there. Didn't make it to the gym so can't comment on that. Location is very central without being in a overly busy spot. Would definitley recommend for business travelers.

title: Rude staff
text: The staff were very rude when we were checking in. As we are from Australia and had to convert more money to American the lady at the desk signed and seemed very frustrated and rude although we came back within 30 minutes. Not welcoming at all.

title: Great customer service!
text: Our recent stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square New York was perfect!  Excellent customer service from all members of staff.  Our room was always cleaned and all requests were met promptly and efficiently.  The location of the hotel is brilliant.  Thanks very much!

title: City Trip New York
text:
Wir waren 9 Tage im Hyatt Centric New York Times Square  und waren sehr zufrieden.Das Zimmer auf der 47 Etage war sehr geräumig,neuwertig und wurde täglich sehr sauber gehalten.Der Service war stets Aufmerksam und sehr freundlich 👌🏻Die Lage des Hotels ist Top,100 Meter vom Times Square entfernt,trotzdem war es relativ ruhig in der Straße.
Sollten wir die nächste Zeit nochmal nach New York kommen,würden wir das Hyatt Centric wieder buchen 👍🏻

title: Fantastic stay at The Hyatt Centric Times Square
text: We stayed at The Hyatt Centric Times Square for a week, we were a party of five, we had three rooms. Our rooms were spotless, modern,  spacious, had a great view from 32nd floor, beds were huge and so comfortable and  the bathroom was lovely with a great shower… Good air con as well, it was really hot weather whilst there… Our  rooms were cleaned every day if you wanted,  fab!  The lifts are really fast btw! The staff couldn’t have been more helpful and courteous. Make sure you check out Bar 54 the hotels roof top bar. The view took our breath away when we first stepped out and then again viewing the sunset and then when New York lit up!! Be sure to book it though… The Hyatt centric Times Square is in a great location if you want to be in the hub of everything and you can walk to most attractions. Maybe a little noisy during the night but that wasn’t a problem. I would definitely recommend and would stay there again!! 👍🏼

title: Wonderful, staff was very helpful and kind
text:
Accomodations for my parents traveling to NYC fell through, I was able to book them a room that they absolutely loved. Hotel management and front desk was very helpful and worked with me so that I could make arrangements. They helped me push a credit card authorization through, despite what Hyatt's 1-800 customer service line and their customer service website said (officially, a credit card authorization request must be made 3 days in advance). I was able to call the hotel directly and they helped me push it through that same day, really appreciate it.

Parents said they had a wonderful stay and the security guard was very courteous and welcoming. Props to the hotel for making my parents feel welcomed.

Many thanks

title: Uncomfortable bed and sofa bed, outweigh great staff & excellent location.
text: This great location was overshadowed by our uncomfortable accommodations. Staff were great and helpful. Sorry. Won’t stay here until refurbishment. Sofa bed was awful. Pillows so flat and uncomfortable for us - even when using 2!

title: Great location and service.
text: Very conveniently located in mid-town close to Times Square, the subway, and across the street from Rise NY, Starbucks, and a Walgreens. Responsive, courteous staff from my first contact with the hotel until the last.

title: Great hotel, great staff!
text: I recommend this hotel 100%. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean, loved the bottled water each evening and the perk of rooftop access! I and so appreciated them holding our bags before and after check-out!

title: Great location, clean room, friendly staff
text: I have no complaints at all about this hotel except it was difficult to get into the rooftop bar. If you didn’t have reservations in advance, it wasn’t happening. No same-day reservations. Room was so clean, staff was so friendly. Great location two blocks off of Times Square. Restaurants, Walgreens, and a couple theaters on the same street. Stayed with my kids and as far as New York hotel rooms go, this was good size.

title: Start Spreading the News.
text: Great location with the feel of a boutique hotel. Easy to get to your room and in and out. If your heading uptown or downtown. It seems like you’re in the perfect centralized location. Bar 54 is a must experience.  Excellent drinks and friendly staff.

title: A great NY hotel
text: Right in the heart of things with good pub next door great roof bar but drinks not cheap .excellent staff and great rooms. Good facilities in the room and lifts good . Luggage storage available but resort charges charged not sure value for what you get .due to location would definitely stay again

title: La mejor ubicación! Personal amable.
text:
Inmejorable ubicación! Las habitaciones son más grandes que el promedio en NY. Personal muy amable. Mi única sugerencia es que quizás los agentes de seguridad al interior del hotel, podrían ser un poco más serviciales.
Definitivamente regresaría!

title: Great location for a theater stay
text: Great location if you are planning your trip around theater tickets.  Centrally located to Broadway and all the theaters, but off the beaten path enough to be quiet a night.  Clean spacious room.  Comfortable beds.  Great shower (hot water was actually hot and the pressure was perfect).  Courteous staff.  Very pleased with the hotel and our stay.

title: Great Location, Clean and Safe Hotel
text:
You cannot beat the location, right off of time square, close to hop on hop off busses, restaurants, and all the theatres.   Walk to 8,9 or 10 street for cheaper restaurants then time square.
Security in lobby and must have hotel key to get to elevators.  Friendly staff and funky rooms. 
Even on the street side you heard nothing of the crowd and it was so quite.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Couldn't fault this hotel. The staff were really polite and helpful. Had a warm welcome every time we returned to the hotel, asking us how our day had been. If we ever had a problem, they were so helpful. The hotel was spotless, our room was cleaned everyday and anything we used, was replaced daily. Brilliant cleaning staff. Usually when you stay in a hotel, you can hear the people above or below, but we didn't hear anything. Of course you hear the sirens and car horns outside, but nothing inside the hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel

title: All we needed
text: Stayed here for 4 nights, 2 rooms for 5 of us. Everyone enjoyed and all would recommend. Check in service was spot on, rooms good size and clean etc. Bar nice, albeit expensive. Right by times Square and everything we needed. Would come back for sure

title: Travel lodge in Times Square
text:
I expected this hotel to be a bit nicer then it was. The hotel is clean and rooms spacious especially for a New York room. If you’re wanting just a place to sleep then this hotel would be perfect. Great location! 

For us the hotel just lacked a bit of character. We were disappointed we couldn’t just grab a drink as the hotel bar is an attraction bar which means booking a table and this didn’t suit our plans. We were meant to have a room with view or Times Square but all we could see were office blocks. Room service is only avaliable for breakfast and at $40 dollars a person i thought it was extortionate for a breakfast in a brown bag. But I guess that’s New York for you! 

Overall location is great, hotel is clean but for us just lacked the overall hotel experience.

title: Nice Hotel in the Heart of the City
text: Very good customer service. I live in NY and competition for nice hotels is high. The cost is commensurate with the quality, condition, and amenities of the hotel. The hotel may need additional common area and lounge space.

title: Outstanding
text:
Very helpful staff. Clean and well
Maintained hotel. Could not find a bad word to say. Location was ideal. If I had to visit Nee york again then I would look no further. The view from bar 54 was amazing as well

title: Great place!
text: I would recommend the Hyatt Centric Time Square! Great location for Awesome Broadway plays and food! Friendly staff, Exceptional housekeeping staff with fresh linen and towels daily. I will definitely use them again.

title: The Ideal Hotel for Visiting New York
text: This hotel was perfectly located just 1/2 a block from Times Square. There are plenty of shops, restaurants and attractions within walking distance. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The rooms were of a good size and standard and refilling the water and coffee pods every day was a nice touch! Cant say much more than i will choose to stay here again when we come back.

title: NY Short break
text: Great location helpful staff just one point coffee tea making facilities in room pod machine with only limited amount of English breakfast tea pods a little difficult to get tea bag and kettle guess it’s a British thing ! Overall staff very friendly and helpful.

title: Il y a beaucoup mieux à NY
text:
L'hôtel est idéalement situé c'est son point fort avec son rooftop. Le reste est moyen. 
La chambre est propre, aucun service. 
Le personnel fait son travail mais pas un sourire au cours des 10 jours que nous avons passés dans cet hôtel.
Disont que pour le prix, nous sommes déçus.

title: Best hotel in Times Square
text:
Great location with amazing views from the upper floors.
Recommend you to go for rooms with higher floor with Times Square view. 
The bed is super comfortable and the work area is good for solo business travellers. Internet is fast!
Rooms are clean and the service is impeccable.
Housekeeping staff go the extra mile..
Thank you to Jorge for his assistance during booking!!
Also Being a Hyatt Globalist is a treat.. best hotel chain in the world!

title: Charmless but very convenient and comfortable!
text: We had a great stay - location was perfect, inter-connecting rooms were spacious and well laid out and beds were very comfortable. However, we were very disappointed by breakfast. It is brought up to your room in a bag - there is a mountain of disposable single-use plastic involved which is completely unacceptable. Our children refused to eat it because they care a lot about the environment. However, to be fair, America in general seems really far behind the rest of the world on environmental awareness - we saw very few people using reusable water bottles, the cafes all seem to only have disposable even when you sitting in and Americans don’t seem to bring their own bags to the market etc. Only other thing to add is that the hotel is a bit charmless - I know it’s a “grab & go” city centre Hyatt but it’s definitely lacking a nice reception / restaurant.

title: Perfect, but for the noise level
text:
Excellently laid-out hotel room, comfortable bed, very clean and really decent space for a NY hotel. Guest services are welcoming and greet you with a smile. The front door is literally a 2 minute walk to the middle of Times Square. 
The shower water pressure is a bit weak for a hotel, and the noise from Times Square and all the many emergency services in NY are the only reason this Hyatt isn't perfect.  Would definitely stay here again, but I'd want a much higher floor than the 25th where my wife and I stayed. Recommended!

title: Great customer service!
text: Rooms with terraces very nice option. Front desk team very accommodating. Breakfast in a bag was a bit disappointing but food and service was good. Many complimentary items available upon demand vs readily available in room.

title: Great stay near Times Square
text: We have stayed at this property before and had just as great if not better experience this time. Everyone was helpful and friendly. Was greeted with a smile when we checked in and upgraded to a higher floor which was a welcomed surprise!  This is the best place to stay if you want to be in the heart of the city and Times Square.

title: Liked the hotel but hidden fee was a disappointment.
text: Restaurant was closed. Bar was closed. Sheets were dirty or stained first night. Duvet had stains. Otherwise room was clean. Provided bottled water that we were told was free. We used Wi-Fi a few times. Destination fee of $30 per day was charged when we checked out. It was not disclosed to us at check in. Short walk to Times Square. Fire alarm went off one night - very confusing as to expectations. Housekeeping was super friendly.

title: Best stay and experience
text: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square for a mother/daughter weekend. The staff was very friendly. Checkin and out was so fast. I highly recommend Bar 54 at the top of the hotel for a relaxing drink and the most incredible views.

title: My visit at Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
text:
I loved my stay at Hyatt Centric Times Square. Very very friendly staff, very helpful and efficient, from the front desk at check in/out to the housekeeping lady working our floor (53). And the views from our room at the 53rd floor were beyond words.
I will surely choose again this hotel for future trips to New York.

title: Very nice hotel perfectly located by times Square and Broadway.
text:
Valet parking was super nice and friendly. 

Front desk did welcome us as globalist. Then went ahead and told us our room number. Ask for the free suite upgrade but was shot down immediately.  Didn't even try to look. Received a decent room. Bed was soft and slept well. Shower was huge and just felt good.

Didn't see a place to buy snacks but there was a Walgreens across street.

We were half a block away from our Broadway show. 

We had a fire alarm for 2 hours. Not a single call to see if we were all right. 

Breakfast was good. Check out was good. 

Hyatt needs to work on a few things in order to make the Globalist perk prestigious.  

I'd rate stay 7/10

title: Excellent beyond expectations
text: LOVED our time here. Within walking distance to Harry Potter. Took advantage of the workout facility, so clean and nice. Also took advantage of the iron. Quiet room. The rooftop was amazing. We were allowed to bring our son up and get a photo. He patio is adjacent to the bar but still able to take in the views!!

title: Outstanding experience
text: The Hyatt Centric in Times Square, met and exceeded my expectations. Also, the location is amazing. It was a few minutes walk to Time Square as well as Broadway. I will most definitely be returning to stay at this hotel on my next trip to New York.

title: An excellent base to explore New York
text:
A fabulous, modern, clean hotel in an excellent location just off Times Square, a perfect base to explore New York. 

Staff were friendly & helpful & we were given a lovely large room on the 22nd floor with Times Square views from the floor - ceiling windows. We were traveling for my daughters 21st birthday & we arrived into the room to 21st birthday balloons which was a lovely start to the trip. A mention to Jennifer housekeeper on the 22nd floor who was absolutely lovely & we enjoyed chatting to her every day.  The hotel could be improved further by providing robe & slippers which I have always had in Hyatt’s I’ve stayed in in the past. 

Overall a 5* stay, The Hyatt Centric Times Square didn’t disappoint & I wouldn’t hesitate to return.

title: Very clean and very helpful staff
text: The staff went above and beyond to make sure it was a great experience for us. Also the room was very very clean. It is clear that the staff take pride in providing exceptional service and truly want the hotel to be a memorable experience. I am incredibly picky with cleanliness, and at other hotels, sometimes I have to asked to switch rooms bc of the lack of hygiene, but I had none of those issues here.

title: Spotless efficiency in a wonderful location
text: Two minutes walk from Times Square, next to the iconic Irish Bar, Connelly's, lies the 54 storey Hyatt Centraic. The rooms are large and spotlessly clean. The service is cheerful. There is a good gym, and at the top is a reservations only rooftop bar. The only drawback is there are only a few elevators, so peak hours can be slow.

title: Best hotel stay
text: I have never had a better hotel stay. Every member of the staff was so kind and helpful, and the room was perfect.  I was traveling with my family, and we had several needs from utensils to extra pillows and each request was fulfilled joyfully.

title: Good location and room, but refreshments very limited
text: This hotel is well located for all midtown attractions and rooms are clean and a good size. During our visit the food options were limited as the restaurant was closed. Bar on rooftop was an attraction for us booking but access was extremely limited and certainly felt as though hotel residents were not given priority or made welcome.

title: Hakim bartender
text: Hakim was a fantastic bartender.  Fast, friendly and personal able.  He catered to our group and made sure everyone was taken care of.  Also remembered everyones name.  Made the entire group feel at home and  gave the best drinks in town. The best!

title: My stay
text: I guess it's New York, so don't expect nothing fancy unless you are willing to spend a whole lots of money. Hyatt hotels that I have stayed at in Texas have beautiful rooms and great breakfast. The good thing about the Hyatt Centric, it's location and friendly staff. They were very helpful with directions and how to use the subway.

title: Coming Back to the Centric!
text: Great hotel.  Super friendly staff and wonderful room!  Comfortable bed!  Great toiletries too. So close to the theaters; great restaurants and Grand Central, MOMA, Rockefeller Center and much more!  I will definitely stay again!

title: Excellant Hotel and Staff
text: Top Notch grade A from check in till check out. Rooms are very nice, wonderful hot water in the rain shower. You will not be disappointed...... The Staff was exceptional from telling us how to ride the subway to giving us the best way to the airport.

title: Einfach Grandios
text:
Sind gerade noch da 46 etage, der Blick ist einfach nur Waouw und wir sind begeistert.
Das frühstück ist mega gut, wir erleben nur gute Personal also daumen hoch 🤩
Alles ist gut zu erreichen schön zentral

title: Excellent Hotel - Roof top Bar good food, bad service.
text: The hotel is excellent, no complaints. However, the bar service is poor- but in a pinch the food is good. However, if you can, there are so many other options. It is NYC and there are many other options.

title: Excellent Holiday
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights.  2 double beds on a high floor.
The hotel is 2 mins away from times square, very friendly staff, very clean rooms.  Plenty of towels, excellent hair dryer and iron / board.  Toiletries and coffee/tea pods / water replenished every day whether we needed them or not.  The room was spacious, the bathroom was spacious and luxurious.  As with most hotels, I always find that the lighting in the bathroom is never bright enough, and the mirrors are placed away from the window light so its not that easy to sort you make up when getting ready for the day / night ahead.  Considering we were so close to Time Square, the room was fairly quiet.  Beds were comfortable.  We stayed on 37th floor.  We did pay a higher price for this hotel than I normally would as it was for a special birthday, but think it was worth it.

title: Extremely clean and modern!
text: I am 52 years old and have stayed at many hotels over the years. This hotel is among the cleanest and most modern I've ever stayed at. Everyone has their priorities about what they look for in a hotel. For my family it is cleanliness and this hotel honestly appeared to be brand new.

title: Overall a great experience.
text:
I booked a luxury solo holiday for myself and wanted somewhere great to stay; From the moment I walked in, I felt that it was going to be lovely; It was a mixed experience.

The first suite was a bit of a disaster. There was a very bad chemical smell, the bedding wasn't tucked in and the duvet cover hadn't been done up. The plumbing was extremely noisy and the shower rattled. The bedside lighting didn't work and an engineer was sent out twice, very quickly but, it couldn't be fixed. I was offered another room.

Second suite was lovely! Slightly dated but, very clean (which is the main thing), linen tucked in properly with pillow and mattress protectors. The Wi-Fi was a little unreliable and you can’t Chromecast much onto the TV. No bin liner for bin, which is a nuisance as there is nowhere to dispose of feminine hygiene products; Thankfully, I'd brought my own bin liners. There were no heated towel rails so, you couldn't wash anything and dry it yourself. Perfect built-in wardrobes with room for suitcases also. Not enough hangers but iron and ironing board provided.

Fantastic A/C. The room was on the 'City View' side, which was incredibly beautiful. Very quiet, considering location and had fabulous views with the Chrysler Building and river etc.

The subway is just round the corner. No restaurant at the moment but Bar54 (hotel roof) is ok. Service was great but the was food average. I sent mine back as undercooked and soggy. The staff gave free drinks and were apologetic, which was great.

Starbucks and Walgreens are just over the road. Mc Donald's is also over the road, if you're desperate. It's easy to find something to eat locally. The hotel is very central and a short walk to 5th Avenue, all the sights and Central Park etc.

Great security presence on doors so it felt secure. There was even someone to open the car door upon arrival and departure. The front desk staff were obliging.

The pillows awful!! Had six and still had to use my jacket, travel pillow and both dressing gowns to slightly elevate myself. I had requested non-feather pillows but when I got there I was told that down pillows are the standard pillow.

Definitely a mixed experience but, I would go back there tomorrow, if I could! Recommended hotel.

title: Amazing hotel!
text:
The hotel has it all! I stayed two nights on a quick weekend trip to NYC. For the first night I had a larger room with two Queen beds for me and my sister, and for the second I “downgraded” to a standard king. Both rooms were fantastic. The larger room was incredibly roomy for an NYC hotel room and had a coffee maker, fridge and a safe. The free bottles of water were a nice touch.  The bathroom had a tub and a shower. Beds were comfy and the towels were nice. The standard king the next day was just as nice. Yea it was smaller but there was still a desk with a chair as well as an armchair. The floor in the bathroom was heated! This room was on a much lower floor  than the two queens (46 vs 16) but there was no street noise to speak of. The elevators were fast (again, for nyc) and the only time there was a wait to speak of was at checkout time on Sunday. 
We did snag a reservation at Bar 54 and even though it was a bit rainy and very foggy it was a great experience. The drinks were delicious and the service was great. We did take our last drink out in the balcony and enjoyed the view (which would be spectacular on a nice night). 
One final note: the staff at the front desk were pretty terrific. It was just, all in all, a first rate experience. Highly recommend!

title: Central Spot to stay when visiting Manhattan
text:
Great spot to stay if you travelto Manhattan and you want to be central to all directions. You are located 80m away from times square. Also 2 Substations are close to your spot. 42nd with a lot of different lines for uptown and downtown. 49th with also some options. Would I stay there a 2nd time? Sure I would.
From the bar on level 54 you have a great view over the city. For sure worth to spend some time there.

title: Clean and Friendly
text:
The suite room was great, beds were comfortable, they even supplied umbrellas for the one evening we had some scatter rain in the area.
The staff was very courteous, they provided a transportation option to the airport for about the same price of a Lyft/uber and it was a nice perk than a random persons vehicle

title: Great Location!!   Great staff, very clean.  Excellent place to stay for a Times Square/broadway weekend.
text: We stayed Friday and Saturday nights with tickets to a show Saturday night.  The location is great.  Our room had a nice view. We had drinks at bar 54. Even better view. Easy walk to Bryant park and any broadway show you would want to see.  We used valet parking and it was professional and conclvwnient.

title: A Great Hotel
text: Great Hotel, very friendly staff and great location . WE come to New York once a year for plays and dining. This is wonderful location for walking to everything that we need. Also very rasy to get a cab or an Uber for transportation when needed

title: First time visit to NYC
text: This was my first time visiting NYC and overall I was very satisfied with this hotel and it's location. It is neutral to Times Square and within walking distance to 5th Ave and Central Park. If you want to visit other locations further south, I would recommend taking a taxi (which is easy to get) or walking if you don't mind a 45 min walk to the Meat District, etc. The room was very clean and surprisingly, the noise did not keep me up. Mattress was not very comfortable, but it's not a complaint. We stayed in a King room w/view of Times Square and were very pleased.

title: Amazing location for Times Square!
text:
Stayed here in May 2022.  It is a bit pricey but worth it for the amazing location.  Just steps to the center of Times Square.  We had a high floor Times Square view and it was super cool.  The room is not big but not small.  The bathroom was larger than I expected.  Everything seems new and well cared for.  The staff was amazing and super helpful.
The restaurant was still closed during our stay but there is plenty of food just outside the hotel.  The rooftop bar, Bar 54, was amazing.  The view were stunning.  Just wished they had a better food menu, they can do so much more if they provided a solid menu of food/snacks.  But its still well worth a visit just for the views.

title: Superb location and fabulous hotel
text: Stayed here with friends for the second time and again this hotel was fabulous. The rooms are spacious and well maintained. The hotel is well located and the rooftop bar while a little busy was great too.

title: Bon emplacement sur times square
text:
Hotel très bien situé,  à 2 pas de times square. 
Chambre faite tous les jours , serviettes changées,  réapprovisionnement de produits de toilette tous les jours .
Nécessaire pour faire thé/ café dans les jours 
Par contre , j'avais pris chambre avec vue mais bon , la vue était moyenne

title: Excellent Stay!
text:
Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in May 2022. 

We where in room 5205 and it was a fabulous room. Spacious, extremely clean and tidy. 

Fresh towels, coffee for the machine and bed changed and made every day. 

The hotel is steps from TS and within easy reach of plenty of restaurants, shops and attractions. 

The hotel staff where helpful and friendly. 

Bar 54 is a must visit. We where lucky enough to visit on a clear sunny day - spectacular views from the rooftop terrace. 

If we where to visit NYC again we would stay here and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends. 

Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: The most wonderful experience
text:
We visited the hotel to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. When we arrived there was a bottle of Prosecco waiting for us and we had also been given a corner room with a balcony we had the most wonderful view of Tines Square. 
The hotel was clean and the staff couldn’t have been more helpful. The airline lost one of our suitcases and the staff on the door pointed us in the right direction to get replacement clothes. 
Everyone we interacted with was kind and so friendly. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to anybody. We had the most amazing trip.

title: Went above and beyond!
text: The staff went above and beyond for our family. We were taking our first trip in several years to treat our daughter to the Harry Potter play in NYC.  Our  daughter has undergone several hip and back surgeries and was unable to walk. When she was finally able to get back on her feet, we treated her to the dream trip she wanted so badly for years. We had to reschedule the play three times due to her her health! This was a very special trip and celebration! Honestly, we can’t typically afford nearly $500 a night for a hotel but we had to be close to the theater. We were nervous about the trip and the expense. We were immediately assured we made the right choice in hotels!  The staff had a balloon and special treat for her in the room. She was so surprised and overwhelmed with happiness. We haven’t seen her smile like this in a long time. The staff made her feel so special! Not to mention, the hotel room was spotless and accommodated a family of four comfortably. We were steps to Time Square and it so convenient. The staff are exceptional. Someone is aways at the front desk and staff stand near elevators to assure guest status. Elevators are fast! We were near the 50th floor and it took less than a minute ride to the top. Rooms come with high end hair dryers and modern amenities. They are truly beautiful and clean. The staff even store your luggage if you arrive early or choose to stay past check out to explore the city. It was safe, clean, spacious, and overwhelmingly welcoming! We had no worries about cleanliness or safety. Thank you Hyatt Centric NYC Times Square! You made our daughter the happiest girl, and our family is forever grateful for your hospitality. Don’t hesitate to book this hotel! They meet and exceed expectations!

title: Family trip to NYC
text: Hotel is very well placed.  Rooms are a good size clean & comfortable with good amenities.Also quiet given how noisy NYC can be. The staff were friendly & helpful.  Only disappointment the restaurant was closed, maybe due to the pandemic?

title: great modern hotel in the middle of everything
text: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric to see a show on Broadway and wanted a convenient location to Times Sq, Central Park and Broadway. The Check In/Out process was easy, room was much larger and modern, compared to what I expect of NYC hotels.  Will certainly visit the Hyatt Centric for future visits.

title: meh
text: room thermostat was horrible, it was either way too hot or way too cold, and was unable to adjust room temperature by just one-degree.  cleaning staff kept the room clean but the towels and sheets were scratchy.  nice view from the room

title: Great location
text: The hotel is ideally located. Perfect for Times Square. The beds were so comfortable. Rooms a good size. Reception staff weren’t overly friendly and not much of a personal service. Bar 54 was fantastic. The views were amazing and the staff here were very welcoming. Prices were extortionate but that is the same all over NYC. However much money you think you will need, double it! We only realised half way through our stay that we had booked a south view room and we’re allocated a north view but it didn’t really bother us. I would stay again if I got a good deal.

title: Disgusted!
text: The floors of my hotel room were absolutely disgusting. You could feel the dirt and dust as you walked across the floor. I will never stay at another Hyatt property ever again! A mop was needed badly!!!

title: Best place to stay in NYC
text: We frequent NYC often. This location is clean, safe and superior with customer service and in a very convenient location in NYC. We have never been disappointed and the elevators are fantastic unlike some other hotels in the area where you have to plan your departure times around heavier traffic.

title: Convenient Location, Just Okay Property
text:
I booked a "suite" with points and cash for a quick trip to see a show on Broadway.  When valuing the World of Hyatt (WoH) points at a $0.01, we paid $505 for the night, which is seems asinine for less than 24 hours in a room, but sadly is par for the course in NYC. This property is centrally located to Times Square, etc., which can be both a "pro" and a "con," depending on your perspective. 

I checked in really early (10:30am) on the WoH app but upon arrival, was told my room wouldn't be ready until 4pm (I actually didn't get a text notification until 4:45pm).  The lobby was small, as expected with a Manhattan hotel, and somewhat chaotic with many rooms turning over simultaneously.  The staff managed the chaos in a friendly, if not methodical manner. The lobby fixtures (namely the plastic flashing on the lobby walls) seek to give off an air of modernity, but up close, are pretty beat up and tired. The lobby bathrooms were similarly tired and "clean enough", probably due to constant use; many guests appear to dart back to the hotel to use them while milling about Times Square. 

The room was fine, but not as we expected, based on World of Hyatt app pictures. Both the bedroom and "living room" parts of the suite were spacious (particularly for anything in Manhattan) and the pull-out sofa bed was about as nice as I've seen recently (great for kids).  That said, some of the fixtures felt cheap and overly pre-fabbed.  Also, I expected a larger bathroom and carpet, not the faux-wood vinyl flooring. All in all, these weren't deal-breakers for a one-night stay, but made the room feel a bit cheap and not a "suite" at a Hyatt, but instead something akin to a Fairfield Inn or Springhill Suites (not to trash their product; they're fine). 

Back to the common areas...I was invited to take a tour of the ("T45") bar and restaurant for the views but didn't due to time constraints and the fact the cool weather wouldn't make for desirable time outside, on a high floor terrace.  The fitness center has a decent selection of newer, well-maintained equipment but is not nearly as large as it is made out to be in the website photos.  Again, not a deal breaker, but worth considering if you are attempting to avoid crowds due to COVID or want to ensure you are able to use what you want.  

All in all, great location and generally pretty good by Midtown Manhattan standards (which is not saying much), but not luxurious.

title: Paseo por EEUU
text: Un lugar muy agradable, limpio!! excelente!  Lo recomiendo su atractivo es la ubicación, demasiado cerca para todos los sitios turísticos de Manhattan NY, es el sitio ideal para por su comodidad y descanso!

title: Awesome experience!
text: Incredible view of Time Square, friendly staff, excellent location - these were our most important impressions of the hotel. Whenever we can we will recommend Hyatt Centric Times Square to friends and book it ourselves once again.

title: Great hotel. Location, staff, and room were exceptional. Beds could be a little more comfortable and more pillows.
text: Family vacation and milestone 13th Birthday for our daughter.  Kids first trip to the BIG APPLE. Spring Break. Daughter interested in NYU. We had an amazing time. Hotel was an excellent choice. Location and staff were fantastic!

title: Buen Hotel para viaje en Familia
text: El trato recibidi fue muy bueno al igual que el  servicio y limpieza y estado de las habitaciones. La ubicación excelente y apesar del estar en el centro no se escuchaba mucho ruido. La habitación era muu adecuado para la pareja y dos niños.

title: Fine stay
text: Great stay. Room was wonderful staff was friendly and helpful. Check in was fast and check out was just as quick. Stayed in yhe small lounge while waiting for train departure, internet worked great. Door guy grabbed us a cab too, all around solid stay.

title: An excellent choice
text: Rooms and bathroom were modern and extremely clean. Hotel is is a good location for Times Square and access to subway for transport to other areas. A comfortable stay with free bottled water provided. Fridge provided in addition to a coffee machine for those that like a cuppa in their room. A comfortable stay for a busy holiday.

title: Excelente Sercicio y gran Ubicación
text: El hotel esta en una excelente ubicación a unos cuantos pasos de Times Square. Muchas opciones para comer cercanas. El hotel me pareció excelente, para ser Nueva York los cuartos de muy buen tamaño para una familia de 2 adultos y 2 adolecentes. Lo recomiendo 100% y volveria sin dudarlo.

title: Great place to stay for a Broadway show!
text:
Great place to stay for a show.  The Cook Eatery a few doors down has a great breakfast selection.  This small grocery store was convenient.

Recommend leaving your car at home.  No need for parking, as everything is right there.

title: Great hotel centrally located
text:
This Hyatt is very new, and the front staff went above and beyond in customer service.  Location cannot be more central in NYC, steps from Time square.  Yet the hotel is very well insulated that you can sleep well without worrying about the noise from the streets below.  It has all the Hyatt standard items like very comfortable beds.

I always measure the true quality of the hotels from small details as devils are all in the details.  Two details stand out here: 1) great shower head with lots of water flow.  So comfortable. 2) hair dryers: a bio-ionic model with lots of settings (very stylish looking too).  This is the best hair dryer I have used in hotels.

A great hotel!

title: Accueil désagréable
text: Accueil très désagréable aucun effort fait pour nous comprendre, ménage très limite et draps tachés ainsi que des taches sur les serviettes de bains, 1 seul gel douche shampoing pour 4 personnes même après réclamation….très déçu dommage car hôtel très bien placé

title: Good hotel, spacious rooms, nice staff.
text: The hotel is in a great location, just around the corner from Times Square. Perfect location to walk to either Central Park or Lower Manhattan. Rooms are spacious and mostly clean. Couple of hairs found in the ice bucket, not great when wanting a cold drink with ice in it? I’ve machine on our level broke down, front desk told but not fixed by time we left 4 days later. Staff were pleasant and helpful during our stay and the gym is very good for a hotel gym. Would stay here again.

title: Wow!! Impressive
text: Very clean, comfortable bed and pillows. Awesome friendly staff, very welcoming. We paid for early check in at 11am, room wasn’t ready but they upgraded our room to a deluxe for free to make up for the situation. bathroom was amazing a separate soaker tub and a walk in shower. This will be my go to hotel anytime we visit time square ..

title: NewYork en famille
text:
Super vue sur Time Square
Idéalement placé pour visiter New York 
Chambre très calme et spacieuse
Idéal pour une famille
Lors de notre prochaine venue à New York nous retournerons dans cet sans hésiter.

title: Super convenient and excellent quality
text: Right at Time Square. Close to subway and easy access to Penn Station. Even offer a bottle of red wine. Respect privacy and yet quick to response if asks for additional shower gel and shampoo.  Perfect to stay for both business and leisure.

title: Excellent location
text: Very pleased with the location, friendly, helpful staff. We were on the 23rd floor, good views of Times Square, have already recommended this hotel to colleagues who are thinking of visiting New York.

title: Great Times Square location
text: Hotel was a great base for exploring central NYC. Room was good size for 2 adults and 2 teen boys. Easy access to Times Square and other iconic NY sites. Walking distance to many restaurants and activities. Felt safe coming back in the evening.

title: Ok hotel. Great location and view — if you pay for it.
text:
A nice hotel right next to Times Square. Unsurprisingly, very central and very busy. We figured this would be the case since we purposefully chose to be close to the center of the action given that this was the first time to NYC for our 10 year old daughter. While there is Bo concierge to arrange things, the reception staff were helpful. 

We stayed on the 45th floor since we wanted our girl to see the bright lights. Of course, you have to pay extra for the higher floors. 

While the bed was very comfortable, there were some very strange idiosyncrasies — almost NO storage. The “bureau” was two shelves. I had to put my clothes on the luggage rack in the closet. And the bedside table drawers were solid.

I don’t think I’d stay there again, but then again, we have had our NYC tourist experience now.

title: Again for warmer weather....
text: Back in NYC for a play, Carnegie Hall and the NY Auto Show.  The hotel is perfectly located in the center at Times Square.  My must is a great shower, and they did it again, even on the 50th floor. The delivery and pressure were perfect!  Staff were personable and very helpful.  Visited Bar54 (B54) twice and it too was enjoyable with amazing views.  My favorite part of the visit was Orquidea (?) the beautiful cleaning lady on our floor.  As she was cleaning rooms, she had the most pleasant demeanor, softly singing or humming and always very nice to interact with while passing.  Very safe, very clean and again, a great location in Manhattan, my go to hotel when visiting.

title: Great stay at Hyatt Centric Times Square
text: The rooms were clean and comfortable.  There was a refrigerator and safe in the room.  The hotel is well situated- near Times Square, theaters and restaurants.  We were there with a 9and 11 year old and we could walk to everything with them from the hotel.  We would definitely stay there again on our next trip to New York.

title: Great service, Staff always helpful, Wonderful Location and Premises. Incredible Bed, super clean.
text: Great service, Staff always helpful, Wonderful Location and Premises. Incredible Bed, super clean. First experience with Hyatt Centric and for sure would elect them again if I am in the city. Staff was always helpful.

title: Great hotel
text: This hotel is lovely; all the staff members we interacted with were excellent.  We had a room with a king bed plus a rollaway and still had tons of room to move around, which is rare in a Manhattan hotel.  The room was bright with floor to ceiling windows, simple and elegant decor.  Beds were comfy as well.   All three of us ladies felt the lighting in the bathroom was not conducive to putting on makeup, though we managed.  We made a reservation to go to the rooftop bar for a drink after our show, expecting a quiet space but it was very crowded and noisy (a Friday night in Manhattan); oh well.  We gave up on that and just went back to our lovely quiet room.

title: Top
text: Excellent séjour, l'hôtel est idéalement situé, la chambre spacieuse propre et fonctionnelle avec vue formidable sur la ville. Literie de qualité. Nous étions situés au 50ème étage, cela restera un grand souvenir.

title: Easy base for exploring NYC
text: Great location, right between Rockefeller Center and Times Square - a great home base for getting out and exploring the city (or if you want to wake up early and get on the Today Show!). Short walk up to Central Park and close to multiple subway stations. Hotel was clean and stylish, rooms larger than expected for a family of 4 (two queen beds). Comfortable beds, good water pressure and temps. Price was very reasonable.

title: Great location, warm and welcoming staff
text: My family of 4 visited nyc for the first time and the location was perfect - easy walk to broadway, times share and Bryant park. Parking was extra, and restaurants weren’t fully open but the room was lovely.

title: Gross room and terrible customer service from a cat 7 hotel
text: Just didn't have a good experience at this location, the staff was rude, the room we were put in had no views, just one window overlooking other rooms with a see through curtain. We asked to get moved and were told no other rooms were available, yet their website showed plenty of rooms available.

title: Great Staff and great location to Times Square
text:
I just completed a 4-night stay here at the Hyatt Centric Times Square after our 2-night stay at the Park Hyatt.  Of course, after staying at the Park Hyatt it feels like you're slumming it.  Ha, ha.   But seriously it was a decent hotel.

We aren't in the room too much other than to sleep and shower in the morning and we were going to a bunch of Broadway shows right in Times Square so this worked out perfectly. It was literally one block from Times Square and about a 5-minute walk to any of the theatres we went to.

I booked a King bed and a connecting room with 2 Queen beds and it was comfortable.  I read a lot of great reviews on TripAdvisor and they did do a great job.  My Hyatt Concierge requested a connecting room a while back and they immediately the same day I booked saw that my wife and I were both Globalists and they proactively upgraded us to an Executive Suite.  All for free without having to burn an upgrade certificate. I thought that was a great touch right from the start.

Our room was on the 19th floor so wasn't too high (the building has 54 floors with a bar at the top).  They do a free tour to the top that you can go to with kids at 10:30 AM each morning but other than that kids aren't allowed up there.   The view was nothing special, especially after visiting Summit One Vanderbilt which I highly recommend.

Breakfast is free for Hyatt Globalists but the restaurant is closed in the building. They just do this QR code that you can select and then they deliver it to your room in bags.  I think they use Grubhub.   Nothing special at all.  You can pick from oatmeal, breakfast bagel with egg and bacon, Avocado toast, cereals, various eggs, etc.  

The rate was about $400 per night per room with taxes.  The only issue we encountered was the bathroom sink in our kid's room didn't really work without first turning on the hot water and then turning on the cold water.  There was no water pressure for the cold water if you were using that alone.  But it was ok and we didn't want to move after arriving.  

If you're seeing some shows in Time Square this is an easy location. This isn't a luxury hotel so expectations should be realistic. But it's a good mid level hotel that was clean and besides the bathroom sink everything worked including the AC which worked super well.  The elevators are a bit slow but were ok and had a friendly employee down there letting people in.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Great stay in the heart of Time Square. Hotel was clean and all staff were friendly and helpful. We reserved early check-in and had no issues. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. We had a king room with plenty of room for a rollaway, and both beds were comfortable. We visited the rooftop bar late Friday (with a reservation) and it was very busy, but once again staff were cheerful, friendly and quick to accommodate us. We did not use the hotel valet but it is offered (additional parking is available in lots on that block)

title: Do not recommend
text: I was very disappointed in this hotel.  I have stayed in different hotels.  I thought this was going to be an amazing hotel from the reviews.   For the money we paid to stay here I assumed the room would be amazing.   It was underwhelming and disappointing.   Our next trip to NYC we will absolutely stay somewhere different.

title: Wonderful location
text: It’s our second time staying here and we would never stay anywhere else while visiting New York. The hotel is spotless clean and the beds are extremely comfortable. The staff are amazing and so helpful .

title: Excellent
text: This was everything we were hoping for; great hotel, great view, everything we needed. Excellent location, close to everything. Friendly staff, great use of space for the room and bathroom. The view alone was worth it.

title: Great staff
text: My husband and I stayed with our four children ages 21, 16, 11 and 8 in two rooms. It was their first time in NY and we’re very excited that both rooms had view to Time Square street. The hotel is cery clean and comfortable and the staff is great.

title: Sandybee
text: Everything was GREAT! Staff, Rooms, Atmosphere! From the Doorman. the front desk, the rooms, the service and I even called to the front desk with a location question and got a return call within 2 mins!

title: Great!
text: I would highly recommend this if you want to stay in Times Square. The rooms and beds comfortable. And some of the bathroom floors are heated. The lobby was quite small.Our room had an awesome view of Times Square too. Bar 57’s food was great (I recommend the charcuterie board) and the view was stunning.

title: Average hotel great location to times square
text:
Hotel is in an excellent location to times square. 
Coffee machine with tea, coffee and water in room. Toiletries replenished daily ( shampoo, conditioner and shower gel).
Clean rooms- cleaner was brilliant.

Rooms were basic, had a bit of wall paper peeling, didn't really feel like a 4 star. Lifts / elevators were really slow ! 
Didn't affect our stay and hotel is very reasonably priced for times square.

title: Strategic position
text: Nice hotel in a really strategic position, prices are ok, it seemed very busy, I guess because the roof bar too. Staff was very friendly (not so common in NYC apparently), we had just one problem, about towels and other things related to the bathroom, we have been forced to require 3 times, that shouldn't happen in a 4 star hotel. But highly recommended anyway

title: Acceptable, clean, good for price
text: We stayed here for a week. All but one of the staff were very friendly and accomodating. Breakfast is meh, arrived in bags, cardboard and recyclable plastic, and we finally went out to breakfast one day; but it was hard to find any hotel near Times Square with a functional restaurant for under $1,000 a night. Bar 54 has good appetizers and we had "dinner" there twice. Bartender and personnel up there were really nice. Room was clean, but I did wish there was at least a small rug. I do yoga and bare floor needed several towels to avoid pain. View of Paramount bldg was nice. We rented a two room suite because were there so long, which turned out to be a good idea. Room was quiet, black out drapes worked, and bed was pretty good. One block from Times Square and no more than 3-4 blocks from most theaters.

title: Great hotel with perfect location.
text: Great hotel with a perfect location for Times Square and Broadway. We moved to this hotel from the Hilton Garden which wasn’t good. Staff were so friendly and helpful and got us checked in early. Rooms clean and spacious. Great viewing gallery at 10:30 which is free on the 54th floor. Security at lifts ensuring it was only guests coming into the hotel Would definitely stay again .

title: Excellent
text:
Great location for Times Square,Broadway and restaurants. Isnt it why you are there?
Room was great with comfortable beds,quality bathroom,quality materials ,air conditioning worked well without any negatives.
Lastly ,staff was exceptional. I always expect excellent service but am frequently disappointed. They were better than expected.

title: Great Hotel, wonderful views from rooftop bar.
text:
Just returned from a 4 night stay in New York as a family of 4 and had a wonderful time. Hotel well situated in city close to subway station and many major attractions within easy walking distance.
Rooms were clean, with large floor to ceiling windows, nice shower and a bath and the staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. It was sadly pouring with rain on our first evening but the hotel provided guests with large orange hotel logo umbrellas which were a godsend for us.
As others have said, one of the biggest flaws was the slow and overworked elevators which is compounded by the split level make up of the hotel, so although there are 5 lifts (2 of which broke during our stay, I pity the poor guest stuck in there) they only service half of the hotel. Our children on floor 24 used the 2 left side elevators and my husband and I on floor 42 used the right hand 3 and only the right side went up to the rooftop bar. This meant having to elevators on floor 25 every time we needed to visit our children’s bedroom….very time consuming.
A plus was the rooftop bar with wonderful views which we visited to toast my husband’s birthday (sadly minus the under aged 21 teenagers - aware this is not the hotels fault but US law) but we were unable to book a table as the QR code booking system requires a text confirmation set up which as we had no mobile data we were unable to complete, again aware this was not the hotels fault but thought it useful to point out to UK travellers who do not have the perk of data roaming ( it also stopped us accessing the citibikes hire for same text confirmation reason) 
Although we are unlikely to return to the city and therefore this hotel, I would have no issue recommending the Hyatt as an option to friends visiting the city.

title: Good hotel, with a major flaw
text: I recently stayed here for a weekend visit to NYC. The hotel itself is clean and the rooms themselves are on the larger side (for New York City). Fair warning, the hotel is just off Times Square, which can be a bonus or negative, depending on your perspective. The major problem with the hotel (in fact, it's so bad it impaired the overall rating) is the elevator situation. There simply aren't enough elevators to meet the needs of the guests (plus the guests share the elevators with those eating at the rooftop bar/restaurant). In the morning, guests can expect to wait 5 minutes to ride down. If you come back around dinner time, you should be prepared to wait in line for as long as ten minutes to get an elevator up to your room (I timed it on Saturday night). I realize this is NYC, and its a busy hotel at a very busy spot, but the elevator situation made it all but impossible to get to and from my room. On Saturday, I forgot my umbrella in my room, and couldn't spare the 20 minute roundtrip it would've taken if I had been forced to wait for an elevator up and back down.

title: Great Stay
