text: Very clean hotel. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The location is perfect and minutes away from lots of entertainment and restaurants. In the theater districts lots of play house within walking distance.

title: Just another Times Square Hotel
text:
Overall it is an average hotel with good location, great staff . However the entire room floor bath and bed area were sticky, The room had an overbearing " Fresh" scent , almost like a entire can of  air freshener was used. Also we were billed unexpectedly, an arrival Fee, that could not be explained.
We were offered a credit after requesting the manager to explain, but as of  this writing, have not received it a week later.  As with so many Hotels they aint what they use to be.

title: Our first bite of the big apple
text: From our initial greeting, to the upgrade to a corner room everything beat our expectations. Safe, clean, comfortable and with a perfect NY view. Brilliant, central location with helpful staff and great cocktails from bar 54

title: Perfect Times Square hotel
text:
Awesome location, large rooms (as far as NY goes), relatively silent (also as far as NY goes), friendly staff that helped with printing covid paperwork, everything went well with this place. 
Would totally recommend when staying on Times Square.

title: Nice hotel, great location!
text: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square for 3 nights at the beginning of a vacation.  The staff were very pleasant and helpful.  We booked through American Express and received some "extras" which was nice.  We got a hotel credit and a late check-out.  They still do not have their traditional restaurant available for breakfast, but they have a call ahead hot breakfast through room service.  It is brought to you in a paper bag, so not room service style, but good if needed.  The breakfast is very pricy, but we used our resort credit.  Now, my one complaint - I really did not like the coffee.  I don't know if it was a type I don't like or if it was not good.....but I did not like it.  Luckily, there is a Starbucks across the street.  We could see it from our room!  The location of this hotel can't be beat.  It is right in Times square, an easy walk to many Broadway shows and tons of restaurants!  I would recommend!

title: Great stay
text: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric for 3 nights to enjoy Times Square. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The hotel was very clean, and the rooms were updated and modern. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect location
text: Great location, right around the corner from Time square, Starbucks right across the street. Hotel very clean, nice, updated rooms and friendly staff. We all had a great sleep, beds very comfortable, thanks!

title: Better  than expected
text: It was great and easily accessible from time square. Room was clean. It was a little noisy but we were so tired every night that we didn’t even notice all the noise. Staff was friendly and always helpful. Walking distance from everything

title: Exceptional
text:
Location cannot be beaten, really friendly staff and a welcoming hotel. Views from the bar are to be seen! Bars and restaurants within a few minutes, Times Square seconds away, but enough of a distance to be quiet! Only sight niggle were pillows being very uncomfortable, but this is simply a cultural preference.
Great service continued when we had checked out and BA cancelled our flight!! Thanks Edwin.

title: Great stay
text:
We stayed at the Hyatt for 5 nights in two rooms. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms very clean. 

They no longer have a concierge Whitchurch is a shame as in past visits they have been amazing with booking trips. 

We had an evening out in the roof top bar and wow what a view. 

Highly recommend

title: Good stay
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights in mid March.

Used a gift certificate voucher to stay.

Great location as you are a 5 minute walk to the heart of Times Square.

Big room and nice high floor view.

Some improvement is when I checked in..I didn’t feel the warmth. In addition, I wasn’t thanked for being a discoverist member. 

May stay here again for the location.

title: Nice location
text:
Great location, but not very clean
The front desk staff are pretty nice, but when I called prior to arrival... I don't want to remember that
Roof top bar is nice
This is to achive 200 characters............

title: Great room, great bathroom, great location.
text: Overall this is a very nice hotel. We had a couple of minor mishaps with administrative things but nothing serious.The double Queen rooms with city views are very spacious and the en-suite bathrooms with them are actually amazing.

title: CENTRIC is its name
text:
the position of the hotel and cleanness of the room were its major points .
I missed a real drawers to fold my tshirts and sweters in the room, there's  only a wardrobe.
The lack of a cafeteria, restaurant or some place to have breakfast or fast dinner inside the hotel is essential and this hotel doesn't have it.

title: Great customer service from staff beutiful view of the city l would recommend anyone that wants a beautiful view
text: Great customer service from staff beutiful view of the city l would recommend anyone that wants a beautiful view l why latoya (front desk) and byron (front door went above and beyond and was very satisfied with their services and will be coming back for sure!

title: Great Stay!!
text: A break from the hustle and bustle of working at one of the busiest Emergency Department, followed by the relaxing, very clean rooms at the Hyatt Centric is enough to brag. Thank you Yenny,  DeeDee, DaSean Alyesa Edwin and all those whose names I can't remember... thanks to all of you.

title: Great location in the heart of the action
text: We got off to a rocky start when a large group was in the lobby during checkin but throughout the weekend this hotel made up for that.  As a globalist, this hotel has a huge benefit with the cost of breakfast and city parking included.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable and we love having a central point in the city to be able to relax and regroup before going to see the next item on our agenda. The best touch was getting access to the view on the 54th floor where Alana took family pictures and let us take in the view.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Hyatt Centric Times Square offers perhaps the best combination of location, value and comfort. While it's a mere block away from TS, this hotel is relatively quiet and not plagued by the crowds that plague the intersection of Broadway and 7th.  The rooftop bar and terrace has amazing views and is highly recommended for an evening night cap. Finally, the suites are spacious and perfect for families with small children, or adults that want to have extra space to relax and/or work.

title: Brilliant hotel
text:
Me and my pregnant wife visited New York as our last trip before we have our child and couldn’t have been happier with the service and location of this hotel. The staff are very warm and welcoming and were so accommodating to the fact my wife was pregnant, they gave us a room right near the elevator so she didn’t have to walk far. 
Perfect location, so close to Times Square it was a dream! 
Would very happily recommend this hotel. Perfect to come back to. My wife kept on calling it home.

title: Fab hotel
text: The Hyatt Centric is a fab place to stay whilst in New York . Even though it’s right next to Times Square it was so quiet .All the staff we came in contact were lovely, the rooms  were spotless . A visit to the rooftop bar Bar54 is a must . Try the Golden Goose cocktail which is definitely hit .

title: Room with a view
text: Thank you to the staff who made our stay very enjoyable. Friendly and efficient we found all the staff we came in to contact with a credit to the hotel.   Room was clean with plenty of storage, a good size and very comfortable bed. The rooftop bar is a must visit, particularly at sunset.  We’d go back and recommend.

title: Great Customer Service!
text: We are actually arriving at the hotel next week, but just had amazing phone customer service with Ysenia.   It was such a refreshing relief to speak with an employee that was able to solve my problem in a friendly and simple manner.    I  am looking forward to our stay at the property.    Thank you Ysenia!

title: Convenient Location, No Amenities
text:
The check-in process was smooth and the location of the hotel is very convenient for tourists and theater goers. The rooms themselves are comfortable and appear to be well kept.

During our stay, however, our dinner reservation was canceled approximately 15 minutes prior to our scheduled time slot. With the only other restaurant in the hotel closed indefinitely, and all nearby restaurants closed for the evening, we were without dinner. The hotel WiFi and TV service were both out during our stay as well.

While our room itself was clean, convenient and comfortable, the lack of any amenities whatsoever made our stay far from worth the $400 /night price for this hotel.

title: Great staff, awesome location
text:
This is the place to stay.  Easy to get plays, Central Park, Hudson River parks. Nice to go to pubs with happy hours in Hell’s Kitchen.  
The room is modern and bedding very comfortable.  The shore was l roomy.
Only downside, few usb ports.  
Don’t forget to go the bar 54 and see the view

title: Great Location
text:
Great stay at this hotel in a great location. Really friendly staff and very welcoming. Room was spacious and really clean. Loved it. 
Never heard any of the busy noise outside whilst in hotel or room. Would definitely stay here on my next trip to New York!

title: Great Hotel, great location
text:
Hotel is very central, stones throw from Times Square. Staff are very helpful and rooms are spacious for New York standards. Room has everything you need, hairdryer, coffee machine, iron….even USB charger points which came in handy. Not all rooms are guaranteed a view so if this is your priority make sure you book one that does. Would definitely stay here again.
The roof top bar wasn’t all that…cocktails were very expensive and not that tasty, paid almost as much for 2 cocktails as we did for a meal!! Would recommend the 10:30 visit if you just want to see the view minus the drinks.

title: Great stay
text: Highly recommend.  Quick fam trip and stayed in king high floor suite with view of Times Square. Location unbeatable. Staff friendly. Room clean. Responsive in terms of requests for any items. Will book again.

title: Quiet and comfortable hotel accessible to everything
text: Our family of 4 had a quiet and comfortable stay in a 2 queen room. The hotel is in the middle of everything yet perfectly quiet at night with very comfortable beds. Housekeeping did a great job. With a family of 4, the only things that could have improved the stay would be a sink/mirror outside the bathroom and a few more outlets for charging our many devices. Overall, it was an excellent hotel.

title: Don't book this hotel
text: Paid for a balcony room and got a window. Front desk staff does not care and is super unhelpful. The hotel is super outdated, TV didn't work, phone to call front desk didnt work & the internet was down. Stay somewhere else.

title: Great location, clean, updated, etc.!
text: Great location, clean, updated, etc.! The room was lovely and the view was fantastic! It is right in Time Square and accessible to just about everything. The room was clean and very tastefully decorated. The rooftop bar is beautiful, but very overpriced.

title: Great Location; Great Hotel Stay
text: Our first time in NYC for a vacation. Hyatt Centric was right in the heart of Times Square. Hotel was clean, quite and very comfortable. Location is great and even though it's very close to Times Square; our room was very quiet. Would stay here again if we go back.

title: Excellent location and quality!
text: For location this place cannot be beaten and it is right in Times Square. There are many others but this place was awesome. There are so much stores all over here and broadway was also a stone throw away.

title: Great location and service!
text: Excellent location.  Walking distance to plenty of restaurants, Broadway theaters and Madison Square Garden.  Close to Times Square, but you can still get a dark and quiet sleep. Irish Pub next door does great drinks and dinner.

title: mixed
text:
Bedrooms are fine and housekeeping lovely, great location.
Breakfast was a free for all not really thought of this as not enough seating  for a busy hotel!!!!
Now after 5 emails to  Jullian its now 19 days since our departure and still 3 of my group are still waiting for our $100 to be put back in our accounts!!!!!!
Not good enough Hyyatt

If you had responded after 14 days as you state and returned my email i would not be posting

title: Great stay with one exception
text: Excellent location with nice staff and great beds and shower.   We spent the first two nights sweating, then called maintenance who found the AC filter was black and caked with dirt.   The AC worked very well after the filter was replaced.   It was disappointing to see that the hotel does not take care of basic room maintenance.    Otherwise a  good stay.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The food we ordered was delicious, the rooms were clean and spacious and the staff was friendly and professional. The hotel location is great too. I’ll definitely stay at this hotel again when I go to New York.

title: Delightful!
text: Me and my friends had a such a good experience …… look forward to do it again in the future. Except for the disappointment we had from the B54 restaurant on the top floor, that night the Kichten was close not a good selection of appetizers and drinks and to over priced for the service we got!! So glad we have dinner before we visit this place.

title: Convenient Location
text:
The staff was very friendly, the room was pretty clean and it was very conveniently located. We enjoyed the 10:30 family friendly bar tour to see the view from the 54th floor. The hotel had umbrellas available for guests to use when it rained which was nice to have. 

The elevators were slow during busy times at night but I presume that is the case most places.

title: Weekend visit
text:
Visited at the start at the month with my 2 children, as a lone parent with 2 children the staff couldn’t of been more helpful! Our suitcases were carried up to our room and we were shown how to use everything in the room. We had an amazing view of the rockerfeller Center and Central Park tower.
Lots of bottle was provided and the house keeping service was exceptional!
Everyone morning were greeted with friendly hello in the lobby. We were sad to leave!

title: New York Broadway Play
text: We booked Hyatt Centric for location, familiar with high quality and pictures of room and view. We were so impressed. Although our first impression was marred by a not so nice welcome, we will stay again.

title: Excelente Hotel
text: Es la tercera vez que me alojo en el Hyatt Centric Times Square y las habitaciones siguen siendo excelentes. Son amplias (raro en NY) las camas comodísimas y el servicio de limpieza impecable. Todos los días limpiaron las habitaciones y nos dejaban botellas de agua, café y te de cortesía. Siempre había gente muy amable en recepción que hablaba español y estaban dispuestos a ayudarnos.

title: Excellent staff, clean and comfortable
text: Close to everything, great staff, clean, just great. All theaters and Madison Square Garden very walkable, tons of dining options within blocks. Housekeeping staff was especially helpful, guest services, valet, everyone was great.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great hotel! The Hyatt centric times square was very accommodating! Drinks at Bar 54 were excellent. Would definitely stay again. Right in the mix of Times Square. Beds very comfortable.  Pillows were a little too soft.

title: Haytt Centric Times Square 1 Night stay  Family of 3 (8 month old baby)
text:
I booked a room for 1 Night - King, high floor (20-50), the day before the trip. Upon arrival I payed additional $75 for early arrival, because check in time starts from 4 PM, and I arrived at 9 AM. Receptionist was friendly and  did all the check-in procedures fast. Room 4707, not super clean, but ok. Curtains were covered in vomit stains. Other than that everything was working fine, bed was clean but not super comfortable. Rooms are marked as soundproof, maybe for walls and windows, but door and all noise from corridor bothered us, door slamming sound was waking our baby up all the time. 

Facilities - there is no way you can work somewhere outside your room. The only option is the lobby, not good for important calls. Business center was not available, but you can print documents for free in lobby.

Location - Perfect location for tourists, close to everything you will need during your stay.

Overall: It's ok for 1 night.

title: Top Hotel
text: This was my 3rd time stay at the Hyatt Centric Time Square.  Wonderful hotel to stay at and walking distance to just about everything.  The higher floor with tub is the best after a long day of walking to soak your bones. Room service was super quick less than 20 mins to deliver a brown bag breakfast for two.

title: Awesome hotel and so convenient to Broadway plays and subways!
text: We loved our visit to this hotel! Staff was so friendly and accommodating! Convenient to all subways and other transportation and walking distance to all the Broadway shows we attended! View from Bar 54 on the top of this hotel was superb! Only drawback for me personally was that I like a bathtub instead of a shower and I didn't realize that we didn't have one until we arrived. There were rooms that had them but it was for a higher rate and we just weren't able to do that once we arrived.

title: Amazing stay!!
text: This hotel has it all! From the location (right in Times Square (!!) the room had a soaking tub and walk in shower, the food options, the easiness of parking with the valet service, the view, the upper rooftop deck to take photos, the concierge service and the staff- 5 stars all around. Excellent experience. Thank you!

title: Super location and comfy room
text: Can’t fault this hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Looks unassuming from street and lobby is modest but room was spacious and nicely furnished. We were three sharing twin queen beds which were super comfy and cosy (we travelled Feb). Bathroom and shower felt warm and luxurious - everything functioned well. Plenty space for three sharing. Wouldn’t hesitate to return - hopefully very soon!

title: Wonderful Staff and Great Room
text:
The staff was really nice. I like to give a shout out to Shawn (not sure on spelling). He really took the time to assist us when our boy had an accident in the lobby (threw up) with a belly ache. He also helped look for restaurants close by that are kid friendly where they have TV showing NBA All Star game.  
Our room was spacious and clean overlooking Time Square. Awesome location walking distance to Broadway shows, Central Park, Radio City, Rockefeller Center, etc! Our bathroom even has radiant floor and rain shower head. We loved it! Only thing is their restaurant was not open, but only the one on 54th floor where it’s 21+, so we couldn’t take our boys there. Would’ve been nice for them to see the city from the top floor. There are a ton of restaurants nearby though. I do recommend staying here, but prepare for steep valet parking fee $90+/day!! Don’t bring a car if possible otherwise park in garage $60+/day. Also choose high floor if you’re a light sleeper or you’ll hear cars honking. We were 22nd floor and I could hear cars honking early morning.

title: Great Location and service
text:
We went as a family for a week. It has a great location, our room was according to what we needed. We would return any time. 

The team could improve breakfast. If the bar is open, why not breakfast? Just an idea.

title: Best Recent Stay
text: This entire stay was excellent for us.  I requested an early check in because our train was arriving at lunchtime.  The room was ready at noon and they let us check in right away. front desk staff were excellent and explained hotel procedures to us.  They honored my request for a quiet room and I was in 5209 which had an amazing view and was super quiet! This room was highly spacious by NYC standards and very clean. I was originally booked for one night but decided to extend my stay for another night and I texted the concierge, they replied quickly that I could extend in that room.  This hotel has unlimited bottled water for guests and if you needed more, I just called downstairs and it came up in under 10 min. The service here was amazing. Everyone was friendly, ranging from housekeeping to the front desk. They held our bags on check out day so we could still explore. The location is excellent, just off Times Square and the entrance is on 45th st so you don't exit into 5000 people immediately on 7th avenue. I've stayed in a few hotels post-covid and the experience has not been great. This is a hotel that is running like a well-oiled machine. I will stay here again.

title: It's a City Hotel Done Very Well
text:
Don't complain about this hotel not having a plush lobby, or carpeted lounges for guests to hang out in. This is a hotel yards from Times Square that has large clean rooms and enough facilities for everyone to enjoy. You come to NYK to spend time in the city rather than in the hotel so as long as the beds are comfy (they are super comfy) and the staff are nice (they are all very polite) then this is what you need. The rooms are large for NYK and also the bathrooms so there is no banging your elbows in the shower.

We had a great room with a balcony and it all just works (the 'busy' carpet could go though in the hallways). There is a bar at the top of the hotel on the 54th floor, but in these Covid times you need to make reservations. It does have a lovely view of the New Year Ball in Times Square. At 1030am each day they also allow guests to go to the bar for the views as there is outside space. Checkout at 2pm which is very useful and Louis on the door sorted our car back to JFK with no issues whatsoever.

If you want sweeping staircases and sprawling lounges then go to the Knickerbocker, but if you are here for NYK then you'll be fine here.

title: Roof top
text:
Nous avons été au roof top pour la tomber de la nuit. Très belle expérience, la vu est très agréable et impressionnante, roof top à l’extérieur mais également à l’intérieur. Prix des consommations un peu plus chère que d’habitude mais cela en vos la peine. 
Expérience à faire.

title: Its an “apart-hotel” it is not really a hotel
text:
When you think of a hotel … what makes a hotel …. A hotel ?
- plush reception 
- a choice of restaurants 
- room service
- pampering
- lots of staff looking after you

Hyatt Centric has none of these.  I feel like i did not receive the memo.  So what does it have ?
- great location
- clean and modern rooms
- quite big rooms for Manhattan 
- keen helpful staff
- a gym
- breakfast delivered to your door in a brown bag
- a public bar on the roof that also serves appetisers

It is well executed.  And if you love Times Square area then it is super convenient.  But it has no real facilities, which makes the stay slightly joyless.  I would not personally come back

title: Long awaited trip to New York
text: We got a flight and accommodation deal with BA, we were not disappointed the staff at the hotel were friendly, and welcoming the overall experience in the hotel was vey good and a stones throw from Times Square.

title: Fabulous!
text: So happy I booked this hotel! Staff were so welcoming and our room was incredible! The hotel is so clean and so convenient to theaters , restaurants, and Times Square..The staff were always so friendly and helpful! Can’t wait to return!

title: Great location
text: The hotel is in a great location for dinner and theatre. The room was clean, not fancy. The service was better than excellent. All employees were very helpful and attentive. I was spoiled from the rooms at the Andaz and Grand Hyatt, this is more of an average hotel stay. I would stay here again if I was going to the theatre, they are all close and within easy walking distance. Many restaurants close by.

title: An honest review
text:
Visited this hotel as we was hoping to be close Times Square, which we was. Stepped out of the taxi, and walked into reception. 
The service and staff in the hotel, In our opinion is Just not good enough. Staff are so rude, did not want help.‘ too busy talking behind the desk to one and other.  You would think that there is no other hotel and we’ve been allocated this hotel. 
Asked for help with where to eat, looking for a bbq place, supermarkets outside town, was told “not sure” and then “can’t understand this in English” was told to use Google to find somewhere close by as they did not know. It makes no sense? 

Upon checking into the room, Coffee machine was not been working, turns out that you are unable to use more than one electrical device in the plug at the same time. So, if you have your coffee machine plugged in, then you are unable to also plug a charger in. Bizzare! 

Just as well, we also did not get any milk in the room, when we asked for milk we was told “the kitchen is closed, you will need to walk and find some from a mini mart”. 
Same thing a couple of days later when asking if anyone had a lighter or matches. 
Staff just do not want to help at all. 

Asked for them upon check in to make a reservation for the bar upstairs, was told we needed to call and do that. When we did they advised we did not.

Overall the hotel reception staff are rude, the hotel is not the best and massively Overpriced in comparison with others: the pictures shown on most websites are very different to reality. Four of our friends came out 2 days after us, stayed in a cheaper hotel around the corner.  the room was bigger, better views, and staff were much more friendly and helpful.  We visited them when they arrived and the hotel staff were very helpful when we asked them anything. Do not waste your money here!! 

would never use your hotels again based on the experience. Room was not as we hoped,’carpets in hallway are dated Just not good enough.. Room was not as we hoped,’carpets in hallway are dated and do not even match the decor. Room was a time square view when booking, when mentioned on front desk at check in was told “the room has been allocated now”. Not as described. 
The only positive I had to say was, there was a lady in the roof too bar, very good and very lovely service. Cannot remember her name, but she had glasses and blondish hair. “Old
Fashioned cocktail” is very good. I would recommend this bar, the views are amazing. Very expensive. We had two cocktails each and it came to $120 - which in my opinion is expensive, would not pay $25 a cocktail in LONDON.
our Maid, she was very good. Very helpful and friendly, always left our room clean.

Personally, we would advise you to save your money and go elsewhere. There is massively better Hotels, Cheaper with better service in New York than this place.
Totally disappointed. Will be taking it up with our airline provider too.

title: Great location! Great Staff!
text: All of the staff were super friendly and welcoming. Especially the staff at the roof top bar!!! And the view of Times Square from the window in our room was amazing. I will definitely be back next time I am in NYC!!!!!

title: NYC Weekend Trip
text: Loved our stay here. Room was everything we needed, and the staff was nothing short of excellent. The only issue we had was with our door out to the terrace. we stayed on the 27th floor (terrace floor) and whenever the wind started, it would create a whistling noise that was tough to drown out. I'm not sure if that is consistent when there is wind or if our door wasn't sealing correctly.

title: Friendly,clean and excellent location
text:
Enjoyed the hotel, room was spacious, comfortable and quiet. staff friendly. Bar 54 has amazing views with friendly staff. Fitness center clean with a variety of working equipment. 
Location is perfect.

title: Excellent location - great room
text: I've had good experiences at Hyatt hotels and this one was no exception.  Great room, perfect location for Broadway and sight-seeing.  Only complaint - I stayed on the 36th floor and it took FOREVER to get hot water in the shower - easily more than 5 minutes.  I hated wasting the water.

title: Rude service - I’m to upset to write a review about my experience. All I can say it was not worth the stay.
text: It was a unpleasant stay. The front desk clerk was rude and unprofessional. The sheets were torn and stained. I would not recommend this hotel , definitely not worth the price. That gentlemen at the front desk has poor customer service.

title: Good location
text: The hotel was very well located. Staff helpful though unfortunately we could not have breakfast at the hotel, not sure if they were renovating. Anyways many great restaurants in neighborhood. Door man always very friendly. Would come back again for convenient location

title: Another wonderful stay
text: We have stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square on two previous occasions. We came back because the hotel and its customer service makes us feel comfortable and safe in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world. We visited for 6 nights for my birthday staying in room 3806 with a Times Square view and were impressed from the beginning to end of our stay, Although we had a couple of issues with our room which I reported on our first day, they were fixed straight away whilst we were out sight seeng. We even had a visit from the technical team to explain what was done to fix the couple of issues and to ensure everything was ok. Many thanks to Michelle and the team for making our stay so personable and welcoming - we will be back again!

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square was great
text: Very accomodating and made for both leisure and business travel.  The location is ideal and the whole experience was comfortable and fast.  Seriously, if you are there to enjoy the experience of Times Square, Broadway, or anything NY has to offer... it really was in the best location.  Great rooms, fast elevators, and awesome service.  I will be staying there again.

title: Expensive for what it is
text: Can’t even get into the bar of your hotel as guest. We were told to come after our show then asked to leave because we didn’t have a reservation. Toilet broken even after they sent someone to fix it. Restaurant closed for COVID.

title: Great midtown hotel
text:
Hotel rooms in midtown Manhattan are small and expensive.  This is no exception to that.  However, I've stayed in at least 20 hotels in Manhattan over the years and this was one of my better stays.

The location is perfect.  It's a 1/2 a block from the craziness of Times Square yet quiet.  The staff is great!  The rooms are clean and updated.

title: Best hotel in NYC! Great location, fabulous room!
text: We stayed in the executive suite room 2001. From the moment we entered the front door we were greeted by several friendly employees. We checked in quickly and made our way to the room. This room was unlike anything I’ve ever stayed in when visiting New York City, the best I’ve ever stayed over the past 20 years. It’s super modern and updated, with tons of “extras” And top of the line items including various lighting options, a robe and slippers, a premium hairdryer, a fabulous rainwater shower, tons of toiletries, including any toiletries you can imagine that you may have forgotten they provide you for free, Bottled waters, refrigerator, a Keurig, tons of closet and dresser space, Comfortable chairs and a couch, and the bed is so comfortable. The Florida ceiling windows provided an amazing view. The pull curtains were very convenient to easily open during the day and to close during the evening. There were two different televisions and also two different temperature controls in each room which I really liked so if someone stayed in the other room there were pocket doors to separate the two rooms and each room could have its own temperature. The housekeeping staff went above and beyond and when you ask for extra towels you actually get a ton and not just one or two like normal hotels. Each day they offer a private view on the top floor of the outdoor rooftop bar where you can get a beautiful view of the city at 10:30 AM each day and a free photo keepsake.  We ordered breakfast for room service and it arrived super fast and everything was packaged nicely in little containers and was delicious. The only thing I wished the room had was a microwave but this was the only thing missing and we ended up not needing one anyways. We will 100% be back and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a beautiful comfortable stay with friendly staff in the absolute perfect location. We were able to walk to Times Square and get to plenty of restaurants and shopping without having to take a subway or any other transportation. A+!!

title: Amazing location and views
text: My partner surprised me at Christmas with tickets to New York. On arrival the hotel is fairly flat fronted and doesn't look imposing or extravagant, On entering the reception area this was also no frills small space but still modern and clean. The lady on reception was wonderful she was very pleasant and friendly as were all staff during our stay. We were allocated a 52nd floor apartment looking over time square to say i was amazed is an under statement. I walked into the room approximately 7pm to be greeted by full length windows that brought the skyline into the room (pictures attached) the price to keep the room on was a little expensive at $50 per hour and our flight wasn't till 8:30pm but we kept it for a few hours then they kindly kept out bags secure until departure. Amazing hotel and the view is outstanding if you pay for the upgrade to a high floor.

title: Perfect location.  Nice, clean hotel.  Friendly Staff
text:
We stayed in the Hyatt Centric Thursday, 01/13 through Monday 01/17.   The hotel mostly exceeded our expectations.  The lobby is no frills and basic.  But, the room is very nice, well updated, well appointed and clean.   The room was small, but once our things were put away and the luggage in the closet, it was adequate for two people, and much the size I would expect in New York.  

The hotel staff was very friendly.  Every person we saw had a pleasantry and each were helpful.

The location is excellent, within easy walking distance to many theaters, restaurants, bars and Times Square.

We were on the 36th floor, so we did not hear any traffic noise, etc.. so, the room was quiet, (with the exception of someone walking down the stairwell one early morning next to our room)

Minor Complaints:

I guess it is a personal preference.....but, I found the bed to be very hard and the pillows were very flat.   I used two pillows, folded them over, and they still didn't support my head.     The sheets were also scratchy and not soft...as were the towels.  In addition, the towels did not always match.  All of them were white, but some had a design around the side, others did not.   

The elevator was a bit slow.....Because the sign said no more than four on an elevator, (due to covid restrictions), we ended up waiting 5-10 minutes each time we needed to ride it, especially at busy times.   One day, we finally asked if we could get in with 4 other people....as, we had refused three other cars that already had the limited number of people.   

The "Bar 54" on the rooftop had excellent views.  However, it was the only place we found the staff to be a bit distant and not friendly.  Likewise, the food was not good.  The charcuterie board was horrible; dry, hard meat and cheese....grocery store delis are much better and cheaper.  

Finally, when we left we found additional charges on our "prepaid room".  It appears they charge some type of "gotcha charge" of a "destination fee" of $30.00 per day?  I'm not sure why this wasn't included in the original price listed for the hotel, as it appears to be a standard part of the hotel charge....when I prepay for the room, I expect that to cover all but incidentals of room service, etc...

Nonetheless, when I return to New York, I will definitely consider this hotel again.

title: Great Visit
text: Rooms were nice, very warm for us during the cold storm that came & we had a view of time square.  They were extremely nice & kept our room very clean and stocked with water/soap/etc..  The doorman was very helpful getting rides around town.  I would return here & recommend this place to others.

title: Steps from Times Square
text: We booked this semi-last minute for a family outing. It’s literally steps from times square. Right in the theater district blocks from the Empire State building in Rockefeller Center. Literally in the heart of it all. Their in-house restaurant is closed so you can do a bag breakfast. Prices seemed a little steep for what they were offering so we didn’t partake in that McDonald’s is literally just steps away. Room was clean. The rainfall showerhead in the bathroom was wonderful except water gets everywhere.

title: Expect Your Final Bill to be Higher than Given at Time of Check Out.. Once You are Off the Premisis and Awaiting Your Flight at
text: Room was cleaned and fresh towels and water replenished every day. Housekeeping staff were fantastic. Security man (From Nepal) was exceptionally nice. However, its all downhill from there. Front desk staff (with the exception of 2 lovely women) would benefit from a course in customer service. Upon check out we were given our (printed) bill and agreed to the charges. We also received an email copy of the bill. Traveled to Newark Airport where some hours later we received a new bill with increased charges. No email or communication to explain why, just an amount showing as a deduction on our bank cards. Upon contacting the hotel we were informed that a mistake had been made and that they had charged fees to British Airways. Extremely disappointing poor service from the Hyatt brand. As regular travelers they have lost our custom for any future trips. Custom that no establishment should be willing to loss in the current circumstances of the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Can't beat the location!
text: Can't beat the location, especially for the price.  One block from Broadway and a few blocks from Rockefeller Center.  The staff was fantastic, the hummus and cocktails were great, and the view from the rooftop bar can't be beat.

title: Great hotel Great location
text: We loved this hotel.  Our room had a heated bathroom floor.  That amenity alone made it a 5 star to me.   The staff was extremely friendly, specifically our housekeeper and the new manager from San Diego. On the rainy day,  the hotel had umbrellas for guests to use. Time Square was a block away.  We walked to all our dinners and shows. It was the perfect location for our vacation.

title: Situation idéale et super pratique, des chambres confortables et propres, personnel très accueillant
text: Situation exceptionnelle à 2 pas de Times Square. Personnel à la réception et service de chambre hyper aimable et serviable. Bar avec une vue magnifique. Des lits très confortable et une chambre super propre tous les jours

title: NYE 2022 - with kids
text: We upgraded to a suite on arrival to better accommodate our family. The room provided us a place to rest - a home base for our adventures, and room to spend a couple of days indoors, playing games and relaxing together. The front desk staff were great and everyone loved the heated floors in the bathroom. (Now we have another "someday project" for our house). Very pleased with the stay. Would recommend.

title: Solid Hotel
text: Overall a good hotel in a great location if you want to be near Times Square and the Theater District. Room was nice with large windows overlooking midtown. The hotel was full when we stayed but we never heard anyone in the rooms around us which was nice. If you are looking for a large bustling lobby with amenities, lobby bar and restaurant, etc... then you may be disappointed - this hotel has none of that and the lobby area was underwhelming at best. Also, as mentioned in other reviews, there are no good breakfast options so you will likely need to venture out for that. Overall a solid choice though.

title: Preis Leistung stimmt nicht
text: Zimmer waren schmutzig. Bei Anreise wurde uns ein Zimmer mlt 500€ Aufpreis aufgedrängt weil unser Zimmer gewisse Mängel hat. Wir waren 7 Nächte dort und haben 6400€ ohne Verpflegung bezahlt. Putzpersonal super aufdringlich. Ich würde nicht mehr dieses Hotel wählen

title: Great location in Mid-town/Times Square
text: Our room was on the 52nd floor - 2 queen bed.  Wonderful view. Great staff, but due to Covid, breakfast selection was blah! Do not take a "breakfast credit" if it is included.  Opt for breakfast else where.

title: Great stay
text: The staff was very welcoming upon arrival. Everything about the stay was exceptional. We ordered breakfast both mornings which was also as described. Housekeeping kept our room in tiptop shape.  If we ever come back to New York this property will be our destination.

title: Great Hotel, Right in the Heart of Entertainment
text: Hyatt Centric was one of the best places we've stayed in New York. The room was spacious, the bed was extremely comfortable, the service was top level, and the best part was how conveniently located the hotel was to all things NYC.

title: Perfect Stay!
text: This was our first time at the Hyatt Centric.  It was absolutely excellent!  The staff were very friendly and the hotel was very clean.  You can't ask for a better location.  Can't wait to come back soon!

title: Convenient Location
text: The hotel lobby and our room were very clean and updated.  The bed and pillows were very comfortable.  The location is convenient to Times Square and easy access to the subway.  The hotel staff was very friendly.

title: Excellent Service!
text: Our room was very clean and the view from our room was incredible. What really made our week long staff awesome was the staff.  We stayed for a week and every time we saw the front staff and housekeepers they went above and beyond to assist us with a smile. Excellent service was provided to us all week. We will definitely choose this hotel again. Excellent location as well.

title: Great Facility, Great Location
text:
We rented two rooms for four nights one week before Christmas. We were well pleased. Each room was large by NYC standards and included two queen beds. We were on the 25th floor so street noise was hardly noticeable. The hotel is relatively new. Everything was clean and in working order. Each room included a small refrigerator, a Keurig coffee/tea maker and a small safe. Bottled water was provided daily. The bathrooms had optional heated floors.

A rooftop bar was very nice and offered limited food service but minors are not allowed. Room service breakfast was available. The primary restaurant was closed because of the pandemic. There was no concierge but the front desk staff and doormen were helpful when assistance was needed. 

The hotel is located on West 45th Street halfway between 6th and 7th Avenues so it's convenient to Times Square. If the Keurig coffee is not sufficient, there is a convenient Starbucks just across the street. Decent food is available in restaurants along 45th Street.

title: Great experience and Times Square views!
text: Would definitely recommend to stay here - great city views from the rooms and rooftop bar. Everything went smooth and do not have one complaint to make regarding my stay. Central to everything in NY. Loved it!

title: Perfection
text: Clean, efficient, discounted rate, upgraded room, and extremely helpful and friendly staff.  It was the best Times Square stay we have had in decades.  If you can snag a great rate, book it.  Note: Broadway shows are canceling left and right due to COVID.  Call the box office before you plan a trip and have alternate plans scheduled.

title: Great Place to stay
text: First time staying at the Hyatt Centric Times Square.  It was a great experience.  The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  Their covid protocol was good and we felt. safe staying there.   I would stay here again and would recommend to family and friends.

title: JJS
text: Great Location in NYC! Clean room and service.  Very friendly people working there to make me more comfortable.  I stayed in high floor.  I didn't hear any Time square noise at all. I  will definitely visit again.

title: Great Weekend Getaway
text: My daughter and I took a quick weekend trip into the city to do some shopping. The hotel and room were very clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. The location is perfect for shopping on 5th, visiting Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park and Time Square. We will be back!

title: Not what I was expecting?
text: I totally understand that the Hyatt Group wish to keep everyone safe during this pandemic but to see other restaurants in the area open? Charging the same price as a normal stay but only providing BAGGED food? was simply somthing I wasn't expecting? I only wished Id booked Grand Central not 3 blocks away, that were not only a cheaper place to stay, but also had a voucher to use at the bar along with the restaurant being open. Not a happy customer on this occasion..

title: Home away from home.
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square last week. The only regret we had was our time being so short. You can stay in any hotel with a nice room and view,  but the people make the difference.  Yenny, DeeDee, Alyssa, Ashram, the housekeeping staff, valet.. and others,  whose names I can't remember, every single person made a positive impact on our stay. Room was clean, almost sterile, view was absolutely breath taking.  The quietness of the hotel knowing that just outside is the busy streets of Times Square, makes it even more appealing. 
I shall be visiting again as soon as possible. Thank you guys. Happy Holidays!

title: Great location and Service
text: Convenient to Time Square, a very short walk to Radio City Music Hall and pretty much most of the attractions in that proximity.  Hotel made me feel secure and the rooms were very clean. Shower pressure, especially for NYC, was good (7/10...9/10 for NYC).  When traveling back to the city, will definitely stay back this hotel and would recommend for couples, family or independent travelers.

title: little disappointed
text: The hotel was nice and very central located, we usually stay OMNI, tried this one and all was fine, front desk girl quite rude upon checkout. but.. they quoted us 204 per night and when we checked out it was 600  EXTRA fees for resort fees etc. ?  what resort ?  for water bottle in room, an wifi they said.. this is ridiculous.. extra 150 in extra fees, DONT say 204 and then charge 150 extra this is NOT spirit Airlines.. This was very deceiving  (read the fine print she said).. Well there was no coffee in room, no cups, could not get glasses to drink our wine in room (covid)   cleaning lady never came. so not sure what resort fee is but very disappointing.!!!   just post price dont trick people and then dont offer them anything because of COVID. ?

title: Checks all boxes
text: Very close to Time Square, 5th Ave, Rockefeller Tree, Saks, Central Park --- all the holiday things. Great location. Super clean hotel. Love the heated bathroom tile floors. Friendly staff. On-site parking was expensive but also convenient. Great views of the city. Accommodated our quick check-in and late check out. Customer service was great

title: HYATT CENTRIC TIME SQUARE
text: Very helpful staff with decently smooth check in process. A walk away from the madness of time square and the great ambience of Broadway. Expensive parking for personal vehicle. Apart from that clean and decent size king size bedroom. Pillows were subpar. Used standard pillows for king size bed. Recommend it

title: Everything you need for a business stay
text: Coffee in the room along with a frig.  Only breakfast available for room service but that was fine and quite good.  HOT water in the shower with good water pressure, right across the street from a drug store, a few restaurants close-by.  Hotel staff were lovely.

title: Great trip /location
text: This hotel was a clean quiet sanctuary in the middle of all the Hussle and bussle of Times Square. Hotel was clean with a great bar but just steps away from everything New York. The staff was kind and helpful, I love having a doorman to greet me when I return from a long day. I would stay at this hotel again.

title: Overcharged at checkout
text: Hotel was nice.  Staff friendly.  Wish they had a better restaurant/bar service and room service.  When I booked directly on line and made reservation it quoted $367 a night.   In confirmation email it did not state the price for the total stay.  Upon check out 3 days later they charged me over $550 a night plus taxes and fees.  Would not stay here again.

title: beautiful hotel
text: convenient located, clean, comfortable, rooms were great - would recommend to friends and family.  easily accessible and friendly bellman and outside person, well lite inside and outside, clean inside and outside

title: Our Hyatt Centric Experience
text: Brilliant hotel, location 2mins from heart of Times Square, walking distance Empire State. Room spacious,as was bathroom and shower,  spotlessly clean as was rest of hotel. Staff welcoming and helpful, excellent housekeeping, loved the tea/coffee maker and endless complimentary supplies, including bottled water, and fridge in room. Fantastic 7days, definitely would stay again, 10/10+

title: DUE PASSI DA TIMES SQUARE
text:
Nella media buono, bel rooftop in cima per un drink , camere metratura grande e bagno in buone condizioni, Ciò che mi ha interdetto è stata la mancanza di una hall ... da un hotel di tale nome mi aspettavo una bella hall , ma assolutamente no , un banco per il check in e subito ascensore per le camere.
Cmq da prendere in considerazione.

title: Amazing Location, but Dirty Rooms
text: For $500 per night, We expected cleanliness.  Instead we were greeted with filth.   The staff was very friendly, but when I travel, I want a clean space to rest my head, and we didn’t get that at the Hyatt Centric.

title: Stay
text: The location is great but I am used to book 4 or 5 Star Hotels for my stays but this hotel doesn't represent a 4 Star. Staff specially the concierges are very nice and helpful, The room was not very clean and very noisy. Unable to sleep well.

title: Will Not Stay Here Again
text: I bought my kids Broadway tickets for Christmas.  I was going to have them stay here but after my stay, I will never pay for a room at the Hyatt again.  The front desk was rude and not accommodating.  I will be staying at the Marriott for my next play!

title: Location, location, location
text:
We used Hyatt points to stay here (Hyatt really has the best rewards program of all the major brands). We'd previously stayed at the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central Station, which is a superior hotel (obviously . . . Grand vs. Centric gives it away) but we had to walk a lot more. We will be staying at the Times Square Centric from now on. 

Our room was a standard NYC room with two double beds. Though we were considered a low floor (23rd) and facing away from Times Square, it was plenty high and had a nice view. Housekeeping did a good job.

There are two elevators for floors 2-25 and another for the higher floors. Staying near the top of our elevator's range was a boon because there was never anyone already on it when it came. I would recommend floors 22-25 for this reason. I didn't pay attention to how high up the other floors were, so I can't make any recommendations there.

Yes, breakfast is delivered in a bag (it said it would be left outside the room, but the delivery person knocked, eager to receive a tip no doubt), and the menu is limited, but I enjoyed it. Go to Connelly's a couple of doors down for a good sit down breakfast. 

Another thing this hotel doesn't have is a mart in the lobby, but there's a Duane Reed across the street.

title: Excellent Location & Service
text: Another excellent stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square! The hotel is centrally located (quite frankly can’t get any better). The check-in was easy, room was clean, and service was very friendly. I was greeted as an Explorist and offered late checkout. The view from the room was impeccable and heated floors in the bathroom was a nice touch. The beds are also extremely comfortable and make for a great sleep! The destination fee of US$30 plus tax per night is always a pest/nuisance. I understand this is now an industry standard, and under normal circumstances guests may be able to get their moneys worth. But under the circumstances with covid, I was surprised to see the destination fee charged to guests when some of the inclusions that are covered by the fee were either not guaranteed or offered to guests. Nevertheless, it was great to be back to the Hyatt Centric - always a good time and I recommend this location to all.

title: When by Times Square, stay at the Hyatt Centric!
text: Outstanding! If you are looking to stay near Times Square look no further. This is the hotel you want. Wonderful service, great rooms, incredible views, and bellmen who know the territory and go above and beyond to help you get around town.

title: Hyatt Centric is the perfect location.
text: This is just off the Times Square craziness and close enough to walk a couple blocks to 5th Ave etc. will definitely stay there anytime I go back to NYC. Great restaurants and the Broadway theaters are only a couple blocks. If you want to be in the middle of everything, this is the place to stay.

title: Great place!
text: Good location for many attractions, theaters, food options, and super close to Times Square!! Nice, clean room! Would stay here again!!! Liked that there was a 24 hr Walgreens across Street and a couple doors, nice to have something open late and close when something is needed late!

title: Great Stay and Great Location
text: Fantastic hotel with a great location and the concierge was terrific and helped with finding me transportation to Philly. Loved this place. Expensive but worth it. The parking is not cheap so if you do not need to park a car I would uber in to avoid the 80 per night charge.

title: Just about ok
text: Location close Times Square - room size moderate - rates very high in comparison to services provided. In particular breakfast (delivered in a paper bag is a true joke). Staff quite nice. 54th bar ok.

title: Overpriced and disappointing
text: Air conditioning did it work. Was told hotel was full and no other rooms available that turned to be untrue. Towels for two guests when they knew it was three. No glasses or mugs available for room. Had to move to another room at 9:30 pm. Second room door lock did not work and was not fixed. Hair dryer did not work. Furniture stains. Scuff marks on window frames and desk. Overall awful overpriced experience. Felt I was at a Motel 8. Sheets had holes and worn.

title: Special Treatment
text: The hotel is perfectly located near Times Square.  The hotel offered a low cost room upgrade that was well worth the extra money (king suite).  The room was very spacious and modern with two TVs and a refrigerator.  When we were leaving early one morning in the rain, the front desk had umbrellas ready for us.  Beds were perfect, and towels were fluffy.  My every need was attended to quickly,  It was a fabulous stay in New York.

title: Good location and clean room!
text: This hotel was centrally located near Times Square and the staff was very helpful in getting the room ready for an early check in. Room was spacious and clean. Bottled water, coffee & tea in the room were complimentary so that was nice!

title: Good location, pleasant experience
text: The Hyatt Centric was ideally sited to accommodate our choice of restaurant and theater.  It is within an easy walking distance of the Times Square attractions and theaters, and an easy walk from the subway.  The hotel check-in procedure ran smoothly, check-out was hands-free.  The room was clean, with plenty of towels and hot water.  We were on the 44th floor in a suite and had wonderful views. The soundproofing was excellent - we would never have guessed we were in the room next to the elevator. No worries at all.  We would definitely come back to this hotel for its location and for its amenities.

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
The hotel is new so the room was fine but the hotel lacked basic amenities.  Didn't even have a place to buy a soda or snack.  
Although this is very convenient to Times Square, I would not stay here again.

title: Night in NYC Theater District
text:
We visited the Hyatt Centric Times Square this weekend and thoroughly enjoyed our experience for the following reasons: 
The room was clean and well maintained including a modern decor. 
The front desk staff was courteous and helpful while adherents to COVID-19 protocols are in effect.
The view from Bar 54 in the balcony is a great view of Times Square and Mid Town Manhattan 
The Concierge and valet service is excellent

title: Great location
text: Just steps from Time Square and Broadway.  Located in the heart of Manhattan.  Close to a lot of the sights and transportation.  Great hotel staff.  Staff is very accommodating. Hotel rooms were spacious and very up-to-date  and modern.  I will always stay at this location.

title: Decent hotel for NYC
text:
The hotel is in a great location if you’re looking to see the sights. We stayed overnight to celebrate our friends birthday and this was close to the activity we were doing. The staff was pretty nice. Only downside was our tv didn’t work and we were told someone would come, no one ever came. 
The room was clean but it did not have a seal on the door to show that the room was cleaned and I was the first person in there since then. This was the first hotel since covid Where I didn’t see this. 

The beds were okay but the pillows were the worst thing ever. We all complained about them. We might as well have slept on nothing. Guaranteed neck ache. 

Overall: it was good for an overnight stay and close to many things and trains especially if you’re going to do something touristy.

title: Great location and clean hotel!
text: Upon arrival, our room was ready for early check in even though we had not asked for it. This was a pleasant surprise. Once we entered our room, it appeared clean and tidy, however, there was a bad odor that filled the room, similar to a sewage smell that can be smelled on the streets of NYC occasionally. We used the room phone to call the front desk and requested a room change because of it. They were very kind and helpful, accepting our request immediately and providing an upgraded room to a higher level with a better view as well. Once we made it into the new room, there was no foul odor and the room was in great condition. We were very pleased with the guest services in this instance. We had no other issues while we stayed here and would definitely stay again. It was a great central location to all points of Manhattan, allowing us to maximize our time there. Would definitely recommend.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Hotel was fantastic!! The location was absolutely perfect!! Close to everything! The room was larger than expected which was a very nice surprise! Cleanliness was on point! Will be staying here again for sure!! Staff were great as well!!

title: The Amazing Hyatt Centric NYC
text: Awesome, Caring, and Compassionate staff.  The Hyatt Centric NYC has awesome amenities and spectacular views of the city and overall is a welcoming place.  A place for business, family, or leisure.  A beautiful gym and rooftop bar to enjoy are also on site and is just as great as everything else.

title: The Place to Be
text: Perfect location, super clean, beautiful, in very good condition. I would recommend this place to everyone who wants to visit Manhattan. We know the city very well and were able to do everything by walk. Broadway shows are a few blocks away, Times square, Museums, Grand Central....

title: Fantastic Staff = Fantastic Stay
text:
I stayed here for 4 nights during Halloween weekend (Thursday thru Monday) for a solo getaway and it was next to perfect. Everyone I encountered at the hotel was friendly, helpful, and went out of their way to be accommodating. I was emailed by Jorge prior to my arrival to ask if there was anyway they could make my stay more enjoyable, which was unexpected but greatly appreciated! I was provided an upgrade to a city view king room on the 25th floor, which was better than I expected for the room I initially booked! Checking in was an easy process, and DeeDee at the front desk was so welcoming and was able to check me in immediately, even though I arrived much earlier than the typical check-in time. 
The room itself was very comfortable and tastefully decorated. Bathroom looked sleek and the rainfall showerhead was great to experience after a long flight.
The location is right off Times Square, which is perfect if you are visiting to watch shows or sightsee in the area. Really convenient to be able to easily retreat to the room when you need to. There's a Starbucks right across the street, and several restaurants within walking distance.
There were a few very minor issues; the bed pillows were a little flat, so I had to stack three to have a comfortable resting height for my head. Upon check-in I noticed a wet stain on the desk, but housekeeping had cleaned it up by the following day. Connecting to the TV's chromecast was somewhat tricky, so I barely used it. Otherwise, the room was a much needed quiet oasis where I could feel completely relaxed. 
The tiny issues aside, what really made the stay great was the staff. Everyone made me feel like a valued guest. Item requests like a bathrobe, slippers, laundry bags and toothpaste were provided to the room promptly free of charge, and the doormen and security would always greet me when I returned. On the last day of my trip before check-out, I asked if I would be able to visit the rooftop to take in the view, which they allowed. Shaun accompanied me to the rooftop and, after I took pictures and videos, he asked about my trip and we had a nice chat. It was a great, memorable way to end my vacation. 
The people who work at the Hyatt Centric Times Square really made this a special trip; just for this reason alone I'd wholeheartedly recommend staying here.

title: Excellent stay and staff tries very hard to meet all my requests
text: Excellent location for public transportation services. We paid extra for a nicer room but the views of Time Square were on the other side. The staff did make sure we got as high and nice a view as we could and even offered to move to to the highest level they could facing Times Square. They really went out of their way to make us comfortable.

title: Very nice
text: Everything was perfect. My family and I visited on Halloween weekend and All staffs are friendly and willing to help everything we’ve asked. Room is really clean and all the amenities are well managed

title: Great First Time Visit to NYC Time Square
text: Hyatt Centric Times Square is an excellent choice due to its proximity to Times Square and walking distance to the theatres.  The hotel has a small lobby which makes entering and leaving the building very easy.  The rooms are very comfortable and spacious and bed and bedding makes sleeping so easy.  Be sure to visit Connollly's Pub and Restaurant located next to the the Hyatt Centric.

title: Perfect Anniversary!
text: The customer service at this hotel is top notch! The hotel and rooms are clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and I can’t wait to stay here again. Great location. 1 minute walk to plays.

title: Best Hotel Experience
text: We had an awesome 5 night stay at the Hyatt Centric NYC.  Absolutely outstanding hotel.  Great, friendly, helpful staff.  Super comfortable, modern, beautiful room with great beds.  Our housekeeper, Jennifer, was SO nice and helpful.  Great lady.  The location here is perfect to get to Times Square, Starbuck’s, Chik-fil-a, Whole Foods, Bryant Park, etc.  we were able to walk to the Met, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, Central Park, Madison Square Garden and tons of shopping/restaurants.  This has moved to the top of our list of hotels and we look forward to staying here on our next visit.  OUTSTANDING HOTEL.

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square.
text: Third visit. Came to see family and a play. Service was great especially as our ac unit was broken. Maintenance came very quickly and fixed the issue on the spot. Good vibe and nice to see that Broadway and the City are on the way back.

title: great and economical hotel in the middle of times square
text: I enjoyed the location, the cleanliness, the great service by the staff and the economics of staying at this hotel. right in the middle of Times Square, fair pricing, and clean rooms, well designed and appointed, Loved my experience.

title: Perfect place in the heart of Manhattan
text:
Ein wirklich sehr schönes Hotel im Herzen von Manhattan nur 2 Minuten vom Time Square entfernt. 
Sehr freundliche und zuvorkommende Mitarbeiter im gesamten Haus. Die Zimmer sind geräumig mit sehr ansprechendem Design zum Wohlfühlen.

title: Excellent location
text: Good service , excellent location . Can’t go wrong with Hyatt . Comfortable beds and beautiful city view. We got the 34th floor view. We had a partial time square view. It’s 1 min walk to time square.

title: Estadia espectacular
text: El hotel sumamente limpio y comodo. La atencion de Luis fue excepcional y la localizacion no tiene precio. Nos sentiamos sumamente seguras y el lugar era tan cerca de todo que nos encanto. Lo repetire en cada visita a NYC

title: DataFest 2021
text: Spent the week traveling around the area for customer business meetings. Facility was exceptionally clean and the staff very attentive.  Security was proactive and attentive to any potential issue.  Always a warm welcome to start the day or when arriving at the end of the day.

title: Great Weekend Getaway
text: This was my first time staying at this hotel and I was impressed. The front desk staff was professional and pleasant. I was also allowed to check-in early. I had a king room on a high floor. The room was clean and modern with a great view. The location was great, within a short walk to everything Times Square has to offer. The cleanliness, location and professionalism at this hotel makes it a hotel that I would stay at again.

title: Great place to stay in Times Square
text: First time at hotel snd was extremely impressed. Felt extremely safe during Covid as all employees wore masks , checked for Vaccination Cards and had all necessary social distancing in place. Rooms were very clean, new and roomy. Bed was very comfortable. Within easy walking distance to Times Square, Broadway and many restaurants  and bars. Will be back often.

title: Great stay
text:
Just stayed 2 nights for family vacation to NYC with 2 teenagers.
We chose this location because it was close to everywhere. 
Location was great, service (especially front desk and bell) was SO helpful.
Initially I booked King Suite with sofa bed (which shows on photo), but turns out
sofa bed is not really a sofa bed, hard fake-leather couch. 

So front desk lady told me we'd better be with Deluxe 2 Queen, so we switched the room.  Room is unusually large for Manhattan, very comfortable 2 queen bed, spacious bathroom with bathtub/shower separate booth, plenty of counter space to spread our toiletries. 
 
Security was very good, doorman would not let any other people in unless they'll show proof of vaccine. I always felt safe staying at this hotel.

Cons: 
1. hope was room rates. I ended up paying $1100 for 2 nights for modest hotel in Times Square. Great service, spacious room but I wish price would be lower. 
2. I am Hyatt member, wish there's apps key access to get to the room, which would be easiest. 
3. Room has wear and tear. Hallway carpet is nice, wish room carpet was redone. Some outlet didn't work (USB outlet)

title: Super close to Time Square
text: If you want to be close to Time Square and yet want some quietness then this hotel is for you. It's basically down the block from the craziness. The hotel staffs are super nice and attentive. They will hold on your luggages until your room is ready. The hotel room is a good sized. Complimentary water bottles and coffee. They didn't have toothbrush and toothpaste for us, but we asked and they provided. The internet is good. There is a roof deck with indoor and outdoor tables and seating. You need to provide a covid vaccines cards and ID. I would recommended folks staying here.

title: Times Square View
text:
Stayed in corner room with great view to times square 
room was clean, hotel location is one minute walk to times square and surrounded with many different restaurants and cafes, 15min walk to Central Park

title: Amazing hotel with amazing views.
text: Staff was very friendly. Great location to all the busy spots. The room was spotless for a NYC had plenty of space. Breakfast was delicious with multiple options. Decently priced. Would definitely stay again.

title: Shockingly Disappointed
text:
Since resuming travel after the worst of the pandemic, I have received excellent service at Hyatts in New Orleans, Honolulu and elsewhere. This stay in NY was the worst. 

Front desk staff had to escort me to my room because I was on the 53rd floor and it was more than likely that my room lock would be faulty. Not once did a staff member offer anything more than "Yeah, many guests are experiencing this. We're having issues." Breathtaking. The stay was diminished by this hassle and inconvenience (as well as doormen not wearing masks and being quite aggressive about me showing my room key upon entry), yet not once did the staff offer anything to make up for it.

Lastly, it was only after I was unable to enter the gym with my key that the front desk told me that I needed to show proof of vaccination. I wasn't informed of this at check-in, though I was ready to show proof. 

Do better, much, much better.

title: Great Service and room!
text: The staff was great and helpful. The rooms were modern, extremely clean and a good size for the location it's in. The location is perfect for doing everything in Times Square and Broadway shows. We would go there again for sure!

title: 40th Birthday Celebration!
text: Checked in and my friend and I received complimentary champagne for my birthday. The corner room with a gorgeous view of Times Square was breath-taking. Spacious rooms, comfy beds, and heated bathroom tiles. I could easily stay there for longer!

title: We had a great time at Hyatt centric New York
text: We had a great stay at Hyatt centric Edwin and Michele  provided us outstanding guests service.Edwin was very nice and professional.room had a great view we were satay Hilton, Marriott marquis and Hyatt centric  during our vacation so far Hyatt centric is our favorite 🤩

title: Wonderful
text: Staff was great. Room was clean. Valet guys were amazing! Will come again. This is the only hotel I will stay at in NYC. Close to Times Square. Overall a great experience. Can’t wait to go again. Hopefully this year

title: SD
text: Very satisfies with the the friendly & attentive staffs and modern facilities. Valet parking was convenient and the staafs were very helpful. Room size was too compact for 2 people staying over 4 nights. Bathroom size was too small.

title: Great Location
text:
This was the first time my wife and I stayed at a Hyatt Centric and after our experience we would definitely stay at this hotel again and also at another Hyatt Centric. We stayed at this Hyatt Centric because we wanted to be close to the 7 subway line to attend the US Open. Here are our comments:

Arrival: We arrived at the hotel at about 3:30 pm on a Friday after taking a Lyft from LaGuardia airport. The Lyft was about $70.00 to the hotel and it took about 20 minutes.  When we arrived at the hotel a very nice bell person asked if we needed assistance, we declined since we did not have too much luggage. We entered the lobby and went to the front desk. The lobby is small compared to other lobbies. But like the rest of the hotel, it does it job. 

Checking In:  Check in was quick because we were the only ones checking in. The person helping us was great, she explained the wifi access and also informed us to always show our room card key to the security stationed right near the elevator. We asked we declined the housekeeping service. We did not receive any additional points for declining the service. We was assigned a room on the 37th floor. I did not receive any notification or special perks due to being a Discoverist member, but maybe if I was a higher status it would be different.

Room: Part of the reason we chose to stay at the Hyatt Centric was due to the comments that the room is a little bigger than other New York hotels. Yes, I do have to agree that the room is bigger than the ones we stayed before. For the two of us, plus three suitcases the size was sufficient. The pictures on the website was accurate, there was a desk next to the television, and also a mini refrigerator. A chair with a floor ramp was next to the window, and the bathroom was a nice size. The door to the closet looks like the door to the next room, I guess other guest get this confused because when I called the front desk the person said other guests get this confused. There is an AC/heater control which worked well. Sometimes too well, because it got really cold and when turned off it got hot again. Since our room was facing part of Times Square, there was a light from one of the advertisements that kept shining a little into our room. It was okay for us, but for others you might have to close the drapes.

Hotel Amenities:  There is a bar on the top floor, we did not see it. It seemed that it is a popular bar, especially on the weekend nights because when we arrived from the tennis matches, there was always a group trying to go up to the bar. The security did a great job holding the group back and allowing us to go up to our room by showing our room card key. I did not see a restaurant or gym facility. I did notice on the morning we were leaving the hotel that behind the front desk there is supposed to be a Concierge. Instead there are travel brochures and maps which might have been helpful to see this when we first go there.

Location: As others have said, the hotel is about a 1 minute walk to Times Square. The hotel is located on the same block as the closed Planet Hollywood. There is a Walgreens and a Starbucks right across the street. To get to the Times Square subway station, which various subway lines go to, it is about a 5-10 minute walk. If you walk the opposite direction away from Times Square, the shops on 5th avenue is about a 5-10 minute walk. Since you are near Times Square, Broadway theatres, there are a number of restaurants and stores nearby. Times Square can be a little intimidating to some people with the crowds (it is getting to be a little more crowded), the street performers, and some of the homeless people. However no one bothers you if you just keep to yourself. If you look interested in them they will approach you. 

Housekeeping: Even though we declined housekeeping, when we saw the housekeeper she always made sure we did not need cleaning or if we needed extra towels or the complimentary water or coffee pods. She was very pleasant.

Checking out: Since we left the hotel at about 4:00 am, there were no one so checking out was very quick. We did use the luggage carts that was available. 

Overall, we did not encounter any major problems with the hotel. The staff was great, very helpful, and very responsive. The location is great, especially if you want to spend time near Times Square and want to see a Broadway show. Since New York has a ton of hotels, I think to decide where you want to stay will be determined in what area you want to be. For us, if we were to attend the US Open again, we might stay in the Queens/Flushing area. However in this case we had no regrets staying at the Hyatt Centric and hopefully you also don't have any problems.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: It’s worth the money. We had the balcony room 2703. It was very nice and spacious, only complaint was that the room temperature was hard to get comfortable. One degree difference was either too hot or freezing, so we were a little chilly, but other than that I would recommended it. It’s a few steps away from Times Square but it wasn’t loud and blackout curtains block out all the city lights at night.

title: 1 min walk from time square
text: I really enjoyed my stay here. The hotel was very clean, the room was spacious considering New York and the staff was very welcoming and helpful.   The location was also excellent you can walk to Times Square in leas than a minute.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, One of the newer hotels
text: Modern hotel, large rooms, just a 1/2 block off Times Square. Quite & clean rooms, staff was great. I would stay again. The roof top bar has great views but you need to make reservations. Connolly's Pub, just a few doors away, has a nice quaint roof top area too (no views).

title: Mirza
text: Love the place. room was clean and friendly front desk , Yes will not hesitate to go this hotel again, veer good location everything with in walking distance. Rooms are little small but its okay compare to others

title: NYC Staycation
text:
Overall I would give this place an 8.5/10. Every staff member I encountered was incredibly nice and welcoming. It wasn't great weather for my stay so I didn't but you could definitely walk to Times Square from there. Anything you needed outside of the hotel was within walking distance. Whenever I asked for something it was brought up in 30 minutes or less. My biggest issues were the following: the business center was advertised as open and it wasn't (not a big deal for me)
it said room service was available for breakfast and dinner and then when I checked in it said just breakfast (I was planning to mostly eat out anyways so again not a big deal)
a few of the outlets weren't working in my room (I just took turns charging my devices)
they have microwaves available but there is no rule to make people return them in a timely manner. I was told that they ask guests to return them as soon as they're done but they hardly ever do that. With the amount of leftovers I had it would've been nice to maybe know that ahead of time.
All in all I would 100% return there again.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: Close to Times Square and Broadway. We walked to the St. James Theatre. Beautiful and clean room. Loved the bathroom and view from the 47th floor. Comfortable bed and quiet room. The only thing missing was in room coffee but no worries there is a Starbucks across the street

title: Excellent property & location!
