text: Was concerned that the hotel might be noisy, due to its proximity to Time Square, however it was great!  Walking distance to many restaurants & bars and Metro station.  Perfect spot for a few days in the city!

title: Top value for a luxury stay
text:
For the price, excellent rooms and a luxury stay.
Customer service is excellent. Rooms are cleaned everyday.
Location is excellent if you want to stay around Times Square, mainly recommended for tourists.

title: Great Short Stay
text: I took a short impromptu trip to NYC to visit friends and family and overall, I had a great stay. Check in and cleaning staff were very cordial and efficient. I can't say the same for my experience at BAR54 (the rooftop bar). The ambience was great  (9/10), drinks were okay (7/10) and view was nice but the waitstaff wasn't welcoming or friendly in the least bit. The hotel is located right in time square and was convenient in visiting the highline and other restaurants in lower manhattan.

title: NYC 2021
text: The hotel is in a perfect location, and I happened to get a room with an amazing view of Times Square! The rooms were comfortable and clean, and the staff is very attentive. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

title: What a great experience.
text: The people were wonderful and the room was very clean and comfortable.  I would recommend this hotel and of course there is a great rooftop bar.  Location is in a perfect spot to enjoy Times Square and also a quick walk to everything else.

title: Great location.
text: Bed very uncomfortable and the pillows. Woke up with neck pain. Beware of being charged for watching any movies without being asked if charge is accepted. My husband and I stayed over the weekend for his Birthday and the movie we watched was old timer but ended up being charged $19.99 on final bill, but there was nothing that was asked go confirm on the charge on TV, so that was odd. Aside from those 2 things, room was completely remodeled, executive sweet on the 5th floor, outstanding room service and the location is amazing. 10 steps and you’re at Times Square. Would stay here again if the bed and pillows were as new as the room itself.

title: Great hotel close to Time Square
text: Clean and friendly hotel, front desk was exceptional, view from the 46th floor was superb. Bathroom has shower and tub, very clean room, love the lighting inside the room. Security inside the hotel was friendly as well. Would definitely go back.

title: Clean, comfortable and stylish
text: Staff were courteous, the building is new and clean. The room was spacious with a wonderful view of Bryant Park and Times Square. The staff even upgraded us to a bigger room when they saw we were Hyatt World members. Great stay!

title: Great Last Minute Hotel
text: We booked this hotel last minute due to a disaster at another hotel.  This hotel is a hidden gem in a perfect location.   This will be my go to hotel moving forward.  Clean rooms.  As advertised.   Quiet!  Well, as quiet as it can be in Times Square.

title: Great location in Times Square
text:
This hotel is on a good location.  Walking distance to all sorts of restaurants and landmarks.  

My favorite part of this hotel is the rooftop bar.  We were there a couple of times during our stay.  The bartenders and the waiters are so friendly and accomodating.

title: Great place to stay
text: I’ve stayed at the Hyatt prior to Covid, this hotel has done it right and it’s a good space for everybody. The view from the rooftop bar is exquisite. It’s definitely an oasis in a very busy city, don’t miss it.

title: Best Staff Around!
text: The hotel is great - centrally located within walking distance to a lot of great shops/restaurants/museums. The staff is outstanding and truly go above and beyond to welcome and accommodate your every need. By the end of our 3 day stay, we felt like we were saying goodbye to dear old friends.

title: Best experience ever
text: I did a lot of research and I was disappointed. Anything you need they are there for you. The rooms was beautiful, the shower was amazing, the door men are your go to for best food if you need a ride or just need directions. Omg we was room 5003 view was amazing the best ever get that room! I never been on an elevator that was so fast that was a plus!

title: Not happy with service
text: Poor attitude of the concierge, even after staying for 8 nights they could only offer late checkout for 90minutes that was very inconsiderate, not enough water bottle were available in the room per they they only offer 2 500ml bottles

title: Wonderful Stay in the heart of NYC - Times Square
text: Just had a wonderful weekend at Hyatt Centric Times Square. The staff were so kind to my Mom and I during our stay from the time that we departed from our cab until the time that we entered our cab to go to the train station. I celebrated my birthday over the weekend and the staff truly made me feel special. I was upgraded to the King size bed on the 53rd floor - the highest room in the hotel. I received a small whisky bottle as a birthday gift and several staff wished me a happy birthday, which was unprompted. The room was wonderful. The view was spectacular.  It was light and airy. The bed was very comfortable.  The bathroom was wonderful with a rainfall shower. All staff were friendly and helpful throughout the stay. I would like to single out a few staff members for their great service. Sean seemed to be happy working at the hotel - always with a smile on his face. He helped immensely during our arrival, by helping my mom, who is infirm, to get out of the cab and helped bring in our bags inside the hotel. Luis also helped immensely with our transportation needs i.e.,. hailing a cab on the day of departure. I can’t say enough good things about this stay. I  look forward going back to Hyatt Centric - Times Square the next time that I visit NYC.

title: Gimmick
text: They over charge and add on random high fees even after you’ve paid the full balance for the room! Three breakfast sandwiches cost $95. No convenient parking.. the list goes on! I’ve stayed at better hotels for lower prices! It’s just a tourist trap!

title: One of the best!
text: Hyatt is always very professional and very friendly. This hotel did not disappoint. The staff was very professional and exceptionally friendly. They greeted me every time I entered and exited the building. They met all of my needs. They even went out of the way to make the room extra special.

title: Great experience
text: Location was fabulous. The bar on the 54th floor has amazing views (make a reservation). The staff was friendly and welcoming. Used it as a home-base for shopping, and exploring. Great location if you enjoy running in the morning. I jogged up the blocks to Central Park and got on a popular running loop/road.

title: You definitely need to visit this hotel
text: Of course the customer service was excellent. From Luis greeting me,Yenny and Dee Dee thank you very much.  Need to write names next time. We Emergency night nurses know we can always do with a good sleep. My colleagues,  the best sleep came immediately as my head touched the pillow. The hotel offers quietness and privacy while as you step outside, there a world of activities in Times Square. Don't miss out!

title: Great hotel, but money was stolen from room.
text: The hotel and front desk employees were wonderful, but I had money stolen from my room and no one even contacted me to discuss. I didn't expect any sort of refund because I never should have left it there, but I would expect a call back to figure out what happened so it wouldn't happen to future guests.

title: Location Location Location!
text:
Best Location!!!
This Hyatt was conveniently located and walking distance to practically every site we wanted to visit which included the obvious Times Square, 20 minutes to Central Park, 15 minutes to Rockefeller Center. We even walked to the Hudson River. The rooms were clean and modern. Wonderful city view to soak in the vive.

title: Excellent time
text: Nice place. Good location near Times Square and everything.  Walking distance to shopping, dining, and entertainment.  Beautiful rooftop Bar area ( Bar 54 ).  20 minutes from La Guardia Airport. Recommended.

title: Nice wrapping empty package
text: When I spend my money, customer service is a big deal to me.  I requested a lower floor when I booked my reservation.  When I arrived at the hotel, I was advised that the lower floors were unavailable.  That info would have been helpful prior to my arrival.

title: Friendly staff
text: The staff at this property went out of their way to be friendly and helpful.  Pre-check in communications were excellent.  Any questions or requests we had were handled immediately and efficiently.  The beds were comfortable and the room spacious and clean.  Great location close to subway.  The only issue I had was loud music from a nightclub across the street, but it was Saturday night and it did not last long.

title: Wonderful
text:
Great location, spacious clean rooms very nice staff. Definitely will visit again at this location.
The staff was very helpful and friendly. Rooms were very clean. Located right in Times Square definitely recommend

title: Good hotel
text:
The room and bathroom were very nice and clean. This hotel was also very close to the Times Square and quiet.
One thing that I was not satisfied with was that one of the employees who were greeting guests in the lobby made a racist "joke." I hope they do not judge their guests' nationality just by looking.

title: Very good option close to Times Square.
text: Unfortunately the restaurant was not open, but other than that, the stay was fine.  The front desk was very helpful and responsive and housekeeping was timely.  Free bottled water was a nice touch.  Good location just a few steps away from Times Square.  There were a few restaurant options very close as well as a pharmacy.

title: Great Location in NYC
text: If you're traveling without kids, this hotel is perfect! It's within walking distance to great restaurants and attractions. It overlooks Time Square without hearing the noise from the crowds of people.

title: Fun Times In NYC
text: Great Location near Time Square. Hotel was very Clean, Staff was very helpful. I would recommend this location to any one visiting NYC and want to e near all the action of Time Square. The Roof  top Bar is nice a little Pricey.

title: Hidden Treasure
text:
Good: Loved how small and intimate this hotel feels in the middle of the city. The service was great with every request addressed promptly. Love that they have hepa filters and everything was clean. LOVED the view from the roof top bar.
Bad: Too close to Time Square... but hey... not far from Central Park and Moma, so all good.
Ugly: Nothing

Would definitely stay here again!

title: Hyatt Centric Times Square
text: Room was a mess when we got there but we were moved to a nicer room and everything was good after that. Everyone was very nice and concerned about our experience. The bar was nice and we were offered free drinks for the inconvenience

title: Stylish Hotel but........
text: Great location and slick decor but Suite not suitable for more than 2 people. I stayed in one of the Executive Suites with my husband and 14 year old daughter. She was supposed to sleep on the queen sofa bed but it was horrible. She opted to sleep on the sofa instead. I do not recommend anyone rent a suite with expectations of comfort for more than a couple.

title: Mejor Hotel 4 Estrellas de Manhattan
text: Es la mejor relación precio-beneficio para un hotel de su segmento. En términos de diseño, limpieza, decoración, confort y amabilidad del personal, no hay una mejor opción, y sumado a la ubicación estratégica y un precio razonable, hace que uno viaje absolutamente tranquilo de encontrarse con la mejor elección, que tomaría incluso si tuviera el tiempo de examinar en el lugar, una a una, las diferentes opciones para su estadía.

title: Fantastic place!  Beautiful city!
text: The best trip I’ve ever been on with my sweetheart!The music the food was fantastic.We stayed at the Hyatt right on Bourbon Street! Love the city!! A very romantic getaway! Well recommend the Hyatt!!!

title: Worth
text:
We were the first guests at the Hyatt Centric times Square NYC. The hotel is beautiful. Great views. DeDe, Yenny, Tim (manager), Luis, the valet and others,  thank you for your great customer service. We had a great time. 
Bar 54....Wow!  The Centric experience is worth the rate... you'll see!

title: Don’t waste your time!
text: I booked this hotel in advance for a special birthday trip. ONE WEEK upon my arrival and they cancel my reservation! No explanation, no inconvenience credit or nothing! I was FORCED to find another hotel that was twice more expensive all because of the close check-in date! Had they alerted me in advance, I could have saved time and money. What is the point of being a member?

title: Not the Greatest Experience
text:
Ahhh...where do I start. 

1).  Day 1 AC doesn't work. We are forced into two separate rooms after midnight and attempts for them to fix the unit. They did comp our room so for that there is some grace and thank you. 

2).  Day 2 alarm goes off in our room and it takes 15 minutes to turn it off while our eardrums are busting. 

3).  Also, the gym which I see online (see attached picture) and why I CHOSE this hotel is not open. Lies all lies...false advertising for sure! Why? Probably their fear of that flu like thing called Covid. Strangers are laying all over the couches but God forbid we who are staying at the hotel workout, right? I had to pay $75 for the gym down the street. 

4).  Top it off with BOTH bathrooms downstairs being out of commission and gnats all over the place because of full garbage cans with sweet Starbucks drinks...ahhh..feeling so special here LOL! 

5).  I tried to vent to Hyatt on Facebook...and they deleted my post!  Now I am posting here and Google as a result!

title: Irresponsible and dishonest hotel! Please avoid!
text:
I never write negative feedback unless there is necessary. For those who are browsing and deciding, please avoid this irresponsible and dishonest hotel!
I book a reservation for a long term stay long time ago and close to the arrival, the hotel sent out an email to cancel my reservation without any other option. Who can find another hotel within last minute? The neighboring hotels have raised their prices already, letting alone this hotel accept my suite upgrade awards, yes, I am a globalist with hyatt( the tier that requires to stay 60+ annually to reach). How could they treat their customers so? Last minute cancelation without any accommodations? Good job! Please please please, stay away from this miserable, irresponsible, dishonest hotel if you have a choice!
Would definitely give a zero if I could!

title: Modern
text: This hotel is located about a ten minute walk from Times Square. The room is very modern, comfy and clean. The mattress is soft and luxurious. The only con is that the hotel room is very tiny and feels a bit claustrophobic.

title: Steps from Time Square
text:
Amazing location in the heart of Time Square! Hyatt Centric is located literally steps from Time Square. We enjoyed being able to walk outside of the hotel to the bright city lights at night. Get some comfortable shoes on because you'll be walking 10 miles a day! We loved being able to walk to all the attractions from our hotel. The subway was a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Central Park, Rockefeller, Radio City Music Hall, Penn Station, Grand Central Station, and most theaters, were all ~15 minute walks from the hotel.

We stayed on the 15th floor, and didn't have any issues with noise. The gym was spacious, had plenty of cardio machines and weights. The hotel also has the tallest rooftop bar in NYC on the 54th floor, as well as a restaurant in the lobby. We didn't have time to check out either, because there were too many places we already planned on going to/eat at.

Front desk staff were friendly and courteous. I want to thank Dede for her hospitality and excellent service. She was very accommodating, checked us in at 7am after our red eye from SF, which allowed us to rest for a few hours before exploring the city.

Loved everything about this hotel and will stay here again next time we're in NY!

title: Muy bien
text:
Muy bien en general.
El personal muy amable desde el principio. En seguida vino una chica que hablaba español y pudimos preguntarle todas las dudas. 
Está bastante limpio y la ubicación es buena. (Boca de metro a dos minutos)
El desayuno muy bueno y variado ( el café malísimo como es habitual en NY) y el ambiente bastante tranquilo.
En general estuvimos muy bien y muy Agusto.

title: Great location
text: First time at a Hyatt Centric.  Great rooms that are spacious for a downtown hotel.  Modern amenities, quiet, and clean.  Hotel security at access to elevators made you feel safe.  Convenient location to Times Square, Rockefeller, Grand Central, and more.

title: Τιμή και ποιότητα όπως ακριβώς πρεπει.
text: Ταξίδεψα μόνος τον Φεβρουάριο για επαγγελματικό σκοπό στην νέα Υόρκη, το ξενοδοχείο είναι ότι καλύτερο έχω επισκευθει με αναλογίες ποιότητας τιμής. Με τιμή κοντά στα 100 δολάρια βρίσκεις εξαίρετη θέση κοντά σε κάθε τι, πολύ τίμιο πρωινό, τρομερά άνετο δωμάτιο με σωστη καθαριότητα. Το προσωπικό εξαίρετα φιλικό και εξυπηρετικό. Μια πραγματικά πολύ καλή λύση για το Μανχάταν.

title: Notre second séjour : toujours aussi bien !
text:
Hôtel extrêmement bien placé à 2 mn de Times Square, 5 mn du métro.
Personnel très professionnel . Le personnel de sécurité est performant.
La chambre que nous avions choisi était très spacieuse et à un étage très élevé. 
Très propre ! Nous étions ravis car l'hôtel nous a attribué la même chambre que nous avions eu la première fois.
Le seul point négatif : Petit déjeuner trop cher

title: Localizacao!! Custo beneficio e belos quartos!
text:
A unica coisa ruim desse hotel é o lobby muito pequeno para encontros quando a familias em quartos diferentes ( nao da pra sentar)
O quarto tem uma decoracao bonita e jovial..mas ao mesmo tempo clean..muito bonito. Espacoso ( por volta de 30m) e funcional. Banheiro muito amplo e tb bonito
Otimo atendimento de forma geral.
E a localizacao é simplesmente excelente...literalmente 40seg caminhando.
fiquei em 2015
Voltaria

title: Location, location, location
text:
A great hotel, just off Times Square. Great view from our floor to ceiling windows. Very modern, and great size rooms, especially for New York. Only downside was that the children were not permitted in the bar area. The view from the bar is fantasticwitj a clear view to the Chrysler building. You can also see the hotel quite clearly from the Top of The Rock!
The housekeeping staff were great too.

title: great location; great staff
text:
I stay at a lot of Hyatts (Im a globalist) and I think the Hyatt Place on 39/9 is idea. It is close to everything a tourist likes but is a few blocks away from the craziness of Times Square, giving you lots of dining options in Hell's Kitchen. 

The staff is so attentive and wonderful. I had a few requests while there and they attended to each of them. Its a brand new property so the rooms and clean and fresh. Highly recommend.

title: First Hyatt Centric visit
text: This was our first time at a Hyatt Centric brand hotel and our expectations were certainly surpassed. Excellent front-desk staff (points for keeping the lobby dry on rainy days). Rooms are above average in size for the area and clean with modern features. Bonus points for the rooftop bar. Could use some additional snack options though there is a Starbucks right across the street and, of course, plenty just around the corner in Times Square.

title: All the Bells and Whisles
text: We had a great reception when we arrived.  Not only friendly and courteous but our room was upgraded at no extra charge.  On the 39th floor we had an excellent view of NYC.  The bathroom floor was heated, a welcomed surprise during the colder months.  The Rooftop Bar on the 54th floor was a great space to relax and again have great views of the city.   We will use this hotel again.  We travel at least once a year to the city.

title: Great hotel for exploring the city
text: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric for 7 nights and the it met every one of our needs as a couple exploring the city, for a very reasonable price!! The location was great, with Times Square just a stone's throw away and plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. We had a king size room on the 19th floor, which was very spacious, lovely bathroom and shower. The staff were very accommodating, with our room being made every day, fresh towels, and coffee and water bottles being topped up daily. The roof top bar had amazing views, but rather expensive... Would definitely recommend!

title: Lovely
text: Our visit to NYC was lovely. The Hyatt Centric Times Square was fabulous! The shower was AMAZING. The location was perfect. The staff was very attentive to all needs/requests. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Ideal location for a first timer to NYC
text:
We stayed here for four nights. Due to the pandemic NYC was very quiet so we were offered the chance to upgrade the room for $25 per night, we declined this as didn’t intend on being in the room that much. The room we had, on 20th floor, was really nice. Could see some of time square lights, plenty of room (By NYC standards) and a big bathroom. The hotel is yards from time square, an ideal location if you are a first timer to New York. I felt the pricing was a little inconsistent, when we asked before we arrived about cars to and from the airport we were quoted $120 (ish) each way, however, when we asked at the hotel it was $75 set fee. We opted for this as it was only $5 more than the total price of a set fee yellow cab. When we asked to keep the room on it was $50 per hour, which seemed excessive considering NYC was in an emergency situation and travel was prohibited from a lot of countries so rooms were available and an upgrade was only $25.

Staff were helpful when needed. It’s clean and tidy but for some reason we both got electric shocks off of everything we touched. We ended up touching everything through clothes, which I suppose wasn’t bad thing considering the circumstances. Would stay here again.

title: Most Accommodating Hotel Ever
text: My grandaughter left her Apple Air Pods.  They secured them for us.  We had to leave unexpectedly and they were extremely understanding.  The roof top bar is outstanding but not pretentious.  The ground floor level  bar/restaurant was very nice as well.  Everyone was helpful and courteous .

title: birthday trip
text: the hyatt centric and lotis soriano went above and beyond to make my daugher's birthday memorable .  they had the room decorated with balloons, birthday banner and a birthday gift when we arrived.   my daughter was so surprised when we walked into our room.  thanks again !!

title: Hospitality at its best
text: The Hyatt Centric came as a huge surprise. This was my first experience at a Hyatt property in the US and my only previous frames of reference in terms of US hotels were Marriott and Hilton properties. This was a long 16-day trip and I was more than a little concerned about being comfortable. I was so cautious that I had my office split the booking so that I could check out if I was not happy. This hotel blew me away. The room and bathroom were great and everything worked the way it should. The decor and color schemes made everything seem airy and light. But the X Factor was the service. I have never experienced this level of warmth and friendliness outside of Taj, ITC and Shangri La properties in Asia. The staff were efficient, proactive, warm and friendly and they anticipated my needs. The GM of this hotel deserves to be commended for putting together and leading such a great crew. From Dyana and Michael at the reception; to Mickey at the bar; to Veronica in housekeeping to Jason, Walter and Luis, the doormen...HUGE shout out! What else can I say except that I will be back.
